Text

THE TURN OF THE SCREW

The story had held [us]50-we , round the fire , sufficiently breathless , but except the obvious remark that it was gruesome , as , on Christmas Eve in [an old house]51-an old house , a strange tale should essentially be , [I]0-i remember no comment uttered till [somebody]52-somebody happened to say that it was the only case [he]52-somebody had met in which such a visitation had fallen on [a child]53-a child . The case , [I]0-i may mention , was that of an apparition in just such [an old house]51-an old house as had gathered [us]50-we for the occasion — an appearance , of a dreadful kind , to [a little boy]55-a little boy sleeping in [the room]56-the room with [[his]55-a little boy mother]57-his mother and waking [her]57-his mother up in the terror of it ; waking [her]57-his mother not to dissipate [his]55-a little boy dread and soothe [him]55-a little boy to sleep again , but to encounter also , [herself]57-his mother , before [she]57-his mother had succeeded in doing so , the same sight that had shaken [him]55-a little boy . It was this observation that drew from [Douglas]10-douglas — not immediately , but later in the evening — a reply that had the interesting consequence to which [I]0-i call attention . [Someone else]58-someone else told a story not particularly effective , which [I]0-i saw [he]10-douglas was not following . This [I]0-i took for a sign that [he]10-douglas had [himself]10-douglas something to produce and that [we]50-we should only have to wait . [We]50-we waited in fact till two nights later ; but that same evening , before [we]50-we scattered , [he]10-douglas brought out what was in [his]10-douglas mind .

“ [I]10-douglas quite agree — in regard to [Griffin]11-griffin ’s ghost , or whatever it was — that its appearing first to [the little boy]1012-the little boy , at so tender an age , adds a particular touch . But it ’s not the first occurrence of [its]1013-its charming kind that [I]10-douglas know to have involved [a child]53-a child . If [the child]1015-the child gives the effect another turn of the screw , what do [you]10-douglas say to [_ two _ children]1016-_ two _ children — ? ”[10-douglas]

“ [We]50-we say , of course , ”[52-somebody] [somebody]52-somebody exclaimed , “ that [they]1016-_ two _ children give two turns ! Also that [we]50-we want to hear about [them]1016-_ two _ children . ”[52-somebody]

[I]0-i can see [Douglas]10-douglas there before the fire , to which [he]10-douglas had got up to present [his]10-douglas back , looking down at [[his]10-douglas interlocutor]60-his interlocutor with [his]10-douglas hands in [his]10-douglas pockets . “ [Nobody]1017-nobody but [me]10-douglas , till now , has ever heard . It ’s quite too horrible . ”[10-douglas] This , naturally , was declared by several voices to give the thing the utmost price , and [[our]61-us friend]62-our friend , with quiet art , prepared [his]62-our friend triumph by turning [his]62-our friend eyes over [the rest of [us]61-us]63-the rest of us and going on : “ It ’s beyond everything . Nothing at all that [I]62-our friend know touches it . ”[62-our friend]

“ For sheer terror ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i remember asking .

[He]62-our friend seemed to say it was not so simple as that ; to be really at a loss how to qualify it . [He]62-our friend passed [his]62-our friend hand over [his]62-our friend eyes , made a little wincing grimace . “ For dreadful — dreadfulness ! ”[62-our friend]

“ Oh , how delicious ! ”[64-one of the women] cried [one of [the women]65-the women]64-one of the women .

[He]62-our friend took no notice of [her]64-one of the women ; [he]62-our friend looked at [me]0-i , but as if , instead of [me]0-i , [he]62-our friend saw what [he]62-our friend spoke of . “ For general uncanny ugliness and horror and pain . ”[62-our friend]

“ Well then , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ just sit right down and begin . ”[0-i]

[He]62-our friend turned round to the fire , gave a kick to a log , watched it an instant . Then as [he]62-our friend faced [us]61-us again : “ [I]62-our friend ca n’t begin . [I]62-our friend shall have to send to [town]1018-town . ”[62-our friend] There was a unanimous groan at this , and much reproach ; after which , in [his]62-our friend preoccupied way , [he]62-our friend explained . “ The story ’s written . It ’s in a locked drawer — it has not been out for years . [I]62-our friend could write to [[my]62-our friend man]1019-my man and enclose the key ; [he]1019-my man could send down the packet as [he]1019-my man finds it . ”[62-our friend] It was to [me]0-i in particular that [he]62-our friend appeared to propound this — appeared almost to appeal for aid not to hesitate . [He]62-our friend had broken a thickness of ice , the formation of many a winter ; had had [his]62-our friend reasons for a long silence . [The others]66-the others resented postponement , but it was just [his]62-our friend scruples that charmed [me]0-i . [I]0-i adjured [him]62-our friend to write by the first post and to agree with [us]61-us for an early hearing ; then [I]0-i asked [him]62-our friend if the experience in question had been [his]62-our friend own . To this [his]62-our friend answer was prompt . “ Oh , thank [God]12-god , no ! ”[62-our friend]

“ And is the record [yours]62-our friend ? [You]62-our friend took the thing down ? ”[0-i]

“ Nothing but the impression . [I]62-our friend took that _ here_”—he[62-our friend] tapped [his]62-our friend heart . “ [I]62-our friend ’ve never lost it . ”[62-our friend]

“ Then [your]62-our friend manuscript — ? ”[0-i]

“ Is in old , faded ink , and in the most beautiful hand . ”[62-our friend] [He]62-our friend hung fire again . “ [A woman]1020-a woman ’s . [She]1020-a woman has been dead these twenty years . [She]1020-a woman sent [me]62-our friend the pages in question before [she]1020-a woman died . ”[62-our friend] [They]67-they were all listening now , and of course there was [somebody to be arch]68-somebody to be arch , or at any rate to draw the inference . But if [he]62-our friend put the inference by without a smile it was also without irritation . “ [She]1020-a woman was [a most charming person]1021-a most charming person , but [she]1020-a woman was ten years older than [I.]62-our friend [She]1020-a woman was [[my]62-our friend sister ’s governess]1022-my sister ’s governess , ”[62-our friend] [he]62-our friend quietly said . “ [She]1020-a woman was [the most agreeable woman [I]62-our friend ’ve ever known in [her]1020-a woman position]1023-the most agreeable woman i ’ve ever known in her position ; [she]1020-a woman would have been worthy of any whatever . It was long ago , and this episode was long before . [I]62-our friend was at [Trinity]1-trinity , and [I]62-our friend found [her]1020-a woman at [home]1024-home on [my]62-our friend coming down the second summer . [I]62-our friend was much [there]1025-there that year — it was a beautiful one ; and [we]1026-we had , in [her]1020-a woman off - hours , some strolls and talks in [the garden]1027-the garden — talks in which [she]1020-a woman struck [me]62-our friend as awfully clever and nice . Oh yes ; do n’t grin : [I]62-our friend liked [her]1020-a woman extremely and am glad to this day to think [she]1020-a woman liked [me]62-our friend , too . If [she]1020-a woman had n’t [she]1020-a woman would n’t have told [me]62-our friend . [She]1020-a woman had never told [anyone]1028-anyone . It was n’t simply that [she]1020-a woman said so , but that [I]62-our friend knew [she]1020-a woman had n’t . [I]62-our friend was sure ; [I]62-our friend could see . [You]0-i ’ll easily judge why when [you]0-i hear . ”[62-our friend]

“ Because the thing had been such a scare ? ”[69-i]

[He]69-i continued to fix [me]0-i . “ [You]0-i ’ll easily judge , ”[69-i] [he]69-i repeated : “ _ [you]0-i _ will . ”[69-i]

[I]0-i fixed [him]69-i , too . “ [I]0-i see . [She]1020-a woman was in love . ”[0-i]

[He]69-i laughed for the first time . “ [You]0-i _ are _ acute . Yes , [she]1020-a woman was in love . That is , [she]1020-a woman had been . That came out — [she]1020-a woman could n’t tell [her]1020-a woman story without its coming out . [I]69-i saw it , and [she]1020-a woman saw [I]69-i saw it ; but neither of [us]1029-us spoke of it . [I]69-i remember the time and [the place]1030-the place — the corner of [the lawn]1031-the lawn , the shade of the great beeches and the long , hot summer afternoon . It was n’t a scene for a shudder ; but oh — ! ”[69-i] [He]69-i quitted the fire and dropped back into [his]69-i chair .

“ [You]69-i ’ll receive the packet Thursday morning ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i inquired .

“ Probably not till the second post . ”[69-i]

“ Well then ; after dinner — ”[69-i]

“ [You]70-we ’ll all meet [me]69-i here ? ”[69-i] [He]69-i looked [us]70-we round again . “ Is n’t [anybody]1032-anybody going ? ”[69-i] It was almost the tone of hope .

“ [Everybody]1033-everybody will stay ! ”[69-i]

“ _ [I]69-i _ will”—and[69-i] “ _ [I]71-the ladies whose departure had been fixed _ will ! ”[71-the ladies whose departure had been fixed] cried [the ladies whose departure had been fixed]71-the ladies whose departure had been fixed . [Mrs. Griffin]11-griffin , however , expressed the need for a little more light . “ Who was it [she]11-griffin was in love with ? ”[11-griffin]

“ The story will tell , ”[0-i] [I]0-i took upon [myself]0-i to reply .

“ Oh , [I]69-i ca n’t wait for the story ! ”[69-i]

“ The story _ wo n’t _ tell , ”[10-douglas] said [Douglas]10-douglas ; “ not in any literal , vulgar way . ”[10-douglas]

“ More ’s the pity , then . That ’s the only way [I]69-i ever understand . ”[69-i]

“ Wo n’t _ [you]10-douglas _ tell , [Douglas]10-douglas ? ”[72-somebody else] [somebody else]72-somebody else inquired .

[He]10-douglas sprang to [his]10-douglas feet again . “ Yes — tomorrow . Now [I]10-douglas must go to bed . Good night . ”[10-douglas] And quickly catching up a candlestick , [he]10-douglas left [us]70-we slightly bewildered . From [our]70-we end of [the great brown hall]73-the great brown hall [we]70-we heard [his]10-douglas step on the stair ; whereupon [Mrs. Griffin]11-griffin spoke . “ Well , if [I]11-griffin do n’t know who [she]11-griffin was in love with , [I]11-griffin know who _ [he]10-douglas _ was . ”[11-griffin]

“ [She]11-griffin was ten years older , ”[74-her husband] said [[her]11-griffin husband]74-her husband .

“ _ Raison de plus_—at that age ! But it ’s rather nice , [his]10-douglas long reticence . ”[11-griffin]

“ Forty years ! ”[11-griffin] [Griffin]11-griffin put in .

“ With this outbreak at last . ”[11-griffin]

“ The outbreak , ”[0-i] [I]0-i returned , “ will make a tremendous occasion of Thursday night ; ”[75-everyone] and [everyone]75-everyone so agreed with [me]0-i that , in the light of it , [we]70-we lost all attention for everything else . The last story , however incomplete and like the mere opening of a serial , had been told ; [we]70-we handshook and “ candlestuck , ”[52-somebody] as [somebody]52-somebody said , and went to bed .

[I]0-i knew the next day that a letter containing the key had , by the first post , gone off to [[his]10-douglas [London]2-london apartments]77-his london apartments ; but in spite of — or perhaps just on account of — the eventual diffusion of this knowledge [we]70-we quite let [him]10-douglas alone till after dinner , till such an hour of the evening , in fact , as might best accord with the kind of emotion on which [our]70-we hopes were fixed . Then [he]10-douglas became as communicative as [we]70-we could desire and indeed gave [us]70-we [his]10-douglas best reason for being so . [We]70-we had it from [him]10-douglas again before the fire in [the hall]78-the hall , as [we]70-we had had [our]70-we mild wonders of the previous night . It appeared that the narrative [he]10-douglas had promised to read [us]70-we really required for a proper intelligence a few words of prologue . Let [me]0-i say here distinctly , to have done with it , that this narrative , from an exact transcript of [my]0-i own made much later , is what [I]0-i shall presently give . [Poor [Douglas]10-douglas]79-poor douglas , before [his]10-douglas death — when it was in sight — committed to [me]0-i the manuscript that reached [him]10-douglas on the third of these days and that , on the same spot , with immense effect , [he]10-douglas began to read to [our]70-we hushed little circle on the night of the fourth . [The departing ladies who had said [they]80-the departing ladies who had said they would stay would stay]80-the departing ladies who had said they would stay did n’t , of course , thank heaven , stay : [they]80-the departing ladies who had said they would stay departed , in consequence of arrangements made , in a rage of curiosity , as [they]80-the departing ladies who had said they would stay professed , produced by the touches with which [he]10-douglas had already worked [us]70-we up . But that only made [his]10-douglas little final auditory more compact and select , kept it , round the hearth , subject to a common thrill .

The first of these touches conveyed that the written statement took up the tale at a point after it had , in a manner , begun . The fact to be in possession of was therefore that [[his]10-douglas old friend]81-his old friend , [the youngest of [several daughters of [a poor country parson]84-a poor country parson]83-several daughters of a poor country parson]82-the youngest of several daughters of a poor country parson , had , at the age of twenty , on taking service for the first time in [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom , come up to [London]2-london , in trepidation , to answer in person an advertisement that had already placed [her]81-his old friend in brief correspondence with [the advertiser]86-the advertiser . [This person]87-this person proved , on [her]81-his old friend presenting [herself]81-his old friend , for judgment , at [a house in [Harley Street]3-harley street]88-a house in harley street , that impressed [her]81-his old friend as vast and imposing — [this prospective patron]89-this prospective patron proved [a gentleman]90-a gentleman , [a bachelor in the prime of life , such a figure as had never risen , save in a dream or an old novel]91-a bachelor in the prime of life , such a figure as had never risen , save in a dream or an old novel , before [a fluttered , anxious girl out of [a Hampshire vicarage]93-a hampshire vicarage]92-a fluttered , anxious girl out of a hampshire vicarage . [One]94-one could easily fix [his]90-a gentleman type ; it never , happily , dies out . [He]90-a gentleman was handsome and bold and pleasant , off - hand and gay and kind . [He]90-a gentleman struck [her]81-his old friend , inevitably , as gallant and splendid , but what took [her]81-his old friend most of all and gave [her]81-his old friend the courage [she]81-his old friend afterward showed was that [he]90-a gentleman put the whole thing to [her]81-his old friend as a kind of favor , an obligation [he]90-a gentleman should gratefully incur . [She]81-his old friend conceived [him]90-a gentleman as rich , but as fearfully extravagant — saw [him]90-a gentleman all in a glow of high fashion , of good looks , of expensive habits , of charming ways with [women]95-women . [He]90-a gentleman had for [[his]90-a gentleman own town]96-his own town residence [a big house filled with the spoils of travel]97-a big house filled with the spoils of travel and the trophies of the chase ; but it was to [[his]90-a gentleman country home]98-his country home , [an old family place in [Essex]4-essex]99-an old family place in essex , that [he]90-a gentleman wished [her]81-his old friend immediately to proceed .

[He]90-a gentleman had been left , by the death of [[their]100-their parents]101-their parents in [India]5-india , [guardian]102-guardian to [a small nephew]103-a small nephew and [a small niece]104-a small niece , [children of [a younger]106-a younger , [a military brother]107-a military brother , whom [he]90-a gentleman had lost two years before]105-children of a younger , a military brother , whom he had lost two years before . [He]90-a gentleman had put [them]111-the poor chicks in possession of [Bly]13-bly , which was healthy and secure , and had placed at the head of [[their]111-the poor chicks little establishment]118-their little establishment — but below stairs only — [an excellent woman]119-an excellent woman , [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , whom [he]90-a gentleman was sure [[his]90-a gentleman visitor]120-his visitor would like and who had formerly been maid to [[his]90-a gentleman mother]57-his mother . [She]14-mrs. grose was now [housekeeper]122-housekeeper and was also acting for the time as [[superintendent]123-superintendent to [the little girl]125-the little girl , of whom , without children of [her]14-mrs. grose own]124-superintendent to the little girl , of whom , without children of her own , [she]14-mrs. grose was , by good luck , extremely fond . So far had [Douglas]10-douglas presented [his]10-douglas picture when [someone]138-someone put a question . “ And what did [the former governess]1034-the former governess die of?—of so much respectability ? ”[138-someone]

[[Our]139-our friend]62-our friend ’s answer was prompt . “ That will come out . [I]62-our friend do n’t anticipate . ”[62-our friend]

“ Excuse [me]10-douglas — [I]10-douglas thought that was just what [you]10-douglas _ are _ doing . ”[10-douglas]

“ In [[[her]1034-the former governess successor]1035-her successor ’s place]1036-her successor ’s place , ”[0-i] [I]0-i suggested , “ [I]0-i should have wished to learn if [the office]1037-the office brought with it — ”[0-i]

“ Necessary danger to life ? ”[10-douglas] [Douglas]10-douglas completed [my]0-i thought . “ [She]1034-the former governess did wish to learn , and [she]1034-the former governess did learn . [You]0-i shall hear tomorrow what [she]1034-the former governess learned . Meanwhile , of course , the prospect struck [her]1034-the former governess as slightly grim . [She]1034-the former governess was young , untried , nervous : it was a vision of serious duties and little company , of really great loneliness . [She]1034-the former governess hesitated — took a couple of days to consult and consider . But the salary offered much exceeded [her]1034-the former governess modest measure , and on a second interview [she]1034-the former governess faced the music , [she]1034-the former governess engaged . ”[10-douglas] And [Douglas]10-douglas , with this , made a pause that , for the benefit of [the company]141-the company , moved [me]0-i to throw in —

“ The moral of which was of course the seduction exercised by [the splendid young man]1038-the splendid young man . [She]1034-the former governess succumbed to it . ”[10-douglas]

[He]10-douglas got up and , as [he]10-douglas had done the night before , went to the fire , gave a stir to a log with [his]10-douglas foot , then stood a moment with [his]10-douglas back to [us]142-us . “ [She]1034-the former governess saw [him]1038-the splendid young man only twice . ”[10-douglas]

“ Yes , but that ’s just the beauty of [her]1034-the former governess passion . ”[10-douglas]

A little to [my]0-i surprise , on this , [Douglas]10-douglas turned round to [me]0-i . “ It _ was _ the beauty of it . There were [others]1039-others , ”[10-douglas] [he]10-douglas went on , “ who had n’t succumbed . [He]1038-the splendid young man told [her]1034-the former governess frankly all [his]1038-the splendid young man difficulty — that for several applicants the conditions had been prohibitive . [They]1039-others were , somehow , simply afraid . It sounded dull — it sounded strange ; and all the more so because of [his]1038-the splendid young man main condition . ”[10-douglas]

“ Which was — ? ”[10-douglas]

“ That [she]1034-the former governess should never trouble [him]1038-the splendid young man — but never , never : neither appeal nor complain nor write about anything ; only meet all questions [herself]1034-the former governess , receive all moneys from [[his]1038-the splendid young man solicitor]1040-his solicitor , take the whole thing over and let [him]1038-the splendid young man alone . [She]1034-the former governess promised to do this , and [she]1034-the former governess mentioned to [me]10-douglas that when , for a moment , disburdened , delighted , [he]1038-the splendid young man held [her]1034-the former governess hand , thanking [her]1034-the former governess for the sacrifice , [she]1034-the former governess already felt rewarded . ”[10-douglas]

“ But was that all [her]1034-the former governess reward ? ”[144-the ladies] [one of [the ladies]144-the ladies]143-one of the ladies asked .

“ [She]1034-the former governess never saw [him]1038-the splendid young man again . ”[10-douglas]

“ Oh ! ”[145-the lady] said [the lady]145-the lady ; which , as [[our]146-our friend]62-our friend immediately left [us]146-our again , was the only other word of importance contributed to the subject till , the next night , by the corner of the hearth , in the best chair , [he]62-our friend opened the faded red cover of a thin old - fashioned gilt - edged album . The whole thing took indeed more nights than one , but on the first occasion [the same lady]148-the same lady put another question . “ What is [your]62-our friend title ? ”[148-the same lady]

“ [I]62-our friend have n’t one . ”[62-our friend]

“ Oh , _ [I]0-i _ have ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . But [Douglas]10-douglas , without heeding [me]0-i , had begun to read with a fine clearness that was like a rendering to the ear of the beauty of [[his]10-douglas author]149-his author ’s hand .

[I]0-i

[I]0-i remember the whole beginning as a succession of flights and drops , a little seesaw of the right throbs and the wrong . After rising , in [town]1018-town , to meet [his]10-douglas appeal , [I]0-i had at all events a couple of very bad days — found [myself]0-i doubtful again , felt indeed sure [I]0-i had made a mistake . In this state of mind [I]0-i spent the long hours of bumping , swinging coach that carried [me]0-i to [the stopping place at which [I]0-i was to be met by [a vehicle]152-a vehicle from [the house]153-the house]151-the stopping place at which i was to be met by a vehicle from the house . This convenience , [I]0-i was told , had been ordered , and [I]0-i found , toward the close of the June afternoon , a commodious fly in waiting for [me]0-i . Driving at that hour , on a lovely day , through [a country to which the summer sweetness seemed to offer [me]0-i a friendly welcome]154-a country to which the summer sweetness seemed to offer me a friendly welcome , [my]0-i fortitude mounted afresh and , as [we]155-we turned into [the avenue]156-the avenue , encountered a reprieve that was probably but a proof of the point to which it had sunk . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i had expected , or had dreaded , something so melancholy that what greeted [me]0-i was a good surprise . [I]0-i remember as a most pleasant impression the broad , clear front , [its]157-its open windows and fresh curtains and the pair of maids looking out ; [I]0-i remember [the lawn]1031-the lawn and the bright flowers and the crunch of [my]0-i wheels on the gravel and the clustered treetops over which the rooks circled and cawed in the golden sky . The scene had a greatness that made it a different affair from [[my]0-i own scant home]159-my own scant home , and there immediately appeared at the door , with [a little girl]160-a little girl in [her]160-a little girl hand , [a civil person who dropped [me]0-i as decent a curtsy as if [I]0-i had been [the mistress]162-the mistress or [a distinguished visitor]163-a distinguished visitor]161-a civil person who dropped me as decent a curtsy as if i had been the mistress or a distinguished visitor . [I]0-i had received in [Harley Street]3-harley street a narrower notion of [the place]1030-the place , and that , as [I]0-i recalled it , made [me]0-i think [the proprietor]165-the proprietor still more of [a gentleman]90-a gentleman , suggested that what [I]0-i was to enjoy might be something beyond [his]165-the proprietor promise .

[I]0-i had no drop again till the next day , for [I]0-i was carried triumphantly through the following hours by [my]0-i introduction to [the younger of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils]167-the younger of my pupils . [The little girl who accompanied [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose]169-the little girl who accompanied mrs. grose appeared to [me]0-i on the spot a creature so charming as to make it a great fortune to have to do with [her]169-the little girl who accompanied mrs. grose . [She]169-the little girl who accompanied mrs. grose was [the most beautiful child [I]0-i had ever seen]170-the most beautiful child i had ever seen , and [I]0-i afterward wondered that [[my]0-i employer]171-my employer had not told [me]0-i more of [her]169-the little girl who accompanied mrs. grose . [I]0-i slept little that night — [I]0-i was too much excited ; and this astonished [me]0-i , too , [I]0-i recollect , remained with [me]0-i , adding to [my]0-i sense of the liberality with which [I]0-i was treated . [The large , impressive room]172-the large , impressive room , one of the best in [the house]153-the house , the great state bed , as [I]0-i almost felt it , the full , figured draperies , the long glasses in which , for the first time , [I]0-i could see [myself]0-i from head to foot , all struck [me]0-i — like the extraordinary charm of [my]0-i small charge — as so many things thrown in . It was thrown in as well , from the first moment , that [I]0-i should get on with [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose in a relation over which , on [my]0-i way , in [the coach]174-the coach , [I]0-i fear [I]0-i had rather brooded . The only thing indeed that in this early outlook might have made [me]0-i shrink again was the clear circumstance of [her]14-mrs. grose being so glad to see [me]0-i . [I]0-i perceived within half an hour that [she]14-mrs. grose was so glad — [stout , simple , plain , clean , wholesome woman]175-stout , simple , plain , clean , wholesome woman — as to be positively on [her]14-mrs. grose guard against showing it too much . [I]0-i wondered even then a little why [she]14-mrs. grose should wish not to show it , and that , with reflection , with suspicion , might of course have made [me]0-i uneasy .

But it was a comfort that there could be no uneasiness in a connection with anything so beatific as the radiant image of [[my]0-i little girl]176-my little girl , the vision of whose angelic beauty had probably more than anything else to do with the restlessness that , before morning , made [me]0-i several times rise and wander about [[my]0-i room]177-my room to take in the whole picture and prospect ; to watch , from [my]0-i open window , the faint summer dawn , to look at such portions of the rest of [the house]153-the house as [I]0-i could catch , and to listen , while , in the fading dusk , [the first birds]179-the first birds began to twitter , for the possible recurrence of a sound or two , less natural and not without , but within , that [I]0-i had fancied [I]0-i heard . There had been a moment when [I]0-i believed [I]0-i recognized , faint and far , the cry of [a child]53-a child ; there had been another when [I]0-i found [myself]0-i just consciously starting as at the passage , before [my]0-i door , of a light footstep . But these fancies were not marked enough not to be thrown off , and it is only in the light , or the gloom , [I]0-i should rather say , of other and subsequent matters that they now come back to [me]0-i . To watch , teach , “ form ”[16-flora] little [Flora]16-flora would too evidently be the making of a happy and useful life . It had been agreed between [us]181-us [downstairs]182-downstairs that after this first occasion [I]0-i should have [her]16-flora as a matter of course at night , [her]16-flora small white bed being already arranged , to that end , in [[my]0-i room]177-my room . What [I]0-i had undertaken was the whole care of [her]16-flora , and [she]16-flora had remained , just this last time , with [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose only as an effect of [our]181-us consideration for [my]0-i inevitable strangeness and [her]16-flora natural timidity . In spite of this timidity — which [the child]1015-the child [herself]1015-the child , in the oddest way in [the world]185-the world , had been perfectly frank and brave about , allowing it , without a sign of uncomfortable consciousness , with the deep , sweet serenity indeed of [one of [[Raphael]17-raphael ’s holy infants]187-raphael ’s holy infants]186-one of raphael ’s holy infants , to be discussed , to be imputed to [her]16-flora , and to determine [us]181-us — [I]0-i feel quite sure [she]16-flora would presently like [me]0-i . It was part of what [I]0-i already liked [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose [herself]14-mrs. grose for , the pleasure [I]0-i could see [her]14-mrs. grose feel in [my]0-i admiration and wonder as [I]0-i sat at supper with four tall candles and with [[my]0-i pupil]188-my pupil , in a high chair and a bib , brightly facing [me]0-i , between [them]189-them , over bread and milk . There were naturally things that in [Flora]16-flora ’s presence could pass between [us]181-us only as prodigious and gratified looks , obscure and roundabout allusions .

“ And [the little boy]1012-the little boy — does [he]1012-the little boy look like [her]16-flora ? Is [he]1012-the little boy too so very remarkable ? ”[94-one]

[One]94-one would n’t flatter [a child]53-a child . “ Oh , [miss]1042-miss , _ most _ remarkable . If [you]1042-miss think well of this one!”—and[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose stood there with a plate in [her]14-mrs. grose hand , beaming at [[our]181-us companion]192-our companion , who looked from one of [us]181-us to the other with placid heavenly eyes that contained nothing to check [us]181-us .

“ Yes ; if [I]14-mrs. grose do — ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [You]1042-miss _ will _ be carried away by [the little gentleman]1043-the little gentleman ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Well , that , [I]0-i think , is what [I]0-i came for — to be carried away . [I]0-i ’m afraid , however , ”[0-i] [I]0-i remember feeling the impulse to add , “ [I]0-i ’m rather easily carried away . [I]0-i was carried away in [London]2-london ! ”[0-i]

[I]0-i can still see [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s broad face as [she]14-mrs. grose took this in . “ In [Harley Street]3-harley street ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ In [Harley Street]3-harley street . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Well , [miss]1042-miss , [you]0-i ’re not the first — and [you]0-i wo n’t be the last . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Oh , [I]0-i ’ve no pretension , ”[0-i] [I]0-i could laugh , “ to being the only one . [[My]0-i other pupil]1045-my other pupil , at any rate , as [I]0-i understand , comes back tomorrow ? ”[0-i]

“ Not tomorrow — Friday , [miss]1042-miss . [He]1045-my other pupil arrives , as [you]0-i did , by [the coach]174-the coach , under care of [the guard]1048-the guard , and is to be met by [the same carriage]1049-the same carriage . ”[0-i]

[I]0-i forthwith expressed that the proper as well as the pleasant and friendly thing would be therefore that on the arrival of the public conveyance [I]0-i should be in waiting for [him]193-him with [[his]193-him little sister]194-his little sister ; an idea in which [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose concurred so heartily that [I]0-i somehow took [her]14-mrs. grose manner as a kind of comforting pledge — never falsified , thank heaven!—that [we]195-we should on every question be quite at one . Oh , [she]14-mrs. grose was glad [I]0-i was [there]1025-there !

What [I]0-i felt the next day was , [I]0-i suppose , nothing that could be fairly called a reaction from the cheer of [my]0-i arrival ; it was probably at the most only a slight oppression produced by a fuller measure of the scale , as [I]0-i walked round [them]197-them , gazed up at [them]197-them , took [them]197-them in , of [my]0-i new circumstances . [They]197-them had , as it were , an extent and mass for which [I]0-i had not been prepared and in the presence of which [I]0-i found [myself]0-i , freshly , a little scared as well as a little proud . [Lessons]18-lessons , in this agitation , certainly suffered some delay ; [I]0-i reflected that [my]0-i first duty was , by the gentlest arts [I]0-i could contrive , to win [the child]1015-the child into the sense of knowing [me]0-i . [I]0-i spent the day with [her]1015-the child out - of - doors ; [I]0-i arranged with [her]1015-the child , to [her]1015-the child great satisfaction , that it should be [she]1015-the child , [she]1015-the child only , who might show [me]0-i the place . [She]1015-the child showed it step by step and room by [room]199-room and secret by secret , with droll , delightful , childish talk about it and with the result , in half an hour , of [our]200-our becoming [immense friends]201-immense friends . Young as [she]1015-the child was , [I]0-i was struck , throughout [our]200-our little tour , with [her]1015-the child confidence and courage with the way , in [empty chambers]202-empty chambers and [dull corridors]203-dull corridors , on crooked staircases that made [me]0-i pause and even on the summit of [an old machicolated square tower]204-an old machicolated square tower that made [me]0-i dizzy , [her]1015-the child morning music , [her]1015-the child disposition to tell [me]0-i so many more things than [she]1015-the child asked , rang out and led [me]0-i on . [I]0-i have not seen [Bly]13-bly since the day [I]0-i left [it]13-bly , and [I]0-i daresay that to [my]0-i older and more informed eyes it would now appear sufficiently contracted . But as [[my]0-i little conductress]205-my little conductress , with [her]1015-the child hair of gold and [her]1015-the child frock of blue , danced before [me]0-i round corners and pattered down passages , [I]0-i had the view of [a castle of romance]206-a castle of romance inhabited by [a rosy sprite]207-a rosy sprite , such a place as would somehow , for [diversion of the young idea]208-diversion of the young idea , take all color out of storybooks and fairytales . Was n’t it just a storybook over which [I]0-i had fallen adoze and adream ? No ; [it]13-bly was [a big , ugly , antique , but convenient house]209-a big , ugly , antique , but convenient house , embodying a few features of [a building still older , half - replaced and half - utilized , in which [I]0-i had the fancy of [our]211-our being almost as lost as a handful of passengers in [a great drifting ship]212-a great drifting ship]210-a building still older , half - replaced and half - utilized , in which i had the fancy of our being almost as lost as a handful of passengers in a great drifting ship . Well , [I]0-i was , strangely , at the helm !

II

This came home to [me]0-i when , two days later , [I]0-i drove over with [Flora]16-flora to meet , as [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose said , [the little gentleman]1043-the little gentleman ; and all the more for an incident that , presenting itself the second evening , had deeply disconcerted [me]0-i . The first day had been , on the whole , as [I]0-i have expressed , reassuring ; but [I]0-i was to see it wind up in keen apprehension . The postbag , that evening — it came late — contained a letter for [me]0-i , which , however , in the hand of [[my]0-i employer]171-my employer , [I]0-i found to be composed but of a few words enclosing another , addressed to [himself]171-my employer , with a seal still unbroken . “ This , [I]0-i recognize , is from [the headmaster]1050-the headmaster , and [the headmaster]1050-the headmaster ’s an awful bore . Read [him]1050-the headmaster , please ; deal with [him]1050-the headmaster ; but mind [you]1052-you do n’t report . Not a word . [I]0-i ’m off ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i broke the seal with a great effort — so great a one that [I]0-i was a long time coming to it ; took the unopened missive at last up to [[my]0-i room]177-my room and only attacked it just before going to bed . [I]0-i had better have let it wait till morning , for it gave [me]0-i a second sleepless night . With no counsel to take , the next day , [I]0-i was full of distress ; and it finally got so the better of [me]0-i that [I]0-i determined to open [myself]0-i at least to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose .

“ What does it mean ? [The child]1015-the child ’s dismissed [[his]1015-the child school]1054-his school . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[She]14-mrs. grose gave [me]0-i a look that [I]0-i remarked at the moment ; then , visibly , with a quick blankness , seemed to try to take it back . “ But are n’t [they]1055-they all — ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Sent [home]1024-home — yes . But only for the holidays . [Miles]15-miles may never go back at all . ”[14-mrs. grose]

Consciously , under [my]0-i attention , [she]14-mrs. grose reddened . “ [They]1055-they wo n’t take [him]1015-the child ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [They]1055-they absolutely decline . ”[14-mrs. grose]

At this [she]14-mrs. grose raised [her]14-mrs. grose eyes , which [she]14-mrs. grose had turned from [me]0-i ; [I]0-i saw them fill with good tears . “ What has [he]1015-the child done ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i hesitated ; then [I]0-i judged best simply to hand [her]14-mrs. grose [my]0-i letter — which , however , had the effect of making [her]14-mrs. grose , without taking it , simply put [her]14-mrs. grose hands behind [her]14-mrs. grose . [She]14-mrs. grose shook [her]14-mrs. grose head sadly . “ Such things are not for [me]14-mrs. grose , [miss]1042-miss . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[[My]0-i counselor]216-my counselor could n’t read ! [I]0-i winced at [my]0-i mistake , which [I]0-i attenuated as [I]0-i could , and opened [my]0-i letter again to repeat it to [her]14-mrs. grose ; then , faltering in the act and folding it up once more , [I]0-i put it back in [my]0-i pocket . “ Is [he]1058-he really _ bad _ ? ”[0-i]

The tears were still in [her]14-mrs. grose eyes . “ Do [the gentlemen]1059-the gentlemen say so ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [They]1059-the gentlemen go into no particulars . [They]1059-the gentlemen simply express [their]1059-the gentlemen regret that it should be impossible to keep [him]1058-he . That can have only one meaning . ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose listened with dumb emotion ; [she]14-mrs. grose forbore to ask [me]0-i what this meaning might be ; so that , presently , to put the thing with some coherence and with the mere aid of [her]14-mrs. grose presence to [my]0-i own mind , [I]0-i went on : “ That [he]1058-he ’s an injury to [the others]66-the others . ”[0-i]

At this , with one of the quick turns of [simple folk]217-simple folk , [she]14-mrs. grose suddenly flamed up . “ [Master Miles]15-miles ! _ [him]1058-he _ an injury ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

There was such a flood of good faith in it that , though [I]0-i had not yet seen [the child]1015-the child , [my]0-i very fears made [me]0-i jump to the absurdity of the idea . [I]0-i found [myself]0-i , to meet [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend the better , offering it , on the spot , sarcastically . “ To [[his]1058-he poor little innocent mates]1061-his poor little innocent mates ! ”[0-i]

“ It ’s too dreadful , ”[14-mrs. grose] cried [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , “ to say such cruel things ! Why , [he]1015-the child ’s scarce ten years old . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Yes , yes ; it would be incredible . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[She]14-mrs. grose was evidently grateful for such a profession . “ See [him]1015-the child , [miss]1042-miss , first . _ Then _ believe it ! ”[14-mrs. grose] [I]0-i felt forthwith a new impatience to see [him]1015-the child ; it was the beginning of a curiosity that , for all the next hours , was to deepen almost to pain . [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose was aware , [I]0-i could judge , of what [she]14-mrs. grose had produced in [me]0-i , and [she]14-mrs. grose followed it up with assurance . “ [You]0-i might as well believe it of [the little lady]1063-the little lady . Bless [her]1063-the little lady , ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose added the next moment—“_look _ at [her]1063-the little lady ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i turned and saw that [Flora]16-flora , whom , ten minutes before , [I]0-i had established in [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom with a sheet of white paper , a pencil , and a copy of nice “ round O ’s , ”[16-flora] now presented [herself]16-flora to view at the open door . [She]16-flora expressed in [her]16-flora little way an extraordinary detachment from disagreeable duties , looking to [me]0-i , however , with a great childish light that seemed to offer it as a mere result of the affection [she]16-flora had conceived for [[my]0-i person]221-my person , which had rendered necessary that [she]16-flora should follow [me]0-i . [I]0-i needed nothing more than this to feel the full force of [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s comparison , and , catching [[my]0-i pupil]188-my pupil in [my]0-i arms , covered [her]188-my pupil with kisses in which there was a sob of atonement .

Nonetheless , the rest of the day [I]0-i watched for further occasion to approach [[my]0-i colleague]223-my colleague , especially as , toward evening , [I]0-i began to fancy [she]188-my pupil rather sought to avoid [me]0-i . [I]0-i overtook [her]188-my pupil , [I]0-i remember , on the staircase ; [we]224-we went down together , and at the bottom [I]0-i detained [her]188-my pupil , holding [her]188-my pupil there with a hand on [her]188-my pupil arm . “ [I]0-i take what [you]188-my pupil said to [me]0-i at noon as a declaration that _ [you]188-my pupil ’ve _ never known [him]1064-him to be bad . ”[0-i]

[She]188-my pupil threw back [her]188-my pupil head ; [she]188-my pupil had clearly , by this time , and very honestly , adopted an attitude . “ Oh , never known [him]1064-him — [I]188-my pupil do n’t pretend _ that ! _ ”[188-my pupil]

[I]0-i was upset again . “ Then [you]188-my pupil _ have _ known [him]1064-him — ? ”[0-i]

“ Yes indeed , [miss]1042-miss , thank [God]12-god ! ”[188-my pupil]

On reflection [I]0-i accepted this . “ [You]188-my pupil mean that [a boy who never is —]1066-a boy who never is — ? ”[0-i]

“ Is [no boy]1067-no boy for _ [me]188-my pupil ! _ ”[188-my pupil]

[I]0-i held [her]188-my pupil tighter . “ [You]188-my pupil like [them]1068-them with the spirit to be naughty ? ”[0-i] Then , keeping pace with [her]188-my pupil answer , “ So do [I]0-i ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i eagerly brought out . “ But not to the degree to contaminate — ”[0-i]

“ To contaminate?”—my[188-my pupil] big word left [her]188-my pupil at a loss . [I]0-i explained it . “ To corrupt . ”[0-i]

[She]188-my pupil stared , taking [my]0-i meaning in ; but it produced in [her]188-my pupil an odd laugh . “ Are [you]188-my pupil afraid [he]1069-he ’ll corrupt _ [you]188-my pupil ? _ ”[188-my pupil] [She]188-my pupil put the question with such a fine bold humor that , with a laugh , a little silly doubtless , to match [her]188-my pupil own , [I]0-i gave way for the time to the apprehension of ridicule .

But the next day , as the hour for [my]0-i drive approached , [I]0-i cropped up in another place . “ What was [the lady who was here before ? ”[0-i]

“ [The last governess]1071-the last governess]1070-the lady who was here before ? ” “ the last governess ? [She]1070-the lady who was here before ? ” “ the last governess was also young and pretty — almost as young and almost as pretty , [miss]1042-miss , even as [you]0-i . ”[188-my pupil]

“ Ah , then , [I]0-i hope [her]1070-the lady who was here before ? ” “ the last governess youth and [her]1070-the lady who was here before ? ” “ the last governess beauty helped [her]1070-the lady who was here before ? ” “ the last governess ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i recollect throwing off . “ [He]1073-he seems to like [us]1074-us young and pretty ! ”[0-i]

“ Oh , [he]1073-he _ did _ , ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose assented : “ it was the way [he]1073-he liked [everyone]75-everyone ! ”[188-my pupil] [She]188-my pupil had no sooner spoken indeed than [she]188-my pupil caught [herself]188-my pupil up . “ [I]188-my pupil mean that ’s _ [his]1073-he _ way — [the master]1076-the master ’s . ”[188-my pupil]

[I]0-i was struck . “ But of whom did [you]188-my pupil speak first ? ”[0-i]

[She]188-my pupil looked blank , but [she]188-my pupil colored . “ Why , of _ [him]1073-he _ . ”[188-my pupil]

“ Of [the master]1076-the master ? ”[188-my pupil]

“ Of who else ? ”[188-my pupil]

There was so obviously [no one else]225-no one else that the next moment [I]0-i had lost [my]0-i impression of [her]188-my pupil having accidentally said more than [she]188-my pupil meant ; and [I]0-i merely asked what [I]0-i wanted to know . “ Did _ [she]188-my pupil _ see anything in [the boy]1078-the boy — ? ”[0-i]

“ That was n’t right ? [She]188-my pupil never told [me]188-my pupil . ”[188-my pupil]

[I]0-i had a scruple , but [I]0-i overcame it . “ Was [she]188-my pupil careful — particular ? ”[0-i]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose appeared to try to be conscientious . “ About some things — yes . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ But not about all ? ”[188-my pupil]

Again [she]188-my pupil considered . “ Well , [miss]1042-miss — [she]188-my pupil ’s gone . [I]188-my pupil wo n’t tell tales . ”[188-my pupil]

“ [I]0-i quite understand [your]14-mrs. grose feeling , ”[0-i] [I]0-i hastened to reply ; but [I]0-i thought it , after an instant , not opposed to this concession to pursue : “ Did [she]188-my pupil die [here]1080-here ? ”[0-i]

“ No — [she]188-my pupil went off . ”[188-my pupil]

[I]0-i do n’t know what there was in this brevity of [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s that struck [me]0-i as ambiguous . “ Went off to die ? ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose looked straight out of the window , but [I]0-i felt that , hypothetically , [I]0-i had a right to know what [young persons engaged for Bly]226-young persons engaged for bly were expected to do . “ [She]188-my pupil was taken ill , [you]14-mrs. grose mean , and went [home]1024-home ? ”[226-young persons engaged for bly]

“ [She]188-my pupil was not taken ill , so far as appeared , in [this house]1082-this house . [She]188-my pupil left it , at the end of the year , to go [home]1024-home , as [she]188-my pupil said , for a short holiday , to which the time [she]188-my pupil had put in had certainly given [her]188-my pupil a right . [We]1084-we had then [a young woman]1085-a young woman — [a nursemaid who had stayed on and who was [a good girl and clever]1087-a good girl and clever]1086-a nursemaid who had stayed on and who was a good girl and clever ; and _ [she]188-my pupil _ took [the children]1088-the children altogether for the interval . But [[our]1084-we young lady]1089-our young lady never came back , and at the very moment [I]14-mrs. grose was expecting [her]188-my pupil [I]14-mrs. grose heard from [the master]1076-the master that [she]188-my pupil was dead . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i turned this over . “ But of what ? ”[0-i]

“ [He]1076-the master never told [me]14-mrs. grose ! But please , [miss]1042-miss , ”[14-mrs. grose] said [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , “ [I]14-mrs. grose must get to [my]14-mrs. grose work . ”[14-mrs. grose]

III

[Her]14-mrs. grose thus turning [her]14-mrs. grose back on [me]0-i was fortunately not , for [my]0-i just preoccupations , a snub that could check the growth of [our]227-our mutual esteem . [We]227-our met , after [I]0-i had brought [home]1024-home [little Miles]15-miles , more intimately than ever on the ground of [my]0-i stupefaction , [my]0-i general emotion : so monstrous was [I]0-i then ready to pronounce it that [such a child]229-such a child as had now been revealed to [me]0-i should be under an interdict . [I]0-i was a little late on the scene , and [I]0-i felt , as [he]230-him stood wistfully looking out for [me]0-i before the door of [the inn at which [the coach]174-the coach had put [him]230-him down]231-the inn at which the coach had put him down , that [I]0-i had seen [him]230-him , on the instant , without and within , in the great glow of freshness , the same positive fragrance of purity , in which [I]0-i had , from the first moment , seen [[his]230-him little sister]194-his little sister . [He]230-him was incredibly beautiful , and [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose had put [her]14-mrs. grose finger on it : everything but a sort of passion of tenderness for [him]230-him was swept away by [his]230-him presence . What [I]0-i then and there took [him]230-him to [my]0-i heart for was something divine that [I]0-i have never found to the same degree in [any child]234-any child — [his]230-him indescribable little air of knowing nothing in [the world]185-the world but love . It would have been impossible to carry a bad name with a greater sweetness of innocence , and by the time [I]0-i had got back to Bly with [him]230-him [I]0-i remained merely bewildered — so far , that is , as [I]0-i was not outraged — by the sense of the horrible letter locked up in [[my]0-i room]177-my room , in a drawer . As soon as [I]0-i could compass a private word with [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose [I]0-i declared to [her]14-mrs. grose that it was grotesque .

[She]14-mrs. grose promptly understood [me]0-i . “ [You]0-i mean the cruel charge — ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ It does n’t live an instant . [[My]14-mrs. grose dear woman]1092-my dear woman , _ look _ at [him]230-him ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

[She]14-mrs. grose smiled at [my]0-i pretention to have discovered [his]230-him charm . “ [I]14-mrs. grose assure [you]0-i , [miss]1042-miss , [I]14-mrs. grose do nothing else ! What will [you]0-i say , then ? ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose immediately added .

“ In answer to the letter ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind . “ Nothing . ”[0-i]

“ And to [[his]230-him uncle]1094-his uncle ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i was incisive . “ Nothing . ”[0-i]

“ And to [the boy]1078-the boy [himself]1078-the boy ? ”[0-i]

[I]0-i was wonderful . “ Nothing . ”[0-i]

[She]14-mrs. grose gave with [her]14-mrs. grose apron a great wipe to [her]14-mrs. grose mouth . “ Then [I]14-mrs. grose ’ll stand by [you]0-i . [We]1096-we ’ll see it out . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [We]1096-we ’ll see it out ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i ardently echoed , giving [her]14-mrs. grose [my]0-i hand to make it a vow .

[She]14-mrs. grose held [me]0-i there a moment , then whisked up [her]14-mrs. grose apron again with [her]14-mrs. grose detached hand . “ Would [you]14-mrs. grose mind , [miss]1042-miss , if [I]14-mrs. grose used the freedom — ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ To kiss [me]0-i ? No ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i took the good creature in [my]0-i arms and , after [we]237-we had embraced like [sisters]238-sisters , felt still more fortified and indignant .

This , at all events , was for the time : a time so full that , as [I]0-i recall the way it went , it reminds [me]0-i of all the art [I]0-i now need to make it a little distinct . What [I]0-i look back at with amazement is the situation [I]0-i accepted . [I]0-i had undertaken , with [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion , to see it out , and [I]0-i was under a charm , apparently , that could smooth away the extent and the far and difficult connections of such an effort . [I]0-i was lifted aloft on a great wave of infatuation and pity . [I]0-i found it simple , in [my]0-i ignorance , [my]0-i confusion , and perhaps [my]0-i conceit , to assume that [I]0-i could deal with [a boy whose education for [the world]185-the world was all on the point of beginning]240-a boy whose education for the world was all on the point of beginning . [I]0-i am unable even to remember at this day what proposal [I]0-i framed for the end of [his]240-a boy whose education for the world was all on the point of beginning holidays and the resumption of [his]240-a boy whose education for the world was all on the point of beginning studies . Lessons with [me]0-i , indeed , that charming summer , [we]242-we all had a theory that [he]240-a boy whose education for the world was all on the point of beginning was to have ; but [I]0-i now feel that , for weeks , the lessons must have been rather [my]0-i own . [I]0-i learned something — at first , certainly — that had not been one of the teachings of [my]0-i small , smothered life ; learned to be amused , and even amusing , and not to think for the morrow . It was the first time , in a manner , that [I]0-i had known space and air and freedom , all the music of summer and all the mystery of nature . And then there was consideration — and consideration was sweet . Oh , it was a trap — not designed , but deep — to [my]0-i imagination , to [my]0-i delicacy , perhaps to [my]0-i vanity ; to whatever , in [me]0-i , was most excitable . The best way to picture it all is to say that [I]0-i was off [my]0-i guard . [They]243-they gave [me]0-i so little trouble — they were of a gentleness so extraordinary . [I]0-i used to speculate — but even this with a dim disconnectedness — as to how the rough future ( for all futures are rough ! ) would handle them and might bruise them . [They]243-they had the bloom of health and happiness ; and yet , as if [I]0-i had been in charge of a pair of little grandees , of [princes of the blood , for whom everything , to be right , would have to be enclosed and protected]244-princes of the blood , for whom everything , to be right , would have to be enclosed and protected , the only form that , in [my]0-i fancy , [the afteryears]245-the afteryears could take for [them]243-they was that of a romantic , a really royal extension of [the garden]1027-the garden and [the park]247-the park . It may be , of course , above all , that what suddenly broke into this gives the previous time a charm of stillness — that hush in which something gathers or crouches . The change was actually like the spring of a beast .

In the first weeks the days were long ; they often , at their finest , gave [me]0-i what [I]0-i used to call [my]0-i own hour , the hour when , for [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils , teatime and bedtime having come and gone , [I]0-i had , before [my]0-i final retirement , a small interval alone . Much as [I]0-i liked [[my]0-i companions]249-my companions , this hour was the thing in the day [I]0-i liked most ; and [I]0-i liked it best of all when , as the light faded — or rather , [I]0-i should say , the day lingered and the last calls of the last birds sounded , in a flushed sky , from the old trees — [I]0-i could take a turn into [the grounds]250-the grounds and enjoy , almost with a sense of property that amused and flattered [me]0-i , the beauty and dignity of [the place]1030-the place . It was a pleasure at these moments to feel [myself]0-i tranquil and justified ; doubtless , perhaps , also to reflect that by [my]0-i discretion , [my]0-i quiet good sense and general high propriety , [I]0-i was giving pleasure — if [he]252-he ever thought of it!—to [the person to whose pressure [I]0-i had responded]253-the person to whose pressure i had responded . What [I]0-i was doing was what [he]252-he had earnestly hoped and directly asked of [me]0-i , and that [I]0-i _ could _ , after all , do it proved even a greater joy than [I]0-i had expected . [I]0-i daresay [I]0-i fancied [myself]0-i , in short , [a remarkable young woman]254-a remarkable young woman and took comfort in the faith that this would more publicly appear . Well , [I]0-i needed to be remarkable to offer a front to the remarkable things that presently gave [their]255-their first sign .

It was plump , one afternoon , in the middle of [my]0-i very hour : [the children]1088-the children were tucked away , and [I]0-i had come out for [my]0-i stroll . One of the thoughts that , as [I]0-i do n’t in the least shrink now from noting , used to be with [me]0-i in these wanderings was that it would be as charming as a charming story suddenly to meet [someone]138-someone . [Someone]138-someone would appear there at the turn of a path and would stand before [me]0-i and smile and approve . [I]0-i did n’t ask more than that — [I]0-i only asked that [he]138-someone should _ know ; _ and the only way to be sure [he]138-someone knew would be to see it , and the kind light of it , in [his]138-someone handsome face . That was exactly present to [me]0-i — by which [I]0-i mean the face was — when , on the first of these occasions , at the end of a long June day , [I]0-i stopped short on emerging from [one of [the plantations]260-the plantations]259-one of the plantations and coming into view of [the house]153-the house . What arrested [me]0-i on the spot — and with a shock much greater than any vision had allowed for — was the sense that [my]0-i imagination had , in a flash , turned real . [He]138-someone did stand there!—but high up , beyond [the lawn]1031-the lawn and at the very top of the tower to which , on that first morning , [little Flora]16-flora had conducted [me]0-i . [This tower]263-this tower was one of a pair — square , incongruous , crenelated structures — that were distinguished , for some reason , though [I]0-i could see little difference , as the new and the old . They flanked opposite ends of [the house]153-the house and were probably architectural absurdities , redeemed in a measure indeed by not being wholly disengaged nor of a height too pretentious , dating , in [their]265-their gingerbread antiquity , from a romantic revival that was already a respectable past . [I]0-i admired [them]265-their , had fancies about [them]265-their , for [we]266-we could all profit in a degree , especially when [they]265-their loomed through the dusk , by the grandeur of [their]265-their actual battlements ; yet it was not at such an elevation that the figure [I]0-i had so often invoked seemed most in place .

It produced in [me]0-i , this figure , in the clear twilight , [I]0-i remember , two distinct gasps of emotion , which were , sharply , the shock of [my]0-i first and that of [my]0-i second surprise . [My]0-i second was a violent perception of the mistake of [my]0-i first : [the man who met [my]0-i eyes]267-the man who met my eyes was not [the person [I]0-i had precipitately supposed]268-the person i had precipitately supposed . There came to [me]0-i thus a bewilderment of vision of which , after these years , there is no living view that [I]0-i can hope to give . [An unknown man in [a lonely place]270-a lonely place]269-an unknown man in a lonely place is a permitted object of fear to [a young woman privately bred]271-a young woman privately bred ; and the figure that faced [me]0-i was — a few more seconds assured [me]0-i — as little anyone else [I]0-i knew as it was the image that had been in [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i had not seen it in [Harley Street]3-harley street — [I]0-i had not seen it anywhere . [The place]1030-the place , moreover , in the strangest way in [the world]185-the world , had , on the instant , and by the very fact of [its]1030-the place appearance , become a solitude . To [me]0-i at least , making [my]0-i statement here with a deliberation with which [I]0-i have never made it , the whole feeling of the moment returns . It was as if , while [I]0-i took in — what [I]0-i did take in — all the rest of the scene had been stricken with death . [I]0-i can hear again , as [I]0-i write , the intense hush in which the sounds of evening dropped . The rooks stopped cawing in the golden sky , and the friendly hour lost , for the minute , all its voice . But there was no other change in nature , unless indeed it were a change that [I]0-i saw with a stranger sharpness . The gold was still in the sky , the clearness in the air , and [the man who looked at [me]0-i over the battlements]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements was as definite as a picture in a frame . That ’s how [I]0-i thought , with extraordinary quickness , of [each person that [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements might have been and that [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements was not]275-each person that he might have been and that he was not . [We]276-we were confronted across [our]276-we distance quite long enough for [me]0-i to ask [myself]0-i with intensity who then [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements was and to feel , as an effect of [my]0-i inability to say , a wonder that in a few instants more became intense .

The great question , or one of these , is , afterward , [I]0-i know , with regard to certain matters , the question of how long they have lasted . Well , this matter of [mine]0-i , think what [you]277-you will of it , lasted while [I]0-i caught at a dozen possibilities , none of which made a difference for the better , that [I]0-i could see , in there having been in [the house]153-the house — and for how long , above [all?—a person of whom [I]0-i was in ignorance]279-all?—a person of whom i was in ignorance . It lasted while [I]0-i just bridled a little with the sense that [[my]0-i office]280-my office demanded that there should be no such ignorance and [no such person]281-no such person . It lasted while [this visitant]282-this visitant , at all events — and there was a touch of the strange freedom , as [I]0-i remember , in the sign of familiarity of [his]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements wearing no hat — seemed to fix [me]0-i , from [his]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements position , with just the question , just the scrutiny through the fading light , that [his]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements own presence provoked . [We]283-we were too far apart to call to [each other]284-each other , but there was a moment at which , at shorter range , some challenge between [us]283-we , breaking the hush , would have been the right result of [our]283-we straight mutual stare . [He]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements was in one of the angles , the one away from [the house]153-the house , very erect , as it struck [me]0-i , and with both hands on the ledge . So [I]0-i saw [him]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements as [I]0-i see the letters [I]0-i form on this page ; then , exactly , after a minute , as if to add to the spectacle , [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements slowly changed [his]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements place — passed , looking at [me]0-i hard all the while , to the opposite corner of [the platform]286-the platform . Yes , [I]0-i had the sharpest sense that during this transit [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements never took [his]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements eyes from [me]0-i , and [I]0-i can see at this moment the way [his]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements hand , as [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements went , passed from one of the crenelations to the next . [He]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements stopped at the other corner , but less long , and even as [he]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements turned away still markedly fixed [me]0-i . [He]274-the man who looked at me over the battlements turned away ; that was all [I]0-i knew .

IV

It was not that [I]0-i did n’t wait , on this occasion , for more , for [I]0-i was rooted as deeply as [I]0-i was shaken . Was there a “ secret ”[274-the man who looked at me over the battlements] at Bly — a mystery of [Udolpho]19-udolpho or [an insane]287-an insane , [an unmentionable relative kept in unsuspected confinement]288-an unmentionable relative kept in unsuspected confinement ? [I]0-i ca n’t say how long [I]0-i turned it over , or how long , in a confusion of curiosity and dread , [I]0-i remained where [I]0-i had had [my]0-i collision ; [I]0-i only recall that when [I]0-i re - entered [the house]153-the house darkness had quite closed in . Agitation , in the interval , certainly had held [me]0-i and driven [me]0-i , for [I]0-i must , in circling about [the place]1030-the place , have walked three miles ; but [I]0-i was to be , later on , so much more overwhelmed that this mere dawn of alarm was a comparatively human chill . The most singular part of it , in fact — singular as the rest had been — was the part [I]0-i became , in [the hall]78-the hall , aware of in meeting [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose . This picture comes back to [me]0-i in the general train — the impression , as [I]0-i received it on [my]0-i return , of the wide white panelled space , bright in the lamplight and with [its]292-its portraits and red carpet , and of the good surprised look of [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend , which immediately told [me]0-i [she]219-my friend had missed [me]0-i . It came to [me]0-i straightway , under [her]219-my friend contact , that , with plain heartiness , mere relieved anxiety at [my]0-i appearance , [she]219-my friend knew nothing whatever that could bear upon the incident [I]0-i had there ready for [her]219-my friend . [I]0-i had not suspected in advance that [her]219-my friend comfortable face would pull [me]0-i up , and [I]0-i somehow measured the importance of what [I]0-i had seen by [my]0-i thus finding [myself]0-i hesitate to mention it . Scarce anything in the whole history seems to [me]0-i so odd as this fact that [my]0-i real beginning of fear was one , as [I]0-i may say , with the instinct of sparing [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion . On the spot , accordingly , in [the pleasant hall]295-the pleasant hall and with [her]219-my friend eyes on [me]0-i , [I]0-i , for a reason that [I]0-i could n’t then have phrased , achieved an inward resolution — offered a vague pretext for [my]0-i lateness and , with the plea of the beauty of the night and of the heavy dew and wet feet , went as soon as possible to [[my]0-i room]177-my room .

Here it was another affair ; [here]1080-here , for many days after , it was a queer affair enough . There were hours , from day to day — or at least there were moments , snatched even from clear duties — when [I]0-i had to shut [myself]0-i up to think . It was not so much yet that [I]0-i was more nervous than [I]0-i could bear to be as that [I]0-i was remarkably afraid of becoming so ; for the truth [I]0-i had now to turn over was , simply and clearly , the truth that [I]0-i could arrive at no account whatever of [the visitor with whom [I]0-i had been so inexplicably and yet , as it seemed to [me]0-i , so intimately concerned]298-the visitor with whom i had been so inexplicably and yet , as it seemed to me , so intimately concerned . It took little time to see that [I]0-i could sound without forms of inquiry and without exciting remark any domestic complications . The shock [I]0-i had suffered must have sharpened all [my]0-i senses ; [I]0-i felt sure , at the end of three days and as the result of mere closer attention , that [I]0-i had not been practiced upon by [the servants]299-the servants nor made the object of any “ game . ”[138-someone] Of whatever it was that [I]0-i knew , nothing was known around [me]0-i . There was but one sane inference : [someone]138-someone had taken a liberty rather gross . That was what , repeatedly , [I]0-i dipped into [[my]0-i room]177-my room and locked the door to say to [myself]0-i . [We]302-we had been , collectively , subject to an intrusion ; [some unscrupulous traveler , curious in [old houses]304-old houses]303-some unscrupulous traveler , curious in old houses , had made [his]303-some unscrupulous traveler , curious in old houses way in unobserved , enjoyed the prospect from the best point of view , and then stolen out as [he]303-some unscrupulous traveler , curious in old houses came . If [he]303-some unscrupulous traveler , curious in old houses had given [me]0-i such a bold hard stare , that was but a part of [his]303-some unscrupulous traveler , curious in old houses indiscretion . The good thing , after all , was that [we]302-we should surely see no more of [him]303-some unscrupulous traveler , curious in old houses .

This was not so good a thing , [I]0-i admit , as not to leave [me]0-i to judge that what , essentially , made nothing else much signify was simply [my]0-i charming work . [My]0-i charming work was just [my]0-i life with [Miles]15-miles and [Flora]16-flora , and through nothing could [I]0-i so like it as through feeling that [I]0-i could throw [myself]0-i into it in trouble . The attraction of [my]0-i small charges was a constant joy , leading [me]0-i to wonder afresh at the vanity of [my]0-i original fears , the distaste [I]0-i had begun by entertaining for the probable gray prose of [[my]0-i office]280-my office . There was to be no gray prose , it appeared , and no long grind ; so how could work not be charming that presented itself as daily beauty ? It was all the romance of [the nursery]306-the nursery and the poetry of [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom . [I]0-i do n’t mean by this , of course , that [we]308-we studied only fiction and verse ; [I]0-i mean [I]0-i can express no otherwise the sort of interest [[my]0-i companions]249-my companions inspired . How can [I]0-i describe that except by saying that instead of growing used to them — and it ’s a marvel for [a governess]310-a governess : [I]0-i call [the sisterhood]311-the sisterhood to witness!—I made constant fresh discoveries . There was one direction , assuredly , in which these discoveries stopped : deep obscurity continued to cover the region of [the boy]1078-the boy ’s conduct at [school]313-school . It had been promptly given [me]0-i , [I]0-i have noted , to face that mystery without a pang . Perhaps even it would be nearer the truth to say that — without a word — [he]1078-the boy [himself]1078-the boy had cleared it up . [He]1078-the boy had made the whole charge absurd . [My]0-i conclusion bloomed there with the real rose flush of [his]1078-the boy innocence : [he]1078-the boy was only too fine and fair for [the little horrid , unclean school - world]314-the little horrid , unclean school - world , and [he]1078-the boy had paid a price for it . [I]0-i reflected acutely that the sense of such differences , such superiorities of quality , always , on the part of [the majority]315-the majority — which could include [even stupid , sordid headmasters]316-even stupid , sordid headmasters — turn infallibly to the vindictive .

Both [the children]1088-the children had a gentleness ( it was [their]1088-the children only fault , and it never made [Miles]15-miles a muff ) that kept [them]1088-the children — how shall [I]0-i express it?—almost impersonal and certainly quite unpunishable . [They]1088-the children were like [the cherubs of the anecdote]318-the cherubs of the anecdote , who had — morally , at any rate — nothing to whack ! [I]0-i remember feeling with [Miles]15-miles in especial as if [he]15-miles had had , as it were , no history . [We]319-we expect of [a small child]320-a small child [a scant one]321-a scant one , but there was in [this beautiful little boy]322-this beautiful little boy something extraordinarily sensitive , yet extraordinarily happy , that , more than in [any creature of [his]322-this beautiful little boy age [I]0-i have seen]323-any creature of his age i have seen , struck [me]0-i as beginning anew each day . [He]15-miles had never for a second suffered . [I]0-i took this as a direct disproof of [his]15-miles having really been chastised . If [he]15-miles had been wicked [he]15-miles would have “ caught ”[15-miles] it , and [I]0-i should have caught it by the rebound — [I]0-i should have found the trace . [I]0-i found nothing at all , and [he]15-miles was therefore [an angel]324-an angel . [He]15-miles never spoke of [[his]15-miles school]1054-his school , never mentioned [a comrade]326-a comrade or [a master]327-a master ; and [I]0-i , for [my]0-i part , was quite too much disgusted to allude to [them]328-them . Of course [I]0-i was under the spell , and the wonderful part is that , even at the time , [I]0-i perfectly knew [I]0-i was . But [I]0-i gave [myself]0-i up to it ; it was an antidote to any pain , and [I]0-i had more pains than one . [I]0-i was in receipt in these days of disturbing letters from [home]1024-home , where things were not going well . But with [[my]0-i children]330-my children , what things in [the world]185-the world mattered ? That was the question [I]0-i used to put to [my]0-i scrappy retirements . [I]0-i was dazzled by [their]330-my children loveliness .

There was a Sunday — to get on — when it rained with such force and for so many hours that there could be no procession to [church]332-church ; in consequence of which , as the day declined , [I]0-i had arranged with [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose that , should the evening show improvement , [we]333-we would attend together the late service . The rain happily stopped , and [I]0-i prepared for [our]333-we walk , which , through [the park]247-the park and by [the good road to [the village]336-the village]335-the good road to the village , would be a matter of twenty minutes . Coming [downstairs]182-downstairs to meet [[my]0-i colleague]223-my colleague in [the hall]78-the hall , [I]0-i remembered a pair of gloves that had required three stitches and that had received them — with a publicity perhaps not edifying — while [I]0-i sat with [the children]1088-the children at [their]1088-the children tea , served on Sundays , by exception , in that cold , clean temple of mahogany and brass , [the “ grown - up ”[0-i] dining room]341-the “ grown - up ” dining room . The gloves had been dropped [there]1025-there , and [I]0-i turned in to recover them . The day was gray enough , but the afternoon light still lingered , and it enabled [me]0-i , on crossing the threshold , not only to recognize , on a chair near the wide window , then closed , the articles [I]0-i wanted , but to become aware of [a person on the other side of the window and looking straight in]343-a person on the other side of the window and looking straight in . [The person looking straight in]345-the person looking straight in was [the person who had already appeared to [me]0-i]346-the person who had already appeared to me . [He]345-the person looking straight in appeared thus again with [I]0-i wo n’t say greater distinctness , for that was impossible , but with a nearness that represented a forward stride in [our]347-our intercourse and made [me]0-i , as [I]0-i met [him]345-the person looking straight in , catch [my]0-i breath and turn cold . [He]345-the person looking straight in was the same — [he]345-the person looking straight in was the same , and seen , this time , as [he]345-the person looking straight in had been seen before , from the waist up , the window , though [the dining room]348-the dining room was on the ground floor , not going down to [the terrace on which [he]345-the person looking straight in stood]349-the terrace on which he stood . [His]345-the person looking straight in face was close to the glass , yet the effect of this better view was , strangely , only to show [me]0-i how intense [the former]350-the former had been . [He]345-the person looking straight in remained but a few seconds — long enough to convince [me]0-i [he]345-the person looking straight in also saw and recognized ; but it was as if [I]0-i had been looking at [him]345-the person looking straight in for years and had known [him]345-the person looking straight in always . Something , however , happened this time that had not happened before ; [his]345-the person looking straight in stare into [my]0-i face , through the glass and across [the room]56-the room , was as deep and hard as then , but it quitted [me]0-i for a moment during which [I]0-i could still watch it , see it fix successively several other things . On the spot there came to [me]0-i the added shock of a certitude that it was not for [me]0-i [he]345-the person looking straight in had come [there]1025-there . [He]345-the person looking straight in had come for [someone else]58-someone else .

The flash of this knowledge — for it was knowledge in the midst of dread — produced in [me]0-i the most extraordinary effect , started as [I]0-i stood there , a sudden vibration of duty and courage . [I]0-i say courage because [I]0-i was beyond all doubt already far gone . [I]0-i bounded straight out of the door again , reached that of [the house]153-the house , got , in an instant , upon [the drive]355-the drive , and , passing along [the terrace]356-the terrace as fast as [I]0-i could rush , turned a corner and came full in sight . But it was in sight of nothing now — [[my]0-i visitor]357-my visitor had vanished . [I]0-i stopped , [I]0-i almost dropped , with the real relief of this ; but [I]0-i took in the whole scene — [I]0-i gave [him]345-the person looking straight in time to reappear . [I]0-i call it time , but how long was it ? [I]0-i ca n’t speak to the purpose today of the duration of these things . [I]0-i got hold of this ; then , instinctively , instead of returning as [I]0-i had come , went to the window .
