[VI]25-vi

It took of course more than that particular passage to place [us]370-we together in presence of what [we]370-we had now to live with as [we]370-we could — [my]0-i dreadful liability to impressions of the order so vividly exemplified , and [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion ’s knowledge , henceforth — a knowledge half consternation and half compassion — of that liability . There had been , this evening , after the revelation left [me]0-i , for an hour , so prostrate — there had been , for either of [us]370-we , no attendance on any service but a little service of tears and vows , of prayers and promises , a climax to the series of mutual challenges and pledges that had straightway ensued on [our]370-we retreating together to [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom and shutting [ourselves]370-we up there to have everything out . The result of [our]370-we having everything out was simply to reduce [our]370-we situation to the last rigor of its elements . [She]239-my companion [herself]239-my companion had seen nothing , not the shadow of a shadow , and [nobody in [the house]153-the house]373-nobody in the house but [the governess]375-the governess was in [the governess]375-the governess ’s plight ; yet [she]239-my companion accepted without directly impugning [my]0-i sanity the truth as [I]0-i gave it to [her]239-my companion , and ended by showing [me]0-i , on this ground , an awestricken tenderness , an expression of the sense of [my]0-i more than questionable privilege , of which the very breath has remained with [me]0-i as that of the sweetest of human charities .

What was settled between [us]370-we , accordingly , that night , was that [we]370-we thought [we]370-we might bear things together ; and [I]0-i was not even sure that , in spite of [her]239-my companion exemption , it was [she]239-my companion who had the best of the burden . [I]0-i knew at this hour , [I]0-i think , as well as [I]0-i knew later , what [I]0-i was capable of meeting to shelter [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils ; but it took [me]0-i some time to be wholly sure of what [[my]0-i honest ally]378-my honest ally was prepared for to keep terms with so compromising a contract . [I]0-i was queer company enough — quite as queer as the company [I]0-i received ; but as [I]0-i trace over what [we]370-we went through [I]0-i see how much common ground [we]370-we must have found in the one idea that , by good fortune , [_]379-_ could _ steady [us]370-we . It was the idea , the second movement , that led [me]0-i straight out , as [I]0-i may say , of [the inner chamber of [my]0-i dread]380-the inner chamber of my dread . [I]0-i could take the air in [the court]381-the court , at least , and there [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose could join [me]0-i . [Perfectly]26-perfectly can [I]0-i recall now the particular way [strength]382-strength came to [me]0-i before [we]370-we separated for the night . [We]370-we had gone over and over every feature of what [I]0-i had seen .

“ [He]1143-he was looking for [someone else]58-someone else , [you]14-mrs. grose say — someone who was not [you]14-mrs. grose ? ”[370-we]

“ [He]1143-he was looking for [little Miles]15-miles . ”[382-strength] A portentous clearness now possessed [me]0-i . “ _ That ’s _ whom [he]1143-he was looking for . ”[382-strength]

“ But how do [you]14-mrs. grose know ? ”[370-we]

“ [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know ! ”[0-i] [My]0-i exaltation grew . “ And _ [you]0-i _ know , [[my]0-i dear]1145-my dear ! ”[0-i]

[She]383-she did n’t deny this , but [I]0-i required , [I]0-i felt , not even so much telling as that . [She]383-she resumed in a moment , at any rate : “ What if [_]1146-_ [he]1143-he _ should see [him]1143-he ? ”[383-she]

“ [Little Miles]15-miles ? That ’s what [he]1143-he wants ! ”[383-she]

[She]383-she looked immensely scared again . “ [The child]1015-the child ? ”[383-she]

“ Heaven forbid ! [The man]1148-the man . [He]1143-he wants to appear to _ [them]1015-the child _ . ”[384-he] That [he]384-he might was an awful conception , and yet , somehow , [I]0-i could keep it at bay ; which , moreover , as [we]385-we lingered there , was what [I]0-i succeeded in practically proving . [I]0-i had an absolute certainty that [I]0-i should see again what [I]0-i had already seen , but something within [me]0-i said that by offering [myself]0-i bravely as [the sole subject of such experience]386-the sole subject of such experience , by accepting , by inviting , by surmounting it all , [I]0-i should serve as [an expiatory victim]387-an expiatory victim and guard the tranquility of [[my]0-i companions]249-my companions . [The children]1088-the children , in especial , [I]0-i should thus fence about and absolutely save . [I]0-i recall one of the last things [I]0-i said that night to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose .

“ It does strike [me]14-mrs. grose that [[my]14-mrs. grose pupils]168-my pupils have never mentioned — ”[14-mrs. grose]

[She]14-mrs. grose looked at [me]0-i hard as [I]0-i musingly pulled up . “ [His]1150-his having been [here]1080-here and the time [they]1088-the children were with [him]1150-his ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ The time [they]1088-the children were with [him]1150-his , and [his]1150-his name , [his]1150-his presence , [his]1150-his history , in any way . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Oh , [the little lady]1063-the little lady does n’t remember . [She]1063-the little lady never heard or knew . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ The circumstances of [his]1150-his death ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i thought with some intensity . “ Perhaps not . But [Miles]15-miles would remember — [Miles]15-miles would know . ”[0-i]

“ Ah , do n’t try [him]1150-his ! ”[14-mrs. grose] broke from [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose .

[I]0-i returned [her]14-mrs. grose the look [she]14-mrs. grose had given [me]0-i . “ Do n’t be afraid . ”[14-mrs. grose] [I]0-i continued to think . “ It _ is _ rather odd . ”[0-i]

“ That [he]1150-his has never spoken of [him]1150-his ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Never by the least allusion . And [you]14-mrs. grose tell [me]0-i [they]1153-they were ‘ [great friends]1154-great friends ’ ? ”[0-i]

“ Oh , it was n’t _ [him]1150-his ! _ ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose with emphasis declared . “ It was [Quint]24-quint ’s own fancy . To play with [him]24-quint , [I]14-mrs. grose mean — to spoil [him]24-quint . ”[14-mrs. grose] [She]14-mrs. grose paused a moment ; then [she]14-mrs. grose added : “ [Quint]24-quint was much too free . ”[14-mrs. grose]

This gave [me]0-i , straight from [my]0-i vision of [his]390-his face—_such _ a face!—a sudden sickness of disgust . “ Too free with _ [[my]14-mrs. grose _ boy]1155-my _ boy ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Too free with [everyone]75-everyone ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i forbore , for the moment , to analyze this description further than by the reflection that a part of it applied to [several of [the members of [the household]393-the household]392-the members of the household , of the half - dozen maids and men who were still of [[our]394-our small colony]395-our small colony]391-several of the members of the household , of the half - dozen maids and men who were still of our small colony . But there was everything , for [our]394-our apprehension , in the lucky fact that no discomfortable legend , no perturbation of [scullions]396-scullions , had ever , within [anyone]1028-anyone ’s memory attached to the kind old place . It had neither bad name nor ill fame , and [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , most apparently , only desired to cling to [me]0-i and to quake in silence . [I]0-i even put [her]14-mrs. grose , the very last thing of all , to the test . It was when , at midnight , [she]14-mrs. grose had [her]14-mrs. grose hand on [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom door to take leave . “ [I]14-mrs. grose have it from [you]0-i then — for it ’s of great importance — that [he]1155-my _ boy was definitely and admittedly bad ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Oh , not admittedly . _ [I]0-i _ knew it — but [the master]1076-the master did n’t . ”[0-i]

“ And [you]0-i never told [him]399-he ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Well , [he]399-he did n’t like tale - bearing — [he]399-he hated complaints . [He]399-he was terribly short with anything of that kind , and if [people]126-people were all right to _ [him]399-he _ — ”[0-i]

“ [He]399-he would n’t be bothered with more ? ”[14-mrs. grose] This squared well enough with [my]0-i impressions of [him]399-he : [he]399-he was not [a trouble - loving gentleman]400-a trouble - loving gentleman , nor so very particular perhaps about some of [the company _ [he]399-he _ kept]401-the company _ he _ kept . All the same , [I]0-i pressed [[my]0-i interlocutress]402-my interlocutress . “ [I]0-i promise [you]402-my interlocutress _ [I]0-i _ would have told ! ”[0-i]

[She]402-my interlocutress felt [my]0-i discrimination . “ [I]402-my interlocutress daresay [I]402-my interlocutress was wrong . But , really , [I]402-my interlocutress was afraid . ”[402-my interlocutress]

“ Afraid of what ? ”[402-my interlocutress]

“ Of things [that man]1159-that man could do . [Quint]24-quint was so clever — [he]24-quint was so deep . ”[402-my interlocutress]

[I]0-i took this in still more than , probably , [I]0-i showed . “ [You]402-my interlocutress were n’t afraid of anything else ? Not of [his]24-quint effect — ? ”[0-i]

“ [His]24-quint effect ? ”[402-my interlocutress] [she]402-my interlocutress repeated with a face of anguish and waiting while [I]0-i faltered .

“ On innocent little precious lives . [They]1160-they were in [your]0-i charge . ”[0-i]

“ No , they were not in [mine]0-i ! ”[402-my interlocutress] [she]402-my interlocutress roundly and distressfully returned . “ [The master]1076-the master believed in [him]24-quint and placed [him]24-quint here because [he]24-quint was supposed not to be well and [the country]114-the country air so good for [him]24-quint . So [he]24-quint had everything to say . Yes”—she[402-my interlocutress] let [me]0-i have it—“even about _ [them]404-them _ . ”[402-my interlocutress]

“ [Them]404-them — [that creature]1163-that creature ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i had to smother a kind of howl . “ And [you]403-the poor woman could bear it ! ”[0-i]

“ No . [I]403-the poor woman couldn’t — and [I]403-the poor woman ca n’t now ! ”[403-the poor woman] And [the poor woman]403-the poor woman burst into tears .

A rigid control , from the next day , was , as [I]0-i have said , to follow [them]404-them ; yet how often and how passionately , for a week , [we]405-we came back together to the subject ! Much as [we]405-we had discussed it that Sunday night , [I]0-i was , in the immediate later hours in especial — for it may be imagined whether [I]0-i slept — still haunted with the shadow of something [she]403-the poor woman had not told [me]0-i . [I]0-i [myself]0-i had kept back nothing , but there was a word [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose had kept back . [I]0-i was sure , moreover , by morning , that this was not from a failure of frankness , but because on every side there were fears . It seems to [me]0-i indeed , in retrospect , that by the time the morrow ’s sun was high [I]0-i had restlessly read into the fact before [us]405-we almost all the meaning [they]404-them were to receive from subsequent and more cruel occurrences . What [they]404-them gave [me]0-i above all was just the sinister figure of [the living man]406-the living man — [the dead one]407-the dead one would keep awhile!—and of the months [he]406-the living man had continuously passed at [Bly]13-bly , which , added up , made a formidable stretch . The limit of this evil time had arrived only when , on the dawn of a winter ’s morning , [Peter Quint]22-quint was found , by [a laborer going to early work]408-a laborer going to early work , stone dead on [the road]409-the road from [the village]336-the village : a catastrophe explained — superficially at least — by a visible wound to [his]22-quint head ; such a wound as might have been produced — and as , on the final evidence , _ had _ been — by a fatal slip , in the dark and after leaving [the public house]411-the public house , on [the steepish icy slope]412-the steepish icy slope , a wrong path altogether , at the bottom of which [he]22-quint lay . [The icy slope]413-the icy slope , the turn mistaken at night and in liquor , accounted for much — practically , in the end and after the inquest and boundless chatter , for everything ; but there had been matters in [his]22-quint life — strange passages and perils , secret disorders , vices more than suspected — that would have accounted for a good deal more .

[I]0-i scarce know how to put [my]0-i story into words that shall be a credible picture of [my]0-i state of mind ; but [I]0-i was in these days literally able to find a joy in the extraordinary flight of heroism the occasion demanded of [me]0-i . [I]0-i now saw that [I]0-i had been asked for a service admirable and difficult ; and there would be a greatness in letting it be seen — oh , in the right quarter!—that [I]0-i could succeed where many [another girl]414-another girl might have failed . It was an immense help to [me]0-i — [I]0-i confess [I]0-i rather applaud [myself]0-i as [I]0-i look back!—that [I]0-i saw [my]0-i service so strongly and so simply . [I]0-i was there to protect and defend [the little creatures in [the world]185-the world [the most bereaved and the most lovable]417-the most bereaved and the most lovable , the appeal of whose helplessness had suddenly become only too explicit , a deep , constant ache of one ’s own committed heart]415-the little creatures in the world the most bereaved and the most lovable , the appeal of whose helplessness had suddenly become only too explicit , a deep , constant ache of one ’s own committed heart . [We]418-we were cut off , really , together ; [we]418-we were united in [our]418-we danger . [They]419-them had nothing but [me]0-i , and [I]0-i — well , [I]0-i had _ [them]419-them _ . It was in short a magnificent chance . This chance presented itself to [me]0-i in an image richly material . [I]0-i was a screen — [I]0-i was to stand before [them]419-them . The more [I]0-i saw , the less [they]419-them would . [I]0-i began to watch [them]419-them in a stifled suspense , a disguised excitement that might well , had it continued too long , have turned to something like madness . What saved [me]0-i , as [I]0-i now see , was that it turned to something else altogether . It did n’t last as suspense — it was superseded by horrible proofs . Proofs , [I]0-i say , yes — from the moment [I]0-i really took hold .

This moment dated from an afternoon hour that [I]0-i happened to spend in [the grounds]250-the grounds with [the younger of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils alone]421-the younger of my pupils alone . [We]423-we had left Miles indoors , on the red cushion of a deep window seat ; [he]421-the younger of my pupils alone had wished to finish a book , and [I]0-i had been glad to encourage a purpose so laudable in [a young man whose only defect was an occasional excess of the restless]424-a young man whose only defect was an occasional excess of the restless . [[His]421-the younger of my pupils alone sister]425-his sister , on the contrary , had been alert to come out , and [I]0-i strolled with [her]425-his sister half an hour , seeking the shade , for the sun was still high and the day exceptionally warm . [I]0-i was aware afresh , with [her]425-his sister , as [we]423-we went , of how , like [[her]425-his sister brother]426-her brother , [she]425-his sister contrived — it was the charming thing in [both children]427-both children — to let [me]0-i alone without appearing to drop [me]0-i and to accompany [me]0-i without appearing to surround . [They]427-both children were never importunate and yet never listless . [My]0-i attention to [them]427-both children all really went to seeing [them]427-both children amuse [themselves]427-both children immensely without [me]0-i : this was a spectacle [they]427-both children seemed actively to prepare and that engaged [me]0-i as [an active admirer]428-an active admirer . [I]0-i walked in a world of [their]427-both children invention — [they]427-both children had no occasion whatever to draw upon [mine]0-i ; so that [my]0-i time was taken only with being , for [them]427-both children , [some remarkable person or thing that the game of the moment]429-some remarkable person or thing that the game of the moment required and that was merely , thanks to [[my]0-i superior]430-my superior , [my]0-i exalted stamp , a happy and highly distinguished sinecure . [I]0-i forget what [I]0-i was on the present occasion ; [I]0-i only remember that [I]0-i was something very important and very quiet and that [Flora]16-flora was playing very hard . [We]431-we were on [the edge of [the lake]433-the lake]432-the edge of the lake , and , as [we]431-we had lately begun geography , [the lake]433-the lake was [the Sea of Azof]435-the sea of azof .

Suddenly , in these circumstances , [I]0-i became aware that , on [the other side of [the Sea of Azof]7-the sea of azof]436-the other side of the sea of azof , [we]431-we had [an interested spectator]437-an interested spectator . The way this knowledge gathered in [me]0-i was the strangest thing in [the world]185-the world — the strangest , that is , except the very much stranger in which it quickly merged itself . [I]0-i had sat down with a piece of work — for [I]0-i was something or other that could sit — on the old stone bench which overlooked [the pond]439-the pond ; and in this position [I]0-i began to take in with certitude , and yet without direct vision , the presence , at a distance , of [a third person]440-a third person . The old trees , the thick shrubbery , made a great and pleasant shade , but it was all suffused with the brightness of the hot , still hour . There was no ambiguity in anything ; none whatever , at least , in the conviction [I]0-i from one moment to another found [myself]0-i forming as to what [I]0-i should see straight before [me]0-i and across [the lake]433-the lake as a consequence of raising [my]0-i eyes . [They]442-they were attached at this juncture to the stitching in which [I]0-i was engaged , and [I]0-i can feel once more the spasm of [my]0-i effort not to move them till [I]0-i should so have steadied [myself]0-i as to be able to make up [my]0-i mind what to do . There was an alien object in view — a figure whose right of presence [I]0-i instantly , passionately questioned . [I]0-i recollect counting over perfectly the possibilities , reminding [myself]0-i that nothing was more natural , for instance , then the appearance of [one of [the men about [the place]1030-the place]444-the men about the place , or even of [a messenger]446-a messenger , [a postman]447-a postman , or [[a tradesman]448-a tradesman ’s boy]449-a tradesman ’s boy , from [the village]336-the village]443-one of the men about the place , or even of a messenger , a postman , or a tradesman ’s boy , from the village . That reminder had as little effect on [my]0-i practical certitude as [I]0-i was conscious — still even without looking — of its having upon the character and attitude of [[our]451-our visitor]452-our visitor . Nothing was more natural than that these things should be the other things that they absolutely were not .

Of the positive identity of [the apparition]453-the apparition [I]0-i would assure [myself]0-i as soon as the small clock of [my]0-i courage should have ticked out the right second ; meanwhile , with an effort that was already sharp enough , [I]0-i transferred [my]0-i eyes straight to [little Flora]16-flora , who , at the moment , was about ten yards away . [My]0-i heart had stood still for an instant with the wonder and terror of the question whether [she]16-flora too would see ; and [I]0-i held [my]0-i breath while [I]0-i waited for what a cry from [her]16-flora , what some sudden innocent sign either of interest or of alarm , would tell [me]0-i . [I]0-i waited , but nothing came ; then , in the first place — and there is something more dire in this , [I]0-i feel , than in anything [I]0-i have to relate — [I]0-i was determined by a sense that , within a minute , all sounds from [her]16-flora had previously dropped ; and , in the second , by the circumstance that , also within the minute , [she]16-flora had , in [her]16-flora play , turned [her]16-flora back to [the water]454-the water . This was [her]16-flora attitude when [I]0-i at last looked at [her]16-flora — looked with the confirmed conviction that [we]455-we were still , together , under direct personal notice . [She]16-flora had picked up a small flat piece of wood , which happened to have in it a little hole that had evidently suggested to [her]16-flora the idea of sticking in another fragment that might figure as a mast and make the thing [a boat]456-a boat . This second morsel , as [I]0-i watched [her]16-flora , [she]16-flora was very markedly and intently attempting to tighten in its place . [My]0-i apprehension of what [she]16-flora was doing sustained [me]0-i so that after some seconds [I]0-i felt [I]0-i was ready for more . Then [I]0-i again shifted [my]0-i eyes — [I]0-i faced what [I]0-i had to face .

VII

[I]0-i got hold of [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose as soon after this as [I]0-i could ; and [I]0-i can give no intelligible account of how [I]0-i fought out the interval . Yet [I]0-i still hear [myself]0-i cry as [I]0-i fairly threw [myself]0-i into [her]14-mrs. grose arms : “ [They]1164-they _ know_—it ’s too monstrous : [they]1164-they know , [they]1164-they know ! ”[0-i]

“ And what on earth — ? ”[14-mrs. grose] [I]0-i felt [her]14-mrs. grose incredulity as [she]14-mrs. grose held [me]0-i .

“ Why , all that _ [we]1165-we _ know — and heaven knows what else besides ! ”[14-mrs. grose] Then , as [she]14-mrs. grose released [me]0-i , [I]0-i made it out to [her]14-mrs. grose , made it out perhaps only now with full coherency even to [myself]0-i . “ Two hours ago , in the garden”—I[14-mrs. grose] could scarce articulate—“Flora _ saw ! _ ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose took it as [she]14-mrs. grose might have taken a blow in the stomach . “ [She]14-mrs. grose has told [you]0-i ? ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose panted .

“ Not a word — that ’s the horror . [She]14-mrs. grose kept it to [herself]14-mrs. grose ! [The child of eight]1166-the child of eight , _ [that _ child]1167-that _ child ! ”[14-mrs. grose] Unutterable still , for [me]0-i , was the stupefaction of it .

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , of course , could only gape the wider . “ Then how do [you]0-i know ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [I]14-mrs. grose was there — [I]14-mrs. grose saw with [my]14-mrs. grose eyes : saw that [she]14-mrs. grose was perfectly aware . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Do [you]0-i mean aware of _ [him]1167-that _ child ? _ ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ No — of _ [her]14-mrs. grose _ . ”[14-mrs. grose] [I]0-i was conscious as [I]0-i spoke that [I]0-i looked prodigious things , for [I]0-i got the slow reflection of them in [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion ’s face . “ [Another person]1168-another person — this time ; but [a figure of quite as unmistakable horror and evil]1169-a figure of quite as unmistakable horror and evil : [a woman in black , pale and dreadful — with such an air also]1170-a woman in black , pale and dreadful — with such an air also , and such a face!—on [the other side of [the lake]433-the lake]1171-the other side of the lake . [I]239-my companion was there with [the child]1015-the child — quiet for the hour ; and in the midst of it [she]14-mrs. grose came . ”[239-my companion]

“ Came how — from where ? ”[0-i]

“ From where [they]1174-they come from ! [She]14-mrs. grose just appeared and stood there — but not so near . ”[239-my companion]

“ And without coming nearer ? ”[0-i]

“ Oh , for the effect and the feeling , [she]14-mrs. grose might have been as close as [you]0-i ! ”[239-my companion]

[[My]0-i friend]219-my friend , with an odd impulse , fell back a step . “ Was [she]14-mrs. grose someone [you]0-i ’ve never seen ? ”[219-my friend]

“ Yes . But someone [the child]1015-the child has . Someone _ [you]0-i _ have . ”[0-i] Then , to show how [I]0-i had thought it all out : “ [[My]0-i predecessor]1176-my predecessor — the one who died . ”[0-i]

“ [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel ? ”[0-i]

“ [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel . [You]0-i do n’t believe [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i pressed .

[She]219-my friend turned right and left in [her]219-my friend distress . “ How can [you]0-i be sure ? ”[219-my friend]

This drew from [me]0-i , in the state of [my]0-i nerves , a flash of impatience . “ Then ask [Flora—_she]219-my friend ’s _ sure ! ”[14-mrs. grose] But [I]0-i had no sooner spoken than [I]0-i caught [myself]0-i up . “ No , for [God]12-god ’s sake , _ do n’t ! _ [She]219-my friend ’ll say [she]219-my friend isn’t — [she’ll]219-my friend lie ! ”[0-i]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose was not too bewildered instinctively to protest . “ Ah , how _ can _ [you]0-i ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Because [I]14-mrs. grose ’m clear . [Flora]16-flora does n’t want [me]14-mrs. grose to know . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ It ’s only then to spare [you]0-i . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ No , no — there are depths , depths ! The more [I]14-mrs. grose go over it , the more [I]14-mrs. grose see in it , and the more [I]14-mrs. grose see in it , the more [I]14-mrs. grose fear . [I]14-mrs. grose do n’t know what [I]14-mrs. grose _ do n’t _ see — what [I]14-mrs. grose _ do n’t _ fear ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose tried to keep up with [me]0-i . “ [You]14-mrs. grose mean [you]14-mrs. grose ’re afraid of seeing [her]16-flora again ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Oh , no ; that ’s nothing — now ! ”[0-i] Then [I]0-i explained . “ It ’s of _ not _ seeing [her]16-flora . ”[0-i]

But [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion only looked wan . “ [I]239-my companion do n’t understand [you]14-mrs. grose . ”[239-my companion]

“ Why , it ’s that [the child]1015-the child may keep it up — and that [the child]1015-the child assuredly _ will_—without [my]14-mrs. grose knowing it . ”[14-mrs. grose]

At the image of this possibility [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose for a moment collapsed , yet presently to pull [herself]14-mrs. grose together again , as if from the positive force of the sense of what , should [we]460-we yield an inch , there would really be to give way to . “ [Dear]1179-dear , [dear]1179-dear — [we]460-we must keep [our]460-we heads ! And after all , if [she]16-flora does n’t mind it — ! ”[14-mrs. grose] [She]14-mrs. grose even tried a grim joke . “ Perhaps [she]16-flora likes it ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Likes _ such _ things — a scrap of [an infant]1181-an infant ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Is n’t it just a proof of [her]16-flora blessed innocence ? ”[219-my friend] [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend bravely inquired .

[She]14-mrs. grose brought [me]0-i , for the instant , almost round . “ Oh , [we]460-we must clutch at _ that_—we must cling to it ! If it is n’t a proof of what [you]0-i say , it ’s a proof of — God knows what ! For [the woman]1182-the woman ’s a horror of horrors . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , at this , fixed [her]14-mrs. grose eyes a minute on the ground ; then at last raising them , “ Tell [me]14-mrs. grose how [you]0-i know , ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose said .

“ Then [you]219-my friend admit it ’s what [she]16-flora was ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i cried .

“ Tell [me]219-my friend how [you]0-i know , ”[219-my friend] [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend simply repeated .

“ Know ? By seeing [her]16-flora ! By the way [she]16-flora looked . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ At [you]219-my friend , do [you]219-my friend mean — so wickedly ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Dear [me]14-mrs. grose , no — [I]14-mrs. grose could have borne that . [She]16-flora gave [me]14-mrs. grose never a glance . [She]16-flora only fixed [the child]1015-the child . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose tried to see it . “ Fixed [her]16-flora ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Ah , with such awful eyes ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

[She]14-mrs. grose stared at [mine]0-i as if they might really have resembled [them]463-them . “ Do [you]219-my friend mean of dislike ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ God help [us]1184-us , no . Of something much worse . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Worse than [dislike?”—this]29-dislike?”—this[14-mrs. grose] left [her]14-mrs. grose indeed at a loss .

“ With a determination — indescribable . With a kind of fury of intention . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i made [her]14-mrs. grose turn pale . “ Intention ? ”[0-i]

“ To get hold of [her]16-flora . ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose — [her]14-mrs. grose eyes just lingering on [mine]0-i — gave a shudder and walked to the window ; and while [she]14-mrs. grose stood there looking out [I]0-i completed [my]0-i statement . “ _ That ’s _ what [Flora]16-flora knows . ”[0-i]

After a little [she]14-mrs. grose turned round . “ [The person]1185-the person was in black , [you]0-i say ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ In mourning — rather poor , almost shabby . [She]14-mrs. grose slowly came back to [me]0-i . “ [Miss Jessel—_was]1186-miss jessel—_was _ infamous . ”[14-mrs. grose] [She]14-mrs. grose once more took [my]0-i hand in both [her]14-mrs. grose own , holding it as tight as if to fortify [me]0-i against the increase of alarm [I]0-i might draw from this disclosure . “ [They]1187-their were both infamous , ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose finally said .

So , for a little , [we]464-we faced it once more together ; and [I]0-i found absolutely a degree of help in seeing it now so straight . “ [I]0-i appreciate , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ the great decency of [your]14-mrs. grose not having hitherto spoken ; but the time has certainly come to give [me]0-i the whole thing . ”[0-i] [She]14-mrs. grose appeared to assent to this , but still only in silence ; seeing which [I]0-i went on : “ [I]0-i must have it now . “ There was everything . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ In spite of the difference — ? ”[0-i]

“ Oh , of [their]1187-their rank , [their]1187-their condition”—she[14-mrs. grose] brought it woefully out . “ _ [She]14-mrs. grose _ was [a lady]1188-a lady . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ And [he]239-my companion so dreadfully below , ”[14-mrs. grose] said [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose .

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose considered as if it were perhaps a little a case for a sense of shades . “ [I]14-mrs. grose ’ve never seen one like [him]1190-the fellow . [He]1190-the fellow did what [he]1190-the fellow wished . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ With _ [her]28-miss jessel ? _ ”[14-mrs. grose]

It was as if now in [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend ’s own eyes [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel had again appeared . [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s face signified that it had been indeed , but [she]14-mrs. grose said at the same time : “ [Poor woman]1191-poor woman — [she]14-mrs. grose paid for it ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Not so dreadful as what _ [I]0-i _ do , ”[0-i] [I]0-i replied ; on which [I]0-i must have shown [her]475-her — as [I]0-i was indeed but too conscious — a front of miserable defeat . It ’s far worse than [I]0-i dreamed — they’re lost ! ”[0-i]

[VIII]30-viii

What [I]0-i had said to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose was true enough : there were in the matter [I]0-i had put before [her]14-mrs. grose depths and possibilities that [I]0-i lacked resolution to sound ; so that when [we]476-we met once more in the wonder of it [we]476-we were of a common mind about the duty of resistance to extravagant fancies . [We]476-we were to keep [our]476-we heads if [we]476-we should keep nothing else — difficult indeed as that might be in the face of what , in [our]476-we prodigious experience , was least to be questioned . Late that night , while [the house]153-the house slept , [we]476-we had another talk in [[my]0-i room]177-my room , when [she]14-mrs. grose went all the way with [me]0-i as to its being beyond doubt that [I]0-i had seen exactly what [I]0-i had seen . To hold [her]14-mrs. grose perfectly in the pinch of that , [I]0-i found [I]0-i had only to ask [her]14-mrs. grose how , if [I]0-i had “ made it up , ”[0-i] [I]0-i came to be able to give , of each of [the persons appearing to [me]0-i]479-the persons appearing to me , a picture disclosing , to the last detail , [their]479-the persons appearing to me special marks — a portrait on the exhibition of which [she]14-mrs. grose had instantly recognized and named them . [She]14-mrs. grose wished of course — small blame to [her!—to]480-her!—to sink the whole subject ; and [I]0-i was quick to assure [her]14-mrs. grose that [my]0-i own interest in it had now violently taken the form of a search for the way to escape from it . [I]0-i encountered [her]14-mrs. grose on the ground of a probability that with recurrence — for recurrence [we]481-we took for granted — [I]0-i should get used to [my]0-i danger , distinctly professing that [my]0-i personal exposure had suddenly become the least of [my]0-i discomforts . It was [my]0-i new suspicion that was intolerable ; and yet even to this complication the later hours of the day had brought a little ease .

On leaving [her]14-mrs. grose , after [my]0-i first outbreak , [I]0-i had of course returned to [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils , associating the right remedy for [my]0-i dismay with that sense of [their]168-my pupils charm which [I]0-i had already found to be a thing [I]0-i could positively cultivate and which had never failed [me]0-i yet . [I]0-i had simply , in other words , plunged afresh into [Flora]16-flora ’s special society and there become aware — it was almost a luxury!—that [she]14-mrs. grose could put [her]14-mrs. grose little conscious hand straight upon the spot that ached . [She]14-mrs. grose had looked at [me]0-i in sweet speculation and then had accused [me]0-i to [my]0-i face of having “ cried . ”[14-mrs. grose] [I]0-i had supposed [I]0-i had brushed away the ugly signs : but [I]0-i could literally — for the time , at all events — rejoice , under this fathomless charity , that they had not entirely disappeared . To gaze into the depths of blue of [the child]1015-the child ’s eyes and pronounce [their]1015-the child loveliness a trick of premature cunning was to be guilty of a cynicism in preference to which [I]0-i naturally preferred to abjure [my]0-i judgment and , so far as might be , [my]0-i agitation . [I]0-i could n’t abjure for merely wanting to , but [I]0-i could repeat to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose — as [I]0-i did [there]1025-there , over and over , in the small hours — that with [their]1015-the child voices in the air , [their]1015-the child pressure on one ’s heart , and [their]1015-the child fragrant faces against one ’s cheek , everything fell to the ground but [their]1015-the child incapacity and [their]1015-the child beauty . It was a pity that , somehow , to settle this once for all , [I]0-i had equally to re - enumerate the signs of subtlety that , in the afternoon , by [the lake]433-the lake had made a miracle of [my]0-i show of self - possession . It was a pity to be obliged to reinvestigate the certitude of the moment itself and repeat how it had come to [me]0-i as a revelation that the inconceivable communion [I]0-i then surprised was a matter , for [either party]486-either party , of habit . It was a pity that [I]0-i should have had to quaver out again the reasons for [my]0-i not having , in [my]0-i delusion , so much as questioned that [the little girl]125-the little girl saw [[our]488-our visitant]489-our visitant even as [I]0-i actually saw [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose [herself]14-mrs. grose , and that [she]14-mrs. grose wanted , by just so much as [she]14-mrs. grose did thus see , to make [me]0-i suppose [she]14-mrs. grose did n’t , and at the same time , without showing anything , arrive at a guess as to whether [I]0-i [myself]0-i did ! It was a pity that [I]0-i needed once more to describe the portentous little activity by which [she]14-mrs. grose sought to divert [my]0-i attention — the perceptible increase of movement , the greater intensity of play , the singing , the gabbling of nonsense , and the invitation to romp .

Yet if [I]0-i had not indulged , to prove there was nothing in it , in this review , [I]0-i should have missed the two or three dim elements of comfort that still remained to [me]0-i . [I]0-i should not for instance have been able to asseverate to [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend that [I]0-i was certain — which was so much to the good — that _ [I]0-i _ at least had not betrayed [myself]0-i . [I]0-i should not have been prompted , by stress of need , by desperation of mind — [I]0-i scarce know what to call it — to invoke such further aid to intelligence as might spring from pushing [[my]0-i colleague]223-my colleague fairly to the wall . [She]14-mrs. grose had told [me]0-i , bit by bit , under pressure , a great deal ; but a small shifty spot on the wrong side of it all still sometimes brushed [my]0-i brow like the wing of a bat ; and [I]0-i remember how on this occasion — for [the sleeping house]492-the sleeping house and the concentration alike of [our]493-our danger and [our]493-our watch seemed to help — [I]0-i felt the importance of giving the last jerk to the curtain . “ [I]0-i do n’t believe anything so horrible , ”[0-i] [I]0-i recollect saying ; “ no , let [us]493-our put it definitely , [[my]0-i dear]1145-my dear , that [I]0-i do n’t . But if [I]0-i did , [you]1145-my dear know , there ’s a thing [I]0-i should require now , just without sparing [you]1145-my dear the least bit more — oh , not a scrap , come!—to get out of [you]1145-my dear . What was it [you]1145-my dear had in mind when , in [our]493-our distress , before [Miles]15-miles came back , over the letter from [[his]15-miles school]1054-his school , [you]1145-my dear said , under [my]0-i insistence , that [you]1145-my dear did n’t pretend for [him]15-miles that [he]15-miles had not literally _ ever _ been ‘ bad ’ ? It was a dreadfully austere inquiry , but levity was not [our]494-our note , and , at any rate , before the gray dawn admonished [us]494-our to separate [I]0-i had got [my]0-i answer . What [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend had had in mind proved to be immensely to the purpose . It was neither more nor less than the circumstance that for a period of several months [Quint]22-quint and [the boy]1078-the boy had been perpetually together . It was in fact the very appropriate truth that [she]219-my friend had ventured to criticize the propriety , to hint at the incongruity , of so close an alliance , and even to go so far on the subject as a frank overture to [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel . [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel had , with a most strange manner , requested [her]219-my friend to mind [her]219-my friend business , and [the good woman]497-the good woman had , on this , directly approached [little Miles]15-miles . [I]0-i pressed again , of course , at this . “ [You]219-my friend reminded [him]15-miles that [Quint]22-quint was only [a base menial]1197-a base menial ? ”[0-i]

“ As [you]219-my friend might say ! And it was [his]15-miles answer , for one thing , that was bad . ”[0-i]

“ And for another thing ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i waited . “ [He]15-miles repeated [your]219-my friend words to [Quint]22-quint ? ”[0-i]

“ No , not that . Only , put it to [me]0-i again ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i cried in a way that made [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend stare . “ There are directions in which [I]0-i must not for the present let [myself]0-i go . ”[0-i] Meanwhile [I]0-i returned to [her]14-mrs. grose first example — the one to which [she]14-mrs. grose had just previously referred — of [the boy]1078-the boy ’s happy capacity for an occasional slip . “ If [Quint]22-quint — on [your]14-mrs. grose remonstrance at the time [you]14-mrs. grose speak of — was a base menial , one of the things [Miles]15-miles said to [you]14-mrs. grose , [I]14-mrs. grose find [myself]14-mrs. grose guessing , was that [you]14-mrs. grose were another . ”[14-mrs. grose] Again [her]14-mrs. grose admission was so adequate that [I]0-i continued : “ And [you]14-mrs. grose forgave [him]1078-the boy that ? ”[0-i]

“ Would n’t _ [you]14-mrs. grose ? _ ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Oh , yes ! ”[503-we] And [we]503-we exchanged there , in the stillness , a sound of the oddest amusement . Then [I]0-i went on : “ At all events , while [he]1078-the boy was with [the man]1148-the man — ”[0-i]

“ [Miss Flora]16-flora was with [the woman]1182-the woman . It suited [them]1211-them all ! ”[0-i]

It suited [me]0-i , too , [I]0-i felt , only too well ; by which [I]0-i mean that it suited exactly the particularly deadly view [I]0-i was in the very act of forbidding [myself]0-i to entertain . But [I]0-i so far succeeded in checking the expression of this view that [I]0-i will throw , just here , no further light on it than may be offered by the mention of [my]0-i final observation to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose . “ [His]1078-the boy having lied and been impudent are , [I]0-i confess , less engaging specimens than [I]0-i had hoped to have from [you]219-my friend of the outbreak in [him]1078-the boy of [the little natural man]1212-the little natural man . Still , ”[0-i] [I]0-i mused , “ [They]1213-they must do , for [they]1213-they make [me]0-i feel more than ever that [I]0-i must watch . ”[0-i]

It made [me]0-i blush , the next minute , to see in [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend ’s face how much more unreservedly [she]219-my friend had forgiven [him]505-him than [her]219-my friend anecdote struck [me]0-i as presenting to [my]0-i own tenderness an occasion for doing . This came out when , at [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom door , [she]219-my friend quitted [me]0-i . “ Surely [you]0-i do n’t accuse _ [him]505-him _ — ”[219-my friend]

“ Of carrying on an intercourse that [he]505-him conceals from [me]219-my friend ? Ah , remember that , until further evidence , [I]219-my friend now accuse [nobody]1017-nobody . ”[219-my friend] Then , before shutting [her]219-my friend out to go , by another passage , to [her]219-my friend own place , “ [I]0-i must just wait , ”[0-i] [I]0-i wound up .

[IX]31-ix

[I]0-i waited and waited , and the days , as they elapsed , took something from [my]0-i consternation . A very few of [them]507-they , in fact , passing , in constant sight of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils , without a fresh incident , sufficed to give to grievous fancies and even to odious memories a kind of brush of the sponge . [I]0-i have spoken of the surrender to [their]507-they extraordinary childish grace as a thing [I]0-i could actively cultivate , and it may be imagined if [I]0-i neglected now to address [myself]0-i to this source for whatever it would yield . Stranger than [I]0-i can express , certainly , was the effort to struggle against [my]0-i new lights ; it would doubtless have been , however , a greater tension still had it not been so frequently successful . [I]0-i used to wonder how [my]0-i little charges could help guessing that [I]0-i thought strange things about [them]507-they ; and the circumstances that these things only made them more interesting was not by itself a direct aid to keeping [them]507-they in the dark . [I]0-i trembled lest [they]507-they should see that [they]507-they _ were _ so immensely more interesting . Putting things at the worst , at all events , as in meditation [I]0-i so often did , any clouding of [their]507-they innocence could only be — blameless and foredoomed as they were — a reason the more for taking risks . There were moments when , by an irresistible impulse , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i catching them up and pressing them to [my]0-i heart . As soon as [I]0-i had done so [I]0-i used to say to [myself]0-i : “ What will [they]507-they think of that ? Does n’t it betray too much ? ”[0-i] It would have been easy to get into a sad , wild tangle about how much [I]0-i might betray ; but the real account , [I]0-i feel , of the hours of peace that [I]0-i could still enjoy was that the immediate charm of [[my]0-i companions]249-my companions was a beguilement still effective even under the shadow of the possibility that it was studied . For if it occurred to [me]0-i that [I]0-i might occasionally excite suspicion by the little outbreaks of [my]0-i sharper passion for [them]507-they , so too [I]0-i remember wondering if [I]0-i might n’t see a queerness in the traceable increase of [their]507-they own demonstrations .

[They]507-they were at this period extravagantly and preternaturally fond of [me]0-i ; which , after all , [I]0-i could reflect , was no more than a graceful response in [children perpetually bowed over and hugged]510-children perpetually bowed over and hugged . The homage of which [they]507-they were so lavish succeeded , in truth , for [my]0-i nerves , quite as well as if [I]0-i never appeared to [myself]0-i , as [I]0-i may say , literally to catch [them]507-they at a purpose in it . [They]507-they had never , [I]0-i think , wanted to do so many things for [[their]507-they poor protectress]511-their poor protectress ; [I]0-i mean — though [they]507-they got [their]507-they lessons better and better , which was naturally what would please [her]511-their poor protectress most — in the way of diverting , entertaining , surprising [her]511-their poor protectress ; reading [her]511-their poor protectress passages , telling [her]511-their poor protectress stories , acting [her]511-their poor protectress charades , pouncing out at [her]511-their poor protectress , in disguises , as animals and [historical characters]512-historical characters , and above all astonishing [her]511-their poor protectress by the “ pieces ”[507-they] [they]507-they had secretly got by heart and could interminably recite . [I]0-i should never get to the bottom — were [I]0-i to let [myself]0-i go even now — of the prodigious private commentary , all under still more private correction , with which , in these days , [I]0-i overscored [their]507-they full hours . [They]507-they had shown [me]0-i from the first a facility for everything , a general faculty which , taking a fresh start , achieved remarkable flights . [They]507-they got [their]507-they little tasks as if [they]507-they loved [them]507-they , and indulged , from the mere exuberance of the gift , in the most unimposed little miracles of memory . [They]507-they not only popped out at [me]0-i as [tigers]513-tigers and as [Romans]514-romans , but as [Shakespeareans]515-shakespeareans , [astronomers]516-astronomers , and [navigators]517-navigators . This was so singularly the case that it had presumably much to do with the fact as to which , at the present day , [I]0-i am at a loss for a different explanation : [I]0-i allude to [my]0-i unnatural composure on the subject of [another school for [Miles]15-miles]518-another school for miles . What [I]0-i remember is that [I]0-i was content not , for the time , to open the question , and that contentment must have sprung from the sense of [his]519-his perpetually striking show of cleverness . [He]519-his was too clever for [a bad governess]520-a bad governess , for [[a parson]521-a parson ’s daughter]522-a parson ’s daughter , to spoil ; and the strangest if not the brightest thread in the pensive embroidery [I]0-i just spoke of was the impression [I]0-i might have got , if [I]0-i had dared to work it out , that [he]519-his was under some influence operating in [his]519-his small intellectual life as a tremendous incitement .

If it was easy to reflect , however , that [such a boy]523-such a boy could postpone school , it was at least as marked that for [such a boy]523-such a boy to have been “ kicked out ”[525-a schoolmaster] by [a schoolmaster]525-a schoolmaster was a mystification without end . Let [me]0-i add that in [their]526-them company now — and [I]0-i was careful almost never to be out of it — [I]0-i could follow no scent very far . [We]527-we lived in a cloud of music and love and success and private theatricals . The musical sense in [each of [the children]1088-the children]528-each of the children was of the quickest , but [the elder in especial]530-the elder in especial had a marvelous knack of catching and repeating . The schoolroom piano broke into all gruesome fancies ; and when that failed there were confabulations in corners , with a sequel of one of [them]526-them going out in the highest spirits in order to “ come in ”[531-brothers] as something new . [I]0-i had had [brothers]531-brothers [myself]0-i , and it was no revelation to [me]0-i that [little girls]532-little girls could be [slavish idolaters of [little boys]534-little boys]533-slavish idolaters of little boys . What surpassed everything was that there was [a little boy in [the world]185-the world]535-a little boy in the world [who could have for the inferior age , sex , and intelligence so fine a consideration]537-who could have for the inferior age , sex , and intelligence so fine a consideration . [They]526-them were extraordinarily at one , and to say that [they]526-them never either quarreled or complained is to make the note of praise coarse for [their]526-them quality of sweetness . Sometimes , indeed , when [I]0-i dropped into coarseness , [I]0-i perhaps came across traces of little understandings between [them]526-them by which one of [them]526-them should keep [me]0-i occupied while the other slipped away . There is a _ naïf _ side , [I]0-i suppose , in all diplomacy ; but if [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils practiced upon [me]0-i , it was surely with the minimum of grossness . It was all in the other quarter that , after a lull , the grossness broke out .

[I]0-i find that [I]0-i really hang back ; but [I]0-i must take [my]0-i plunge . In going on with the record of what was hideous at Bly , [I]0-i not only challenge the most liberal faith — for which [I]0-i little care ; but — and this is another matter — [I]0-i renew what [I]0-i [myself]0-i suffered , [I]0-i again push [my]0-i way through it to the end . There came suddenly an hour after which , as [I]0-i look back , the affair seems to [me]0-i to have been all pure suffering ; but [I]0-i have at least reached the heart of it , and the straightest road out is doubtless to advance . One evening — with nothing to lead up or to prepare it — [I]0-i felt the cold touch of the impression that had breathed on [me]0-i the night of [my]0-i arrival and which , much lighter then , as [I]0-i have mentioned , [I]0-i should probably have made little of in memory had [my]0-i subsequent sojourn been less agitated . [I]0-i had not gone to bed ; [I]0-i sat reading by a couple of candles . There was a roomful of old books at Bly — last - century fiction , some of it , which , to the extent of a distinctly deprecated renown , but never to so much as that of a stray specimen , had reached [the sequestered home]539-the sequestered home and appealed to the unavowed curiosity of [my]0-i youth . [I]0-i remember that the book [I]0-i had in [my]0-i hand was [Fielding]32-fielding ’s _ Amelia _ ; also that [I]0-i was wholly awake . [I]0-i recall further both a general conviction that it was horribly late and a particular objection to looking at [my]0-i watch . [I]0-i figure , finally , that the white curtain draping , in the fashion of those days , the head of [[Flora]16-flora ’s little bed]540-flora ’s little bed , shrouded , as [I]0-i had assured [myself]0-i long before , the perfection of childish rest . [I]0-i recollect in short that , though [I]0-i was deeply interested in [[my]0-i author]541-my author , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i , at the turn of a page and with [his]541-my author spell all scattered , looking straight up from [him]541-my author and hard at the door of [[my]0-i room]177-my room . There was a moment during which [I]0-i listened , reminded of the faint sense [I]0-i had had , the first night , of there being something undefinably astir in [the house]153-the house , and noted the soft breath of the open casement just move the half - drawn blind . Then , with all the marks of a deliberation that must have seemed magnificent had there been [anyone to admire it]544-anyone to admire it , [I]0-i laid down [my]0-i book , rose to [my]0-i feet , and , taking a candle , went straight out of [the room]56-the room and , from [the passage]546-the passage , on which [my]0-i light made little impression , noiselessly closed and locked the door .

[I]0-i can say now neither what determined nor what guided [me]0-i , but [I]0-i went straight along [the lobby]547-the lobby , holding [my]0-i candle high , till [I]0-i came within sight of the tall window that presided over the great turn of the staircase . At this point [I]0-i precipitately found [myself]0-i aware of three things . They were practically simultaneous , yet they had flashes of succession . [My]0-i candle , under a bold flourish , went out , and [I]0-i perceived , by the uncovered window , that the yielding dusk of earliest morning rendered it unnecessary . Without it , the next instant , [I]0-i saw that there was [someone on the stair]548-someone on the stair . [I]0-i speak of sequences , but [I]0-i required no lapse of seconds to stiffen [myself]0-i for a third encounter with [Quint]22-quint . [The apparition]453-the apparition had reached the landing halfway up and was therefore on the spot nearest the window , where at sight of [me]0-i , it stopped short and fixed [me]0-i exactly as it had fixed [me]0-i from [the tower]1104-the tower and from [the garden]1027-the garden . [He]22-quint knew [me]0-i as well as [I]0-i knew [him]22-quint ; and so , in the cold , faint twilight , with a glimmer in the high glass and another on the polish of the oak stair below , [we]552-we faced [each other]284-each other in [our]552-we common intensity . [He]22-quint was absolutely , on this occasion , [a living , detestable , dangerous presence]554-a living , detestable , dangerous presence . But that was not the wonder of wonders ; [I]0-i reserve this distinction for quite another circumstance : the circumstance that dread had unmistakably quitted [me]0-i and that there was nothing in [me]0-i there that did n’t meet and measure [him]22-quint .

[I]0-i had plenty of anguish after that extraordinary moment , but [I]0-i had , thank [God]12-god , no terror . And [he]22-quint knew [I]0-i had not — [I]0-i found [myself]0-i at the end of an instant magnificently aware of this . [I]0-i felt , in a fierce rigor of confidence , that if [I]0-i stood [my]0-i ground a minute [I]0-i should cease — for the time , at least — to have [him]22-quint to reckon with ; and during the minute , accordingly , the thing was as human and hideous as a real interview : hideous just because it _ was _ human , as human as to have met alone , in the small hours , in [a sleeping house]555-a sleeping house , [some enemy]556-some enemy , [some adventurer]557-some adventurer , [some criminal]558-some criminal . It was the dead silence of [our]559-us long gaze at such close quarters that gave the whole horror , huge as it was , its only note of the unnatural . If [I]0-i had met [a murderer]560-a murderer in such a place and at such an hour , [we]559-us still at least would have spoken . Something would have passed , in life , between [us]559-us ; if nothing had passed , [one of [us]559-us]561-one of us would have moved . The moment was so prolonged that it would have taken but little more to make [me]0-i doubt if even _ [I]0-i _ were in life . [I]0-i ca n’t express what followed it save by saying that the silence itself — which was indeed in a manner an attestation of [my]0-i strength — became the element into which [I]0-i saw the figure disappear ; in which [I]0-i definitely saw it turn as [I]0-i might have seen [the low wretch to which it had once belonged turn on receipt of an order]562-the low wretch to which it had once belonged turn on receipt of an order , and pass , with [my]0-i eyes on the villainous back that no hunch could have more disfigured , straight down the staircase and into the darkness in which the next bend was lost .

X

[I]0-i remained awhile at the top of the stair , but with the effect presently of understanding that when [[my]0-i visitor]357-my visitor had gone , [he]357-my visitor had gone : then [I]0-i returned to [[my]0-i room]177-my room . The foremost thing [I]0-i saw there by the light of the candle [I]0-i had left burning was that [Flora]16-flora ’s little bed was empty ; and on this [I]0-i caught [my]0-i breath with all the terror that , five minutes before , [I]0-i had been able to resist . [I]0-i dashed at the place in which [I]0-i had left [her]16-flora lying and over which ( for the small silk counterpane and the sheets were disarranged ) the white curtains had been deceivingly pulled forward ; then [my]0-i step , to [my]0-i unutterable relief , produced an answering sound : [I]0-i perceived an agitation of the window blind , and [the child]1015-the child , ducking down , emerged rosily from the other side of [it]566-it . [She]16-flora stood there in so much of [her]16-flora candor and so little of [her]16-flora nightgown , with [her]16-flora pink bare feet and the golden glow of [her]16-flora curls . [She]16-flora looked intensely grave , and [I]0-i had never had such a sense of losing an advantage acquired ( the thrill of which had just been so prodigious ) as on [my]0-i consciousness that [she]16-flora addressed [me]0-i with a reproach . “ [You]0-i naughty : where _ have _ [you]0-i been?”—instead[16-flora] of challenging [her]16-flora own irregularity [I]0-i found [myself]0-i arraigned and explaining . [She]16-flora [herself]16-flora explained , for that matter , with the loveliest , eagerest simplicity . [She]16-flora had known suddenly , as [she]16-flora lay there , that [I]0-i was out of [the room]56-the room , and had jumped up to see what had become of [me]0-i . [I]0-i had dropped , with the joy of [her]16-flora reappearance , back into [my]0-i chair — feeling then , and then only , a little faint ; and [she]16-flora had pattered straight over to [me]0-i , thrown [herself]16-flora upon [my]0-i knee , given [herself]16-flora to be held with the flame of the candle full in the wonderful little face that was still flushed with sleep . [I]0-i remember closing [my]0-i eyes an instant , yieldingly , consciously , as before the excess of something beautiful that shone out of the blue of [her]16-flora own . “ [You]16-flora were looking for [me]0-i out of the window ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ [You]16-flora thought [I]0-i might be walking in [the grounds]250-the grounds ? ”[0-i]

“ Well , [you]16-flora know , [I]16-flora thought [someone]138-someone was”—she[16-flora] never blanched as [she]16-flora smiled out that at [me]0-i .

Oh , how [I]0-i looked at [her]16-flora now ! “ And did [you]16-flora see [anyone]1028-anyone ? ”[0-i]

“ Ah , _ no ! _ ”[16-flora] [she]16-flora returned , almost with the full privilege of childish inconsequence , resentfully , though with a long sweetness in [her]16-flora little drawl of the negative .

At that moment , in the state of [my]0-i nerves , [I]0-i absolutely believed [she]16-flora lied ; and if [I]0-i once more closed [my]0-i eyes it was before the dazzle of the three or four possible ways in which [I]0-i might take this up . One of these , for a moment , tempted [me]0-i with such singular intensity that , to withstand it , [I]0-i must have gripped [[my]0-i little girl]176-my little girl with a spasm that , wonderfully , [she]176-my little girl submitted to without a cry or a sign of fright . Why not break out at [her]16-flora on the spot and have it all over?—give it to [her]16-flora straight in [her]16-flora lovely little lighted face ? “ [You]16-flora see , [you]16-flora see , [you]16-flora _ know _ that [you]16-flora do and that [you]16-flora already quite suspect [I]569-i believe it ; therefore , why not frankly confess it to [me]569-i , so that [we]1218-we may at least live with it together and learn perhaps , in the strangeness of [our]1218-we fate , where [we]1218-we are and what it means ? ”[569-i] This solicitation dropped , alas , as it came : if [I]0-i could immediately have succumbed to it [I]0-i might have spared [myself]0-i — well , [you]569-i ’ll see what . Instead of succumbing [I]0-i sprang again to [my]0-i feet , looked at [her]16-flora bed , and took a helpless middle way . “ Why did [you]16-flora pull the curtain over [the place]1030-the place to make [me]0-i think [you]16-flora were still there ? ”[0-i]

[Flora]16-flora luminously considered ; after which , with [her]16-flora little divine smile : “ Because [I]16-flora do n’t like to frighten [you]0-i ! ”[16-flora]

“ But if [I]16-flora had , by [your]16-flora idea , gone out — ? ”[16-flora]

[She]16-flora absolutely declined to be puzzled ; [she]16-flora turned [her]16-flora eyes to the flame of the candle as if the question were as irrelevant , or at any rate as impersonal , as [Mrs. Marcet]33-mrs. marcet or nine - times - nine . “ Oh , but [you]0-i know , ”[16-flora] [she]16-flora quite adequately answered , “ that [you]0-i might come back , [[you]0-i dear]1220-you dear , and that [you]0-i _ have ! _ ”[16-flora] And after a little , when [she]16-flora had got into bed , [I]0-i had , for a long time , by almost sitting on [her]16-flora to hold [her]16-flora hand , to prove that [I]0-i recognized the pertinence of [my]0-i return .

[You]570-you may imagine the general complexion , from that moment , of [my]0-i nights . [I]0-i repeatedly sat up till [I]0-i did n’t know when ; [I]0-i selected moments when [[my]0-i roommate]571-my roommate unmistakably slept , and , stealing out , took noiseless turns in [the passage]546-the passage and even pushed as far as to where [I]0-i had last met [Quint]22-quint . But [I]0-i never met [him]22-quint there again ; and [I]0-i may as well say at once that [I]0-i on no other occasion saw [him]22-quint in [the house]153-the house . [I]0-i just missed , on the staircase , on the other hand , a different adventure . Looking down [it]574-it from the top [I]0-i once recognized the presence of [a woman]1020-a woman seated on one of the lower steps with [her]1020-a woman back presented to [me]0-i , [her]1020-a woman body half - bowed and [her]1020-a woman head , in an attitude of woe , in [her]1020-a woman hands . [I]0-i had been there but an instant , however , when [she]1020-a woman vanished without looking round at [me]0-i . [I]0-i knew , nonetheless , exactly what dreadful face [she]1020-a woman had to show ; and [I]0-i wondered whether , if instead of being above [I]0-i had been below , [I]0-i should have had , for going up , the same nerve [I]0-i had lately shown [Quint]22-quint . Well , there continued to be plenty of chance for nerve . On the eleventh night after [my]0-i latest encounter with [that gentleman]576-that gentleman — they were all numbered now — [I]0-i had an alarm that perilously skirted it and that indeed , from the particular quality of its unexpectedness , proved quite [my]0-i sharpest shock . It was precisely the first night during this series that , weary with watching , [I]0-i had felt that [I]0-i might again without laxity lay [myself]0-i down at [my]0-i old hour . [I]0-i slept immediately and , as [I]0-i afterward knew , till about one o’clock ; but when [I]0-i woke it was to sit straight up , as completely roused as if a hand had shook [me]0-i . [I]0-i had left a light burning , but it was now out , and [I]0-i felt an instant certainty that [Flora]16-flora had extinguished it . This brought [me]0-i to [my]0-i feet and straight , in the darkness , to [her]16-flora bed , which [I]0-i found [she]16-flora had left . A glance at the window enlightened [me]0-i further , and the striking of a match completed the picture .

[The child]1015-the child had again got up — this time blowing out the taper , and had again , for some purpose of observation or response , squeezed in behind the blind and was peering out into the night . That [she]1015-the child now saw — as [she]1015-the child had not , [I]0-i had satisfied [myself]0-i , the previous time — was proved to [me]0-i by the fact that [she]1015-the child was disturbed neither by [my]0-i reillumination nor by the haste [I]0-i made to get into slippers and into a wrap . Hidden , protected , absorbed , [she]1015-the child evidently rested on the sill — the casement opened forward — and gave [herself]1015-the child up . There was a great still moon to help [her]1015-the child , and this fact had counted in [my]0-i quick decision . [She]1015-the child was face to face with [the apparition [we]579-we had met at [the lake]433-the lake]578-the apparition we had met at the lake , and could now communicate with [it]578-the apparition we had met at the lake as [she]1015-the child had not then been able to do . What [I]0-i , on [my]0-i side , had to care for was , without disturbing [her]1015-the child , to reach , from [the corridor]581-the corridor , some other window in the same quarter . [I]0-i got to the door without [her]1015-the child hearing [me]0-i ; [I]0-i got out of it , closed it , and listened , from the other side , for some sound from [her]1015-the child . While [I]0-i stood in [the passage]546-the passage [I]0-i had [my]0-i eyes on [[her]1015-the child brother]426-her brother ’s door , which was but ten steps off and which , indescribably , produced in [me]0-i a renewal of the strange impulse that [I]0-i lately spoke of as [my]0-i temptation . What if [I]0-i should go straight in and march to _ [his]426-her brother _ window?—what if , by risking to [his]426-her brother boyish bewilderment a revelation of [my]0-i motive , [I]0-i should throw across the rest of the mystery the long halter of [my]0-i boldness ?

This thought held [me]0-i sufficiently to make [me]0-i cross to [his]426-her brother threshold and pause again . [I]0-i preternaturally listened ; [I]0-i figured to [myself]0-i what might portentously be ; [I]0-i wondered if [his]426-her brother bed were also empty and [he]426-her brother too were secretly at watch . It was a deep , soundless minute , at the end of which [my]0-i impulse failed . [He]426-her brother was quiet ; [he]426-her brother might be innocent ; the risk was hideous ; [I]0-i turned away . There was a figure in [the grounds]250-the grounds — [a figure prowling for a sight]585-a figure prowling for a sight , [the visitor with whom [Flora]16-flora was engaged]586-the visitor with whom flora was engaged ; but it was not [the visitor most concerned with [[my]0-i boy]588-my boy]587-the visitor most concerned with my boy . [I]0-i hesitated afresh , but on [other grounds]589-other grounds and only for a few seconds ; then [I]0-i had made [my]0-i choice . There were [empty rooms at [Bly]13-bly]590-empty rooms at bly , and it was only a question of choosing the right one . [The right one]591-the right one suddenly presented itself to [me]0-i as [the lower one — though high above [the gardens]593-the gardens]592-the lower one — though high above the gardens — in [the solid corner of [the house]153-the house that [I]0-i have spoken of as [the old tower]1102-the old tower]594-the solid corner of the house that i have spoken of as the old tower . [This]597-this was [a large , square chamber , arranged with some state as [a bedroom]599-a bedroom]598-a large , square chamber , arranged with some state as a bedroom , the extravagant size of which made [it]597-this so inconvenient that [it]597-this had not for years , though kept by [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose in exemplary order , been occupied . [I]0-i had often admired [it]597-this and [I]0-i knew [my]0-i way about in it ; [I]0-i had only , after just faltering at the first chill gloom of [its]597-this disuse , to pass across [it]597-this and unbolt as quietly as [I]0-i could one of the shutters . Achieving this transit , [I]0-i uncovered the glass without a sound and , applying [my]0-i face to the pane , was able , the darkness without being much less than within , to see that [I]0-i commanded the right direction . Then [I]0-i saw something more . The moon made the night extraordinarily penetrable and showed [me]0-i on [the lawn]1031-the lawn [a person , diminished by distance , who stood there motionless and as if fascinated]601-a person , diminished by distance , who stood there motionless and as if fascinated , looking up to where [I]0-i had appeared — looking , that is , not so much straight at [me]0-i as at something that was apparently above [me]0-i . There was clearly [another person above [me]0-i]602-another person above me — there was [a person on the tower]603-a person on the tower ; but the presence on [the lawn]1031-the lawn was not in the least what [I]0-i had conceived and had confidently hurried to meet . The presence on [the lawn]1031-the lawn — [I]0-i felt sick as [I]0-i made it out — was [poor little [Miles]15-miles [himself]15-miles]606-poor little miles himself .

XI

It was not till late next day that [I]0-i spoke to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ; the rigor with which [I]0-i kept [my]0-i pupils in sight making it often difficult to meet [her]14-mrs. grose privately , and the more as [we]607-we each felt the importance of not provoking — on the part of [the servants]299-the servants quite as much as on that of [the children]1088-the children — any suspicion of a secret flurry or that of a discussion of mysteries . [I]0-i drew a great security in this particular from [her]14-mrs. grose mere smooth aspect . There was nothing in [her]14-mrs. grose fresh face to pass on to others [my]0-i horrible confidences . [She]14-mrs. grose believed [me]0-i , [I]0-i was sure , absolutely : if [she]14-mrs. grose had n’t [I]0-i do n’t know what would have become of [me]0-i , for [I]0-i could n’t have borne the business alone . But [she]14-mrs. grose was a magnificent monument to the blessing of a want of imagination , and if [she]14-mrs. grose could see in [our]607-we little charges nothing but [their]610-their beauty and amiability , [their]610-their happiness and cleverness , [she]14-mrs. grose had no direct communication with the sources of [my]0-i trouble . If [they]610-their had been at all visibly blighted or battered , [she]14-mrs. grose would doubtless have grown , on tracing it back , haggard enough to match them ; as matters stood , however , [I]0-i could feel [her]14-mrs. grose , when [she]14-mrs. grose surveyed [them]610-their , with [her]14-mrs. grose large white arms folded and the habit of serenity in all [her]14-mrs. grose look , thank [the Lord]611-the lord ’s mercy that if they were ruined the pieces would still serve . Flights of fancy gave place , in [her]14-mrs. grose mind , to a steady fireside glow , and [I]0-i had already begun to perceive how , with the development of the conviction that — as time went on without a public accident — [[our]607-we young things]612-our young things could , after all , look out for [themselves]610-their , [she]14-mrs. grose addressed [her]14-mrs. grose greatest solicitude to the sad case presented by [[their]610-their instructress]613-their instructress . That , for [myself]0-i , was a sound simplification : [I]0-i could engage that , to [the world]185-the world , [my]0-i face should tell no tales , but it would have been , in the conditions , an immense added strain to find [myself]0-i anxious about [hers]14-mrs. grose .

At the hour [I]0-i now speak of [she]14-mrs. grose had joined [me]0-i , under pressure , on [the terrace]356-the terrace , where , with the lapse of the season , the afternoon sun was now agreeable ; and [we]607-we sat there together while , before [us]607-we , at a distance , but within call if [we]607-we wished , [the children]1088-the children strolled to and fro in one of [their]1088-the children most manageable moods . [They]1088-the children moved slowly , in unison , below [us]607-we , over [the lawn]1031-the lawn , [the boy]1078-the boy , as [they]1088-the children went , reading aloud from a storybook and passing [his]1078-the boy arm round [[his]1078-the boy sister]425-his sister to keep [her]425-his sister quite in touch . [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose watched [them]1088-the children with positive placidity ; then [I]0-i caught the suppressed intellectual creak with which [she]14-mrs. grose conscientiously turned to take from [me]0-i a view of the back of the tapestry . [I]0-i had made [her]14-mrs. grose a receptacle of lurid things , but there was an odd recognition of [my]0-i superiority — [my]0-i accomplishments and [my]0-i function — in [her]14-mrs. grose patience under [my]0-i pain . [She]14-mrs. grose offered [her]14-mrs. grose mind to [my]0-i disclosures as , had [I]0-i wished to mix [a witch]620-a witch ’s broth and proposed it with assurance , [she]14-mrs. grose would have held out a large clean saucepan . This had become thoroughly [her]14-mrs. grose attitude by the time that , in [my]0-i recital of the events of the night , [I]0-i reached the point of what [Miles]15-miles had said to [me]0-i when , after seeing [him]15-miles , at such a monstrous hour , almost on the very spot where [he]15-miles happened now to be , [I]0-i had gone down to bring [him]15-miles in ; choosing then , at the window , with a concentrated need of not alarming [the house]153-the house , rather that method than a signal more resonant . [I]0-i had left [her]14-mrs. grose meanwhile in little doubt of [my]0-i small hope of representing with success even to [her]14-mrs. grose actual sympathy [my]0-i sense of the real splendor of the little inspiration with which , after [I]0-i had got [him]15-miles into [the house]153-the house , [the boy]1078-the boy met [my]0-i final articulate challenge . As soon as [I]0-i appeared in the moonlight on [the terrace]356-the terrace , [he]15-miles had come to [me]0-i as straight as possible ; on which [I]0-i had taken [his]15-miles hand without a word and led [him]15-miles , through [the dark spaces]625-the dark spaces , up the staircase where [Quint]22-quint had so hungrily hovered for [him]15-miles , along [the lobby where [I]0-i had listened and trembled]626-the lobby where i had listened and trembled , and so to [[his]15-miles forsaken room]627-his forsaken room .

Not a sound , on the way , had passed between [us]628-us , and [I]0-i had wondered — oh , _ how _ [I]0-i had wondered!—if [he]15-miles were groping about in [his]15-miles little mind for something plausible and not too grotesque . It would tax [his]15-miles invention , certainly , and [I]0-i felt , this time , over [his]15-miles real embarrassment , a curious thrill of triumph . It was a sharp trap for the inscrutable ! [He]15-miles could n’t play any longer at innocence ; so how [the deuce]629-the deuce would [he]15-miles get out of it ? There beat in [me]0-i indeed , with the passionate throb of this question an equal dumb appeal as to how the deuce _ [I]0-i _ should . [I]0-i was confronted at last , as never yet , with all the risk attached even now to sounding [my]0-i own horrid note . [I]0-i remember in fact that as [we]628-us pushed into [[his]15-miles little chamber , where the bed had not been slept in at all and the window , uncovered to the moonlight]630-his little chamber , where the bed had not been slept in at all and the window , uncovered to the moonlight , made the place so clear that there was no need of striking a match — [I]0-i remember how [I]0-i suddenly dropped , sank upon the edge of the bed from the force of the idea that [he]15-miles must know how [he]15-miles really , as [they]631-they say , “ had ”[631-they] [me]0-i . [He]15-miles could do what [he]15-miles liked , with all [his]15-miles cleverness to help [him]15-miles , so long as [I]0-i should continue to defer to the old tradition of the criminality of [those caretakers of [the young who minister to superstitions and fears]633-the young who minister to superstitions and fears]632-those caretakers of the young who minister to superstitions and fears . [He]15-miles “ had ”[15-miles] [me]0-i indeed , and in a cleft stick ; for who would ever absolve [me]0-i , who would consent that [I]0-i should go unhung , if , by the faintest tremor of an overture , [I]0-i were the first to introduce into [our]634-our perfect intercourse an element so dire ? No , no : it was useless to attempt to convey to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , just as it is scarcely less so to attempt to suggest here , how , in [our]634-our short , stiff brush in the dark , [he]15-miles fairly shook [me]0-i with admiration . [I]0-i was of course thoroughly kind and merciful ; never , never yet had [I]0-i placed on [his]15-miles little shoulders hands of such tenderness as those with which , while [I]0-i rested against the bed , [I]0-i held [him]15-miles there well under fire . [I]0-i had no alternative but , in form at least , to put it to [him]15-miles .

“ [You]15-miles must tell [me]0-i now — and all the truth . What did [you]15-miles go out for ? What were [you]15-miles doing there ? ”[0-i]

[I]0-i can still see [his]15-miles wonderful smile , the whites of [his]15-miles beautiful eyes , and the uncovering of [his]15-miles little teeth shine to [me]0-i in the dusk . “ If [I]15-miles tell [you]15-miles why , will [you]15-miles understand ? ”[15-miles] [My]0-i heart , at this , leaped into [my]0-i mouth . _ Would _ [he]15-miles tell [me]0-i why ? [I]0-i found no sound on [my]0-i lips to press it , and [I]0-i was aware of replying only with a vague , repeated , grimacing nod . [He]15-miles was gentleness itself , and while [I]0-i wagged [my]0-i head at [him]15-miles [he]15-miles stood there more than ever [a little fairy prince]635-a little fairy prince . It was [his]15-miles brightness indeed that gave [me]0-i a respite . Would it be so great if [he]15-miles were really going to tell [me]0-i ? “ Well , ”[15-miles] [he]15-miles said at last , “ just exactly in order that [you]0-i should do this . ”[15-miles]

“ Do what ? ”[15-miles]

“ Think [me]15-miles — for a change—_bad ! _ ”[15-miles] [I]0-i shall never forget the sweetness and gaiety with which [he]15-miles brought out the word , nor how , on top of it , [he]15-miles bent forward and kissed [me]0-i . It was practically the end of everything . [I]0-i met [his]15-miles kiss and [I]0-i had to make , while [I]0-i folded [him]15-miles for a minute in [my]0-i arms , the most stupendous effort not to cry . [He]15-miles had given exactly the account of [himself]15-miles that permitted least of [my]0-i going behind it , and it was only with the effect of confirming [my]0-i acceptance of it that , as [I]0-i presently glanced about [the room]56-the room , [I]0-i could say —

“ Then [you]15-miles did n’t undress at all ? ”[0-i]

[He]15-miles fairly glittered in the gloom . “ Not at all . [I]15-miles sat up and read . ”[15-miles]

“ And when did [you]15-miles go down ? ”[15-miles]

“ At midnight . When [I]15-miles ’m bad [I]15-miles _ am _ bad ! ”[15-miles]

“ [I]15-miles see , [I]15-miles see — it ’s charming . But how could [you]15-miles be sure [I]15-miles would know it ? ”[15-miles]

“ Oh , [I]15-miles arranged that with [Flora]16-flora . ”[15-miles] [His]15-miles answers rang out with a readiness ! “ [She]16-flora was to get up and look out . ”[15-miles]

“ Which is what [she]16-flora did do . ”[15-miles] It was [I]0-i who fell into the trap !

“ So [she]16-flora disturbed [you]15-miles , and , to see what [she]16-flora was looking at , [you]15-miles also looked — [you]15-miles saw . ”[15-miles]

“ While [you]15-miles , ”[0-i] [I]0-i concurred , “ caught [your]15-miles death in the night air ! ”[0-i]

[He]15-miles literally bloomed so from this exploit that [he]15-miles could afford radiantly to assent . “ How otherwise should [I]15-miles have been bad enough ? ”[15-miles] [he]15-miles asked .
