Then , after another embrace , the incident and [our]637-our interview closed on [my]0-i recognition of all the reserves of goodness that , for [his]15-miles joke , [he]15-miles had been able to draw upon .

[XII]34-xii

The particular impression [I]0-i had received proved in the morning light , [I]0-i repeat , not quite successfully presentable to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , though [I]0-i reinforced it with the mention of still another remark that [he]15-miles had made before [we]637-our separated . “ It all lies in half a dozen words , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said to [her]14-mrs. grose , “ words that really settle the matter . ‘ Think , [you]14-mrs. grose know , what [I]0-i _ might _ do ! ’ [He]15-miles threw that off to show [me]0-i how good [he]15-miles is . [He]15-miles knows down to the ground what [he]15-miles ‘ might ’ do . That ’s what [he]15-miles gave [them]1221-they a taste of at [school]313-school . ”[0-i]

“ [Lord]1223-lord , [you]0-i do change ! ”[219-my friend] cried [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend .

“ [I]0-i do n’t change — [I]0-i simply make it out . The four , depend upon it , perpetually meet . If on either of these last nights [you]0-i had been with [either child]1224-either child , [you]0-i would clearly have understood . The more [I]0-i ’ve watched and waited the more [I]0-i ’ve felt that if there were nothing else to make it sure it would be made so by the systematic silence of each . _ Never _ , by a slip of the tongue , have [they]1221-they so much as alluded to either of [[their]1221-they old friends]1225-their old friends , any more than [Miles]15-miles has alluded to [his]15-miles expulsion . Oh , yes , [we]1226-we may sit here and look at [them]1221-they , and [they]1221-they may show off to [us]1226-we there to [their]1221-they fill ; but even while [they]1221-they pretend to be lost in [their]1221-they fairytale [they]1221-they ’re steeped in [their]1221-they vision of the dead restored . [He]15-miles ’s not reading to [her]1224-either child , ”[0-i] [I]0-i declared ; “ [they]1221-they ’re talking of _ them_—they’re talking horrors ! [I]0-i go on , [I]0-i know , as if [I]0-i were crazy ; and it ’s a wonder [I]0-i ’m not . What [I]0-i ’ve seen would have made _ [you]223-my colleague _ so ; but it has only made [me]0-i more lucid , made [me]0-i get hold of still other things . ”[0-i]

[My]0-i lucidity must have seemed awful , but the charming creatures who were victims of it , passing and repassing in [their]639-they interlocked sweetness , gave [[my]0-i colleague]223-my colleague something to hold on by ; and [I]0-i felt how tight [she]223-my colleague held as , without stirring in the breath of [my]0-i passion , [she]223-my colleague covered them still with [her]223-my colleague eyes . “ Of what other things have [you]0-i got hold ? ”[223-my colleague]

“ Why , of the very things that have delighted , fascinated , and yet , at bottom , as [I]0-i now so strangely see , mystified and troubled [me]0-i . [Their]639-they more than earthly beauty , [their]639-they absolutely unnatural goodness . It ’s a game , ”[0-i] [I]0-i went on ; “ it ’s a policy and a fraud ! ”[0-i]

“ On the part of [little darlings]1227-little darlings — ? ”[223-my colleague]

“ As yet [mere lovely babies]1228-mere lovely babies ? Yes , mad as that seems ! ”[0-i] The very act of bringing it out really helped [me]0-i to trace it — follow it all up and piece it all together . “ [They]639-they have n’t been good — [they’ve]639-they only been absent . It has been easy to live with [them]639-they , because [they]639-they ’re simply leading a life of [their]639-they own . [They]639-they ’re not [mine]0-i — [they’re]639-they not [ours]0-i . [They]639-they ’re [his]0-i and [they]639-they ’re [hers]14-mrs. grose ! ”[0-i]

“ [Quint]22-quint ’s and [that woman]1229-that woman ’s ? ”[219-my friend]

“ [Quint]22-quint ’s and [that woman]1229-that woman ’s . [They]639-they want to get to [them]641-them . ”[0-i]

Oh , how , at this , [poor Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose appeared to study [them]641-them ! “ But for what ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ For the love of all the evil that , in those dreadful days , [the pair]1231-the pair put into [them]641-them . And to ply [them]641-them with that evil still , to keep up the work of demons , is what brings [the others]66-the others back . ”[219-my friend]

“ Laws ! ”[219-my friend] said [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend under [her]219-my friend breath . The exclamation was homely , but it revealed a real acceptance of [my]0-i further proof of what , in the bad time — for there had been a worse even than this!—must have occurred . There could have been no such justification for [me]0-i as the plain assent of [her]219-my friend experience to whatever depth of depravity [I]0-i found credible in [our]643-us brace of [scoundrels]644-scoundrels . It was in obvious submission of memory that [she]219-my friend brought out after a moment : “ [They]644-scoundrels _ were _ rascals ! But what can [they]644-scoundrels now do ? ”[219-my friend] [she]219-my friend pursued .

“ Do ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i echoed so loud that [Miles]15-miles and [Flora]16-flora , as [they]645-their passed at [their]645-their distance , paused an instant in [their]645-their walk and looked at [us]643-us . “ Do n’t [they]644-scoundrels do enough ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i demanded in a lower tone , while [the children]1088-the children , having smiled and nodded and kissed hands to [us]643-us , resumed [their]1088-the children exhibition . [We]643-us were held by it a minute ; then [I]0-i answered : “ [They]644-scoundrels can destroy [them]644-scoundrels ! ”[0-i] At this [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion did turn , but the inquiry [she]219-my friend launched was a silent one , the effect of which was to make [me]0-i more explicit . “ [They]644-scoundrels do n’t know , as yet , quite how — but [they]644-scoundrels ’re trying hard . [They]644-scoundrels ’re seen only across , as it were , and beyond — in strange places and on high places , the top of [towers]1233-towers , the roof of [houses]1234-houses , the outside of windows , the further edge of [pools]1235-pools ; but there ’s a deep design , on either side , to shorten the distance and overcome the obstacle ; and the success of [the tempters]1236-the tempters is only a question of time . [They]644-scoundrels ’ve only to keep to [their]644-scoundrels suggestions of danger . ”[219-my friend]

“ For [the children]1088-the children to come ? ”[219-my friend]

“ And perish in the attempt ! ”[219-my friend] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose slowly got up , and [I]0-i scrupulously added : “ Unless , of course , [we]1238-we can prevent ! ”[0-i]

Standing there before [me]0-i while [I]0-i kept [my]0-i seat , [she]219-my friend visibly turned things over . “ [[Their]1088-the children uncle]1239-their uncle must do the preventing . [He]1239-their uncle must take [them]1088-the children away . ”[219-my friend]

“ And who ’s to make [him]1239-their uncle ? ”[219-my friend]

[She]219-my friend had been scanning the distance , but [she]219-my friend now dropped on [me]0-i a foolish face . “ [You]0-i , [miss]1042-miss . ”[219-my friend]

“ By writing to [him]1239-their uncle that [[his]1239-their uncle house]1241-his house is poisoned and [[his]1239-their uncle little nephew]1242-his little nephew and [niece]1243-niece mad ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ But if [they]1088-the children _ are _ , [miss]1042-miss ? ”[219-my friend]

“ And if [I]14-mrs. grose am [myself]14-mrs. grose , [you]219-my friend mean ? That ’s charming news to be sent [him]1239-their uncle by [a governess whose prime undertaking was to give [him]1239-their uncle no worry]1245-a governess whose prime undertaking was to give him no worry . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose considered , following [the children]1088-the children again . “ Yes , [he]1239-their uncle do hate worry . That was the great reason — ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Why [those fiends]1246-those fiends took [him]1239-their uncle in so long ? No doubt , though [his]1239-their uncle indifference must have been awful . As [I]239-my companion ’m not [a fiend]1247-a fiend , at any rate , [I]239-my companion should n’t take [him]1239-their uncle in . ”[239-my companion]

[[My]0-i companion]239-my companion , after an instant and for all answer , sat down again and grasped [my]0-i arm . “ Make [him]1239-their uncle at any rate come to [you]0-i . ”[239-my companion]

[I]0-i stared . “ To _ [me]0-i ? _ ”[0-i] [I]0-i had a sudden fear of what [she]239-my companion might do . “ ‘ [Him]1239-their uncle ’ ? ”[0-i]

“ [He]1239-their uncle ought to _ be _ here — [he]1239-their uncle ought to help . ”[239-my companion]

[I]0-i quickly rose , and [I]0-i think [I]0-i must have shown [her]239-my companion a queerer face than ever yet . “ [You]239-my companion see [me]0-i asking [him]651-him for a visit ? ”[0-i] No , with [her]239-my companion eyes on [my]0-i face [she]239-my companion evidently could n’t . Instead of it even — as [a woman]1020-a woman reads another — [she]239-my companion could see what [I]0-i [myself]0-i saw : [his]651-him derision , [his]651-him amusement , [his]651-him contempt for the breakdown of [my]0-i resignation at being left alone and for the fine machinery [I]0-i had set in motion to attract [his]651-him attention to [my]0-i slighted charms . [She]239-my companion did n’t know — [no one]652-no one knew — how proud [I]0-i had been to serve [him]651-him and to stick to [our]653-our terms ; yet [she]239-my companion nonetheless took the measure , [I]0-i think , of the warning [I]0-i now gave [her]239-my companion . “ If [you]0-i should so lose [your]0-i head as to appeal to [him]651-him for [me]239-my companion — ”[239-my companion]

[She]239-my companion was really frightened . “ Yes , [miss]1042-miss ? ”[239-my companion]

“ [I]35-xiii would leave , on the spot , both [him]651-him and [you]0-i . ”[35-xiii]

[XIII]35-xiii

It was all very well to join [them]654-them , but speaking to [them]654-them proved quite as much as ever an effort beyond [my]0-i strength — offered , in close quarters , difficulties as insurmountable as before . This situation continued a month , and with new aggravations and particular notes , the note above all , sharper and sharper , of the small ironic consciousness on the part of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils . It was not , [I]0-i am as sure today as [I]0-i was sure then , [my]0-i mere infernal imagination : it was absolutely traceable that [they]654-them were aware of [my]0-i predicament and that this strange relation made , in a manner , for a long time , the air in which [we]656-we moved . [I]0-i do n’t mean that [they]654-them had [their]654-them tongues in [their]654-them cheeks or did anything vulgar , for that was not one of [their]654-them dangers : [I]0-i do mean , on the other hand , that the element of the unnamed and untouched became , between [us]656-we , greater than any other , and that so much avoidance could not have been so successfully effected without a great deal of tacit arrangement . It was as if , at moments , [we]656-we were perpetually coming into sight of subjects before which [we]656-we must stop short , turning suddenly out of alleys that [we]656-we perceived to be blind , closing with a little bang that made [us]656-we look at [each other]284-each other — for , like all bangs , it was something louder than [we]656-we had intended — the doors [we]656-we had indiscreetly opened . [All roads]658-all roads lead to [Rome]9-rome , and there were times when it might have struck [us]656-we that almost every branch of study or subject of conversation skirted [forbidden ground]659-forbidden ground . [Forbidden ground]659-forbidden ground was the question of the return of the dead in general and of whatever , in especial , might survive , in memory , of [the friends [little children]662-little children had lost]661-the friends little children had lost . There were days when [I]0-i could have sworn that [one of [them]654-them]663-one of them had , with a small invisible nudge , said to the other : “ [She]663-one of them thinks [she]663-one of them ’ll do it this time — but [she]663-one of them _ wo n’t ! _ ”[663-one of them] To “ do it ”[654-them] would have been to indulge for instance — and for once in a way — in some direct reference to [the lady who had prepared [them]654-them for [my]0-i discipline]664-the lady who had prepared them for my discipline . [They]654-them had a delightful endless appetite for passages in [my]0-i own history , to which [I]0-i had again and again treated [them]654-them ; [they]654-them were in possession of everything that had ever happened to [me]0-i , had had , with every circumstance the story of [my]0-i smallest adventures and of those of [[my]0-i brothers]665-my brothers and [sisters]238-sisters and of the cat and the dog at [home]1024-home , as well as many particulars of the eccentric nature of [[my]0-i father]668-my father , of the furniture and arrangement of [[our]669-our house]670-our house , and of the conversation of [the old women of [our]669-our village]671-the old women of our village . There were things enough , taking one with another , to chatter about , if one went very fast and knew by instinct when to go round . [They]654-them pulled with an art of [their]654-them own the strings of [my]0-i invention and [my]0-i memory ; and nothing else perhaps , when [I]0-i thought of such occasions afterward , gave [me]0-i so the suspicion of being watched from under cover . It was in any case over _ [my]0-i _ life , _ [my]0-i _ past , and _ [[my]0-i _ friends]672-my _ friends alone that [we]669-our could take anything like [our]669-our ease — a state of affairs that led [them]654-them sometimes without the least pertinence to break out into sociable reminders . [I]0-i was invited — with no visible connection — to repeat afresh [Goody Gosling]36-goody gosling ’s celebrated _ mot _ or to confirm the details already supplied as to the cleverness of [the vicarage pony]673-the vicarage pony .

It was partly at such junctures as these and partly at quite different ones that , with the turn [my]0-i matters had now taken , [my]0-i predicament , as [I]0-i have called it , grew most sensible . The fact that the days passed for [me]0-i without another encounter ought , it would have appeared , to have done something toward soothing [my]0-i nerves . Since the light brush , that second night on [the upper landing]674-the upper landing , of the presence of [a woman at the foot of the stair]675-a woman at the foot of the stair , [I]0-i had seen nothing , whether in or out of [the house]153-the house , that [one]94-one had better not have seen . There was many a corner round which [I]0-i expected to come upon [Quint]22-quint , and many a situation that , in a merely sinister way , would have favored the appearance of [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel . The summer had turned , the summer had gone ; the autumn had dropped upon [Bly]13-bly and had blown out half [our]669-our lights . [The place]1030-the place , with [its]1030-the place gray sky and withered garlands , [its]1030-the place bared spaces and scattered dead leaves , was like [a theater after the performance]679-a theater after the performance — all strewn with crumpled playbills . There were exactly states of the air , conditions of sound and of stillness , unspeakable impressions of the _ kind _ of ministering moment , that brought back to [me]0-i , long enough to catch it , the feeling of the medium in which , that June evening out of doors , [I]0-i had had [my]0-i first sight of [Quint]22-quint , and in which , too , at those other instants , [I]0-i had , after seeing [him]22-quint through the window , looked for [him]22-quint in vain in the circle of shrubbery . [I]0-i recognized the signs , the portents — [I]0-i recognized the moment , the spot . But they remained unaccompanied and empty , and [I]0-i continued unmolested ; if unmolested one could call [a young woman whose sensibility had , in the most extraordinary fashion , not declined but deepened]680-a young woman whose sensibility had , in the most extraordinary fashion , not declined but deepened . [I]0-i had said in [my]0-i talk with [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose on that horrid scene of [Flora]16-flora ’s by [the lake]433-the lake — and had perplexed [her]14-mrs. grose by so saying — that it would from that moment distress [me]0-i much more to lose [my]0-i power than to keep it . [I]0-i had then expressed what was vividly in [my]0-i mind : the truth that , whether [the children]1088-the children really saw or not — since , that is , it was not yet definitely proved — [I]0-i greatly preferred , as a safeguard , the fullness of [my]0-i own exposure . [I]0-i was ready to know the very worst that was to be known . What [I]0-i had then had an ugly glimpse of was that [my]0-i eyes might be sealed just while theirs were most opened . Well , [my]0-i eyes _ were _ sealed , it appeared , at present — a consummation for which it seemed blasphemous not to thank [God]12-god . There was , alas , a difficulty about that : [I]0-i would have thanked [him]683-him with all [my]0-i soul had [I]0-i not had in a proportionate measure this conviction of the secret of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils .

How can [I]0-i retrace today the strange steps of [my]0-i obsession ? There were times of [our]685-our being together when [I]0-i would have been ready to swear that , literally , in [my]0-i presence , but with [my]0-i direct sense of it closed , [they]686-they had [visitors who were known and were welcome]687-visitors who were known and were welcome . Then it was that , had [I]0-i not been deterred by the very chance that such an injury might prove greater than the injury to be averted , [my]0-i exultation would have broken out . “ [They]686-they ’re here , [they]686-they ’re here , [[you]688-the little wretches little wretches]1249-you little wretches , ”[0-i] [I]0-i would have cried , “ and [you]688-the little wretches ca n’t deny it now ! ”[0-i] [The little wretches]688-the little wretches denied it with all the added volume of [their]688-the little wretches sociability and [their]688-the little wretches tenderness , in just the crystal depths of which — like the flash of a fish in a stream — the mockery of [their]688-the little wretches advantage peeped up . The shock , in truth , had sunk into [me]0-i still deeper than [I]0-i knew on the night when , looking out to see either [Quint]22-quint or [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel under the stars , [I]0-i had beheld [the boy over whose rest [I]0-i watched and who had immediately brought in with [him]689-the boy over whose rest i watched and who had immediately brought in with him]689-the boy over whose rest i watched and who had immediately brought in with him — had straightway , there , turned it on [me]0-i — the lovely upward look with which , from the battlements above [me]0-i , the hideous apparition of [Quint]22-quint had played . If it was a question of a scare , [my]0-i discovery on this occasion had scared [me]0-i more than any other , and it was in the condition of nerves produced by it that [I]0-i made [my]0-i actual inductions . [They]690-they harassed [me]0-i so that sometimes , at odd moments , [I]0-i shut [myself]0-i up audibly to rehearse — it was at once a fantastic relief and a renewed despair — the manner in which [I]0-i might come to the point . [I]0-i approached it from one side and the other while , in [[my]0-i room]177-my room , [I]0-i flung [myself]0-i about , but [I]0-i always broke down in the monstrous utterance of names . As they died away on [my]0-i lips , [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that [I]0-i should indeed help [them]690-they to represent something infamous , if , by pronouncing [them]690-they , [I]0-i should violate as rare a little case of instinctive delicacy as [any schoolroom]692-any schoolroom , probably , had ever known . When [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i : “ _ [They]690-they _ have the manners to be silent , and [you]1250-you , trusted as [you]1250-you are , the baseness to speak ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i crimson and [I]0-i covered [my]0-i face with [my]0-i hands . After these secret scenes [I]0-i chattered more than ever , going on volubly enough till one of [our]693-we prodigious , palpable hushes occurred — [I]0-i can call [them]694-them nothing else — the strange , dizzy lift or swim ( [I]0-i try for terms ! ) into a stillness , a pause of all life , that had nothing to do with the more or less noise that at the moment [we]693-we might be engaged in making and that [I]0-i could hear through any deepened exhilaration or quickened recitation or louder strum of the piano . Then it was that [the others]66-the others , [the outsiders]696-the outsiders , were there . Though [they]66-the others were [not angels]697-not angels , [they]66-the others “ passed , ”[698-the french] as [the French]698-the french say , causing [me]0-i , while [they]66-the others stayed , to tremble with the fear of [their]66-the others addressing to [[their]66-the others younger victims]699-their younger victims some yet more infernal message or more vivid image than [they]66-the others had thought good enough for [myself]0-i .

What it was most impossible to get rid of was the cruel idea that , whatever [I]0-i had seen , [Miles]15-miles and [Flora]16-flora saw _ more_—things terrible and unguessable and that sprang from dreadful passages of intercourse in the past . Such things naturally left on the surface , for the time , a chill which [we]693-we vociferously denied that [we]693-we felt ; and [we]693-we had , all three , with repetition , got into such splendid training that [we]693-we went , each time , almost automatically , to mark the close of the incident , through the very same movements . It was striking of [the children]1088-the children , at all events , to kiss [me]0-i inveterately with a kind of wild irrelevance and never to fail — one or the other — of the precious question that had helped [us]693-we through many a peril . “ When do [you]0-i think [he]1239-their uncle _ will _ come ? Do n’t [you]0-i think [we]693-we _ ought _ to write?”—there[1088-the children] was nothing like that inquiry , [we]693-we found by experience , for carrying off an awkwardness . “ [He]1239-their uncle ”[1239-their uncle] of course was [[their]1088-the children uncle]1239-their uncle in [Harley Street]3-harley street ; and [we]693-we lived in much profusion of theory that [he]1239-their uncle might at any moment arrive to mingle in [our]693-we circle . It was impossible to have given less encouragement than [he]1239-their uncle had done to such a doctrine , but if [we]693-we had not had the doctrine to fall back upon [we]693-we should have deprived each other of some of [our]693-we finest exhibitions . [He]1239-their uncle never wrote to [them]1088-the children — that may have been selfish , but it was a part of the flattery of [his]1239-their uncle trust of [me]0-i ; for the way in which [a man]702-a man pays [his]702-a man highest tribute to [a woman]1020-a woman is apt to be but by the more festal celebration of one of the sacred laws of [his]702-a man comfort ; and [I]0-i held that [I]0-i carried out the spirit of the pledge given not to appeal to [him]1239-their uncle when [I]0-i let [[my]0-i charges]704-my charges understand that [their]704-my charges own letters were but charming literary exercises . They were too beautiful to be posted ; [I]0-i kept them [myself]0-i ; [I]0-i have them all to this hour . This was a rule indeed which only added to the satiric effect of [my]0-i being plied with the supposition that [he]1239-their uncle might at any moment be among [us]705-us . It was exactly as if [[my]0-i charges]704-my charges knew how almost more awkward than anything else that might be for [me]0-i . There appears to [me]0-i , moreover , as [I]0-i look back , no note in all this more extraordinary than the mere fact that , in spite of [my]0-i tension and of [their]704-my charges triumph , [I]0-i never lost patience with [them]704-my charges . Adorable [they]704-my charges must in truth have been , [I]0-i now reflect , that [I]0-i did n’t in these days hate [them]704-my charges ! Would exasperation , however , if relief had longer been postponed , finally have betrayed [me]0-i ? It little matters , for relief arrived . [I]0-i call it relief , though it was only the relief that a snap brings to a strain or the burst of a thunderstorm to a day of suffocation . It was at least change , and it came with a rush .

[XIV

Walking]37-xiv walking to [church]332-church a certain Sunday morning , [I]0-i had little Miles at [my]0-i side and [[his]708-his sister]425-his sister , in advance of [us]710-us and at [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s , well in sight . It was a crisp , clear day , the first of its order for some time ; the night had brought a touch of frost , and the autumn air , bright and sharp , made the church bells almost gay . It was an odd accident of thought that [I]0-i should have happened at such a moment to be particularly and very gratefully struck with the obedience of [[my]0-i little charges]711-my little charges . Why did [they]704-my charges never resent [my]0-i inexorable , [my]0-i perpetual society ? Something or other had brought nearer [home]1024-home to [me]0-i that [I]0-i had all but pinned [the boy]1078-the boy to [my]0-i shawl and that , in the way [[our]710-us companions]714-our companions were marshaled before [me]0-i , [I]0-i might have appeared to provide against some danger of rebellion . [I]0-i was like [a gaoler with an eye to possible surprises and escapes]715-a gaoler with an eye to possible surprises and escapes . But all this belonged — [I]0-i mean [their]704-my charges magnificent little surrender — just to the special array of the facts that were most abysmal . Turned out for [Sunday]38-sunday by [[[his]1078-the boy uncle]1094-his uncle ’s tailor , who had had a free hand and a notion of pretty waistcoats and of [his]1078-the boy grand little air]717-his uncle ’s tailor , who had had a free hand and a notion of pretty waistcoats and of his grand little air , [Miles]15-miles ’s whole title to independence , the rights of [his]15-miles sex and situation , were so stamped upon [him]15-miles that if [he]15-miles had suddenly struck for freedom [I]0-i should have had nothing to say . [I]0-i was by the strangest of chances wondering how [I]0-i should meet [him]15-miles when the revolution unmistakably occurred . [I]0-i call it a revolution because [I]0-i now see how , with the word [he]15-miles spoke , the curtain rose on the last act of [my]0-i dreadful drama , and the catastrophe was precipitated . “ Look here , [[my]15-miles dear]1145-my dear , [you]1145-my dear know , ”[15-miles] [he]15-miles charmingly said , “ when in [the world]185-the world , please , am [I]15-miles going back to [school]313-school ? ”[15-miles]

Transcribed here the speech sounds harmless enough , particularly as uttered in the sweet , high , casual pipe with which , at [all interlocutors]718-all interlocutors , but above all at [[his]15-miles eternal governess]719-his eternal governess , [he]15-miles threw off intonations as if [he]15-miles were tossing roses . There was something in them that always made one “ catch , ”[0-i] and [I]0-i caught , at any rate , now so effectually that [I]0-i stopped as short as if one of the trees of [the park]247-the park had fallen across [the road]409-the road . There was something new , on the spot , between [us]722-us , and [he]15-miles was perfectly aware that [I]0-i recognized it , though , to enable [me]0-i to do so , [he]15-miles had no need to look a whit less candid and charming than usual . [I]0-i could feel in [him]15-miles how [he]15-miles already , from [my]0-i at first finding nothing to reply , perceived the advantage [he]15-miles had gained . [I]0-i was so slow to find anything that [he]15-miles had plenty of time , after a minute , to continue with [his]15-miles suggestive but inconclusive smile : “ [You]0-i know , [[my]15-miles dear]1145-my dear , that for [a fellow]1255-a fellow to be with [a lady]1188-a lady _ always _ — ! ”[15-miles] [His]15-miles “ [[my]15-miles dear]1145-my dear ”[15-miles] was constantly on [his]15-miles lips for [me]0-i , and nothing could have expressed more the exact shade of the sentiment with which [I]0-i desired to inspire [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils than its fond familiarity . It was so respectfully easy .

But , oh , how [I]0-i felt that at present [I]0-i must pick [my]0-i own phrases ! [I]0-i remember that , to gain time , [I]0-i tried to laugh , and [I]0-i seemed to see in the beautiful face with which [he]15-miles watched [me]0-i how ugly and queer [I]0-i looked . “ And always with [the same lady]148-the same lady ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i returned .

[He]15-miles neither blanched nor winked . The whole thing was virtually out between [us]724-us . “ Ah , of course , [she]148-the same lady ’s [a jolly , ‘ perfect ’ lady]1259-a jolly , ‘ perfect ’ lady ; but , after all , [I]15-miles ’m [a fellow]1255-a fellow , do n’t [you]15-miles see ? that’s — well , getting on . ”[15-miles]

[I]0-i lingered there with [him]15-miles an instant ever so kindly . “ Yes , [you]15-miles ’re getting on . ”[0-i] Oh , but [I]0-i felt helpless !

[I]0-i have kept to this day the heartbreaking little idea of how [he]15-miles seemed to know that and to play with it . “ And [you]15-miles ca n’t say [I]15-miles ’ve not been awfully good , can [you]15-miles ? ”[15-miles]

[I]0-i laid [my]0-i hand on [his]15-miles shoulder , for , though [I]0-i felt how much better it would have been to walk on , [I]0-i was not yet quite able . “ No , [I]0-i ca n’t say that , [Miles]15-miles . ”[0-i]

“ Except just that one night , [you]15-miles know — ! ”[15-miles]

“ That one night ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i could n’t look as straight as [he]15-miles .

“ Why , when [I]15-miles went down — went out of [the house]153-the house . ”[15-miles]

“ Oh , yes . But [I]15-miles forget what [you]15-miles did it for . ”[15-miles]

“ [You]0-i forget?”—he[15-miles] spoke with the sweet extravagance of childish reproach . “ Why , it was to show [you]0-i [I]15-miles could ! ”[15-miles]

“ Oh , yes , [you]15-miles could . ”[15-miles]

“ And [I]15-miles can again . ”[15-miles]

[I]0-i felt that [I]0-i might , perhaps , after all , succeed in keeping [my]0-i wits about [me]0-i . “ Certainly . But [you]15-miles wo n’t . ”[0-i]

“ No , not _ that _ again . It was nothing . ”[15-miles]

“ It was nothing , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said . “ But [we]725-we must go on . ”[0-i]

[He]15-miles resumed [our]725-we walk with [me]0-i , passing [his]15-miles hand into [my]0-i arm . “ Then when _ am _ [I]15-miles going back ? ”[15-miles]

[I]0-i wore , in turning it over , [my]0-i most responsible air . “ Were [you]15-miles very happy at [school]313-school ? ”[0-i]

[He]15-miles just considered . “ Oh , [I]15-miles ’m happy enough anywhere ! ”[15-miles]

“ Well , then , ”[0-i] [I]0-i quavered , “ if [you]15-miles ’re just as happy here — ! ”[0-i]

“ Ah , but that is n’t everything ! Of course _ [you]15-miles _ know a lot — ”[15-miles]

“ But [you]15-miles hint that [you]15-miles know almost as much ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i risked as [he]15-miles paused .

“ Not half [I]15-miles want to ! ”[15-miles] [Miles]15-miles honestly professed . “ But it is n’t so much that . ”[15-miles]

“ What is it , then ? ”[15-miles]

“ Well — [I]15-miles want to see more life . ”[15-miles]

“ [I]15-miles see ; [I]15-miles see . ”[15-miles] [We]726-we had arrived within sight of [the church]727-the church and of [various persons , including several of [the household of [Bly]13-bly]729-the household of bly]728-various persons , including several of the household of bly , on [their]728-various persons , including several of the household of bly way to [it]727-the church and clustered about the door to see [us]726-we go in . [I]0-i quickened [our]726-we step ; [I]0-i wanted to get [there]1025-there before the question between [us]726-we opened up much further ; [I]0-i reflected hungrily that , for more than an hour , [he]15-miles would have to be silent ; and [I]0-i thought with envy of the comparative dusk of the pew and of the almost spiritual help of the hassock on which [I]0-i might bend [my]0-i knees . [I]0-i seemed literally to be running a race with some confusion to which [he]15-miles was about to reduce [me]0-i , but [I]0-i felt that [he]15-miles had got in first when , before [we]726-we had even entered [the churchyard]731-the churchyard , [he]15-miles threw out —

“ [I]15-miles want [my]15-miles own sort ! ”[15-miles]

It literally made [me]0-i bound forward . “ There are not many of [your]15-miles own sort , [Miles]15-miles ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i laughed . “ Unless perhaps [dear little Flora]16-flora ! ”[0-i]

“ [You]15-miles really compare [me]15-miles to [a baby girl]1263-a baby girl ? ”[15-miles]

This found [me]0-i singularly weak . “ Do n’t [you]15-miles , then , _ love _ [our]732-we sweet [Flora]16-flora ? ”[0-i]

“ If [I]15-miles didn’t — and [you]0-i , too ; if [I]15-miles did n’t — ! ”[15-miles] [he]15-miles repeated as if retreating for a jump , yet leaving [his]15-miles thought so unfinished that , after [we]732-we had come into the gate , another stop , which [he]15-miles imposed on [me]0-i by the pressure of [his]15-miles arm , had become inevitable . [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose and [Flora]16-flora had passed into [the church]727-the church , [the other worshippers]734-the other worshippers had followed , and [we]732-we were , for the minute , alone among the old , thick graves . [We]732-we had paused , on the path from the gate , by [a low , oblong , tablelike tomb]735-a low , oblong , tablelike tomb .

“ Yes , if [you]0-i did n’t — ? ”[732-we]

[He]15-miles looked , while [I]0-i waited , at [the graves]736-the graves . “ Well , [you]0-i know what ! ”[15-miles] But [he]15-miles did n’t move , and [he]15-miles presently produced something that made [me]0-i drop straight down on the stone slab , as if suddenly to rest . “ Does [[my]15-miles uncle]1264-my uncle think what _ [you]15-miles _ think ? ”[15-miles]

[I]0-i markedly rested . “ How do [you]15-miles know what [I]0-i think ? ”[0-i]

“ Ah , well , of course [I]15-miles do n’t ; for it strikes [me]15-miles [you]15-miles never tell [me]15-miles . But [I]15-miles mean does _ [he]1264-my uncle _ know ? ”[15-miles]

“ Know what , [Miles]15-miles ? ”[0-i]

“ Why , the way [I]15-miles ’m going on . ”[15-miles]

[I]0-i perceived quickly enough that [I]0-i could make , to this inquiry , no answer that would not involve something of a sacrifice of [[my]0-i employer]171-my employer . Yet it appeared to [me]0-i that [we]738-we were all , at Bly , sufficiently sacrificed to make that venial . “ [I]15-miles do n’t think [[your]15-miles uncle]1265-your uncle much cares . ”[15-miles]

[Miles]15-miles , on this , stood looking at [me]0-i . “ Then do n’t [you]1078-the boy think [he]1078-the boy can be made to ? ”[15-miles]

“ In what way ? ”[15-miles]

“ Why , by [his]1078-the boy coming down . ”[15-miles]

“ But who ’ll get [him]1078-the boy to come down ? ”[15-miles]

“ _ [I]1078-the boy _ will ! ”[1078-the boy] [the boy]1078-the boy said with extraordinary brightness and emphasis . [He]1078-the boy gave [me]0-i another look charged with that expression and then marched off alone into [church]332-church .

XV

The business was practically settled from the moment [I]0-i never followed [him]1078-the boy . It was a pitiful surrender to agitation , but [my]0-i being aware of this had somehow no power to restore [me]0-i . [I]0-i only sat there on [[my]0-i tomb]741-my tomb and read into what [[my]0-i little friend]742-my little friend had said to [me]0-i the fullness of its meaning ; by the time [I]0-i had grasped the whole of which [I]0-i had also embraced , for absence , the pretext that [I]0-i was ashamed to offer [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils and [the rest of [the congregation]745-the congregation]744-the rest of the congregation such an example of delay . What [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i above all was that [Miles]15-miles had got something out of [me]0-i and that the proof of it , for [him]15-miles , would be just this awkward collapse . [He]15-miles had got out of [me]0-i that there was something [I]0-i was much afraid of and that [he]15-miles should probably be able to make use of [my]0-i fear to gain , for [his]15-miles own purpose , more freedom . [My]0-i fear was of having to deal with the intolerable question of the grounds of [his]15-miles dismissal from [school]313-school , for that was really but the question of the horrors gathered behind . That [[his]15-miles uncle]1094-his uncle should arrive to treat with [me]0-i of these things was a solution that , strictly speaking , [I]0-i ought now to have desired to bring on ; but [I]0-i could so little face the ugliness and the pain of it that [I]0-i simply procrastinated and lived from hand to mouth . [The boy]1078-the boy , to [my]0-i deep discomposure , was immensely in the right , was in a position to say to [me]0-i : “ Either [you]0-i clear up with [[my]1078-the boy guardian]1266-my guardian the mystery of this interruption of [my]1078-the boy studies , or [you]0-i cease to expect [me]1078-the boy to lead with [you]0-i a life that ’s so unnatural for [a boy]1267-a boy . ”[1078-the boy] What was so unnatural for [the particular boy [I]0-i was concerned with]749-the particular boy i was concerned with was this sudden revelation of a consciousness and a plan .

That was what really overcame [me]0-i , what prevented [my]0-i going in . [I]0-i walked round [the church]727-the church , hesitating , hovering ; [I]0-i reflected that [I]0-i had already , with [him]1078-the boy , hurt [myself]0-i beyond repair . Therefore [I]0-i could patch up nothing , and it was too extreme an effort to squeeze beside [him]1078-the boy into the pew : [he]1078-the boy would be so much more sure than ever to pass [his]1078-the boy arm into [mine]0-i and make [me]0-i sit there for an hour in close , silent contact with [his]1078-the boy commentary on [our]751-our talk . For the first minute since [his]1078-the boy arrival [I]0-i wanted to get away from [him]1078-the boy . As [I]0-i paused beneath the high east window and listened to the sounds of worship , [I]0-i was taken with an impulse that might master [me]0-i , [I]0-i felt , completely should [I]0-i give it the least encouragement . [I]0-i might easily put an end to [my]0-i predicament by getting away altogether . Here was [my]0-i chance ; there was [no one]652-no one to stop [me]0-i ; [I]0-i could give the whole thing up — turn [my]0-i back and retreat . It was only a question of hurrying again , for a few preparations , to [the house which [the attendance at [church]332-church of so many of [the servants]299-the servants]754-the attendance at church of so many of the servants]753-the house which the attendance at church of so many of the servants would practically have left unoccupied . [No one]652-no one , in short , could blame [me]0-i if [I]0-i should just drive desperately off . What was it to get away if [I]0-i got away only till dinner ? That would be in a couple of hours , at the end of which — [I]0-i had the acute prevision — [[my]0-i little pupils]758-my little pupils would play at innocent wonder about [my]0-i nonappearance in [[their]758-my little pupils train]759-their train .

“ What _ did _ [you]0-i do , [you]0-i naughty , bad thing ? Why in [the world]185-the world , to worry [us]1269-us so — and take [our]1269-us thoughts off , too , do n’t [you]0-i know?—did [you]0-i desert [us]1269-us at the very door ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i could n’t meet such questions nor , as [they]760-they asked [them]760-they , [their]760-they false little lovely eyes ; yet it was all so exactly what [I]0-i should have to meet that , as the prospect grew sharp to [me]0-i , [I]0-i at last let [myself]0-i go .

[I]0-i got , so far as the immediate moment was concerned , away ; [I]0-i came straight out of [the churchyard]731-the churchyard and , thinking hard , retraced [my]0-i steps through [the park]247-the park . It seemed to [me]0-i that by the time [I]0-i reached [the house]153-the house [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind [I]0-i would fly . The Sunday stillness both of [the approaches]764-the approaches and of the interior , in which [I]0-i met [no one]652-no one , fairly excited [me]0-i with a sense of opportunity . Were [I]0-i to get off quickly , this way , [I]0-i should get off without a scene , without a word . [My]0-i quickness would have to be remarkable , however , and the question of a conveyance was the great one to settle . Tormented , in [the hall]78-the hall , with difficulties and obstacles , [I]0-i remember sinking down at the foot of the staircase — suddenly collapsing there on the lowest step and then , with a revulsion , recalling that it was exactly where more than a month before , in the darkness of night and just so bowed with evil things , [I]0-i had seen the specter of the most horrible of [women]95-women . At this [I]0-i was able to straighten [myself]0-i ; [I]0-i went the rest of the way up ; [I]0-i made , in [my]0-i bewilderment , for [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom , where there were objects belonging to [me]0-i that [I]0-i should have to take . But [I]0-i opened the door to find again , in a flash , [my]0-i eyes unsealed . In the presence of what [I]0-i saw [I]0-i reeled straight back upon [my]0-i resistance .

“ Yes , [miss]1042-miss — ”[0-i] [[my]0-i companion]239-my companion pressed [me]0-i .

“ Well , there ’s that awful reason . ”[0-i]

There were now clearly so many of these for [[my]0-i poor colleague]790-my poor colleague that [she]790-my poor colleague was excusable for being vague . “ But — a — which ? ”[790-my poor colleague]

“ Why , the letter from [[his]15-miles old place]1285-his old place . ”[0-i]

“ [You]0-i ’ll show it to [the master]1076-the master ? ”[790-my poor colleague]

“ [I]0-i ought to have done so on the instant . ”[0-i]

“ Oh , no ! ”[14-mrs. grose] said [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose with decision .

“ [I]0-i ’ll put it before [him]15-miles , ”[0-i] [I]0-i went on inexorably , “ that [I]0-i ca n’t undertake to work the question on behalf of [a child who has been expelled]1287-a child who has been expelled — ”[0-i]

“ For [we]1288-we ’ve never in the least known what ! ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose declared .

“ For wickedness . For what else — when [he]15-miles ’s so clever and beautiful and perfect ? Is [he]15-miles stupid ? Is [he]15-miles untidy ? Is [he]15-miles infirm ? Is [he]15-miles ill - natured ? [He]15-miles ’s exquisite — so it can be only _ that _ ; and that would open up the whole thing . After all , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ it ’s [[their]1289-their uncle]1239-their uncle ’s fault . If [he]15-miles left [here]1080-here [such people]1292-such people — ! ”[0-i]

“ [He]15-miles did n’t really in the least know [them]1292-such people . The fault ’s mine . ”[14-mrs. grose] [She]14-mrs. grose had turned quite pale .

“ Well , [you]14-mrs. grose sha n’t suffer , ”[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

“ [The children]1088-the children sha n’t ! ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose emphatically returned .

[I]0-i was silent awhile ; [we]791-we looked at [each other]284-each other . “ Then what am [I]791-we to tell [him]15-miles ? ”[791-we]

“ [You]14-mrs. grose need n’t tell [him]15-miles anything . _ [I]14-mrs. grose ’ll _ tell [him]15-miles . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i measured this . “ Do [you]14-mrs. grose mean [you]14-mrs. grose ’ll write — ? ”[0-i] Remembering [she]14-mrs. grose could n’t , [I]0-i caught [myself]0-i up . “ How do [you]14-mrs. grose communicate ? ”[0-i]

“ [I]14-mrs. grose tell [the bailiff]1294-the bailiff . _ [He]15-miles _ writes . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ And should [you]14-mrs. grose like [him]15-miles to write [our]793-our story ? ”[0-i]

[My]0-i question had a sarcastic force that [I]0-i had not fully intended , and it made [her]14-mrs. grose , after a moment , inconsequently break down . The tears were again in [her]14-mrs. grose eyes . “ Ah , [miss]1042-miss , _ [you]0-i _ write ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Well — tonight , ”[0-i] [I]0-i at last answered ; and on this [we]793-our separated .

XVII

[I]0-i went so far , in the evening , as to make a beginning . The weather had changed back , a great wind was abroad , and beneath the lamp , in [[my]0-i room]177-my room , with [Flora]16-flora at peace beside [me]0-i , [I]0-i sat for a long time before a blank sheet of paper and listened to the lash of the rain and the batter of the gusts . Finally [I]0-i went out , taking a candle ; [I]0-i crossed [the passage]546-the passage and listened a minute at [Miles]15-miles ’s door . What , under [my]0-i endless obsession , [I]0-i had been impelled to listen for was some betrayal of [his]15-miles not being at rest , and [I]0-i presently caught one , but not in the form [I]0-i had expected . [His]15-miles voice tinkled out . “ [I]15-miles say , [you]0-i there — come in . ”[15-miles] It was a gaiety in the gloom !

[I]0-i went in with [my]0-i light and found [him]15-miles , in bed , very wide awake , but very much at [his]15-miles ease . “ Well , what are _ [you]0-i _ up to ? ”[15-miles] [he]15-miles asked with a grace of sociability in which it occurred to [me]0-i that [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , had [she]14-mrs. grose been present , might have looked in vain for proof that anything was “ out . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i stood over [him]15-miles with [my]0-i candle . “ How did [you]15-miles know [I]0-i was [there]1025-there ? ”[0-i]

“ Why , of course [I]15-miles heard [you]15-miles . Did [you]15-miles fancy [you]15-miles made no noise ? [You]15-miles ’re like [a troop of cavalry]1297-a troop of cavalry ! ”[15-miles] [he]15-miles beautifully laughed .

“ Then [you]15-miles were n’t asleep ? ”[0-i]

“ Not much ! [I]0-i lie awake and think . ”[0-i]

[I]0-i had put [my]0-i candle , designedly , a short way off , and then , as [he]15-miles held out [his]15-miles friendly old hand to [me]0-i , had sat down on the edge of [his]15-miles bed . “ What is it , ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked , “ that [you]15-miles think of ? ”[0-i]

“ What in [the world]185-the world , [[my]0-i dear]1145-my dear , but _ [you]15-miles ? _ ”[0-i]

“ Ah , the pride [I]0-i take in [your]15-miles appreciation does n’t insist on that ! [I]0-i had so far rather [you]15-miles slept . ”[0-i]

“ Well , [I]0-i think also , [you]15-miles know , of this queer business of [ours]1300-ours . ”[0-i]

[I]0-i marked the coolness of [his]15-miles firm little hand . “ Of what queer business , [Miles]15-miles ? ”[0-i]

“ Why , the way [you]15-miles bring [me]0-i up . And all the rest ! ”[0-i]

[I]0-i fairly held [my]0-i breath a minute , and even from [my]0-i glimmering taper there was light enough to show how [he]15-miles smiled up at [me]0-i from [his]15-miles pillow . “ What do [you]15-miles mean by all the rest ? ”[15-miles]

“ Oh , [you]15-miles know , [you]15-miles know ! ”[0-i]

[I]0-i could say nothing for a minute , though [I]0-i felt , as [I]0-i held [his]15-miles hand and [our]796-our eyes continued to meet , that [my]0-i silence had all the air of admitting [his]15-miles charge and that nothing in the whole world of reality was perhaps at that moment so fabulous as [our]796-our actual relation . “ Certainly [you]15-miles shall go back to [school]313-school , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , “ if it be that that troubles [you]15-miles . But not to [the old place]1302-the old place — [we]796-our must find another , a better . How could [I]0-i know it did trouble [you]15-miles , this question , when [you]15-miles never told [me]0-i so , never spoke of it at all ? ”[0-i] [His]15-miles clear , listening face , framed in its smooth whiteness , made [him]15-miles for the minute as appealing as [some wistful patient in [[a children]798-a children ’s hospital]799-a children ’s hospital]797-some wistful patient in a children ’s hospital ; and [I]0-i would have given , as the resemblance came to [me]0-i , all [I]0-i possessed on earth really to be [the nurse]800-the nurse or [the sister of charity who might have helped to cure [him]15-miles]801-the sister of charity who might have helped to cure him . Well , even as it was , [I]0-i perhaps might help ! “ Do [you]15-miles know [you]15-miles ’ve never said a word to [me]0-i about [[your]15-miles school]1303-your school — [I]0-i mean [the old one]1304-the old one ; never mentioned it in any way ? ”[0-i]

[He]15-miles seemed to wonder ; [he]15-miles smiled with the same loveliness . But [he]15-miles clearly gained time ; [he]15-miles waited , [he]15-miles called for guidance . “ Have n’t [I]15-miles ? ”[15-miles] It was n’t for _ [me]0-i _ to help [him]15-miles — it was for the thing [I]0-i had met !

Something in [his]15-miles tone and the expression of [his]15-miles face , as [I]0-i got this from [him]15-miles , set [my]0-i heart aching with such a pang as it had never yet known ; so unutterably touching was it to see [his]15-miles little brain puzzled and [his]15-miles little resources taxed to play , under the spell laid on [him]15-miles , a part of innocence and consistency . “ No , never — from the hour [you]15-miles came back . [You]15-miles ’ve never mentioned to [me]0-i [one of [[your]15-miles masters]1306-your masters]1305-one of your masters , [one of [[your]15-miles comrades]1308-your comrades]1307-one of your comrades , nor the least little thing that ever happened to [you]15-miles at [school]313-school . Never , [little Miles]15-miles — no , never — have [you]15-miles given [me]0-i an inkling of anything that _ may _ have happened there . Therefore [you]15-miles can fancy how much [I]0-i ’m in the dark . Until [you]15-miles came out , that way , this morning , [you]15-miles had , since the first hour [I]0-i saw [you]15-miles , scarce even made a reference to anything in [your]15-miles previous life . [You]15-miles seemed so perfectly to accept the present . ”[0-i] It was extraordinary how [my]0-i absolute conviction of [his]802-you secret precocity ( or whatever [I]0-i might call the poison of an influence that [I]0-i dared but half to phrase ) made [him]802-you , in spite of the faint breath of [his]802-you inward trouble , appear as accessible as [an older person]803-an older person — imposed [him]802-you almost as [an intellectual equal]804-an intellectual equal . “ [I]804-an intellectual equal thought [you]15-miles wanted to go on as [you]15-miles are . ”[804-an intellectual equal]

It struck [me]0-i that at this [he]802-you just faintly colored . [He]802-you gave , at any rate , like a convalescent slightly fatigued , a languid shake of [his]802-you head . “ [I]802-you don’t — [I]802-you do n’t . [I]802-you want to get away . ”[802-you]

“ [You]802-you ’re tired of [Bly]13-bly ? ”[802-you]

“ Oh , no , [I]802-you like [Bly]13-bly . ”[802-you]

“ Well , then — ? ”[802-you]

“ Oh , _ [you]15-miles _ know what [a boy]1267-a boy wants ! ”[802-you]

[I]0-i felt that [I]0-i did n’t know so well as [Miles]15-miles , and [I]0-i took temporary refuge . “ [You]802-you want to go to [[your]802-you uncle]1265-your uncle ? ”[0-i]

Again , at this , with [his]802-you sweet ironic face , [he]802-you made a movement on the pillow . “ Ah , [you]802-you ca n’t get off with that ! ”[802-you]

[I]0-i was silent a little , and it was [I]0-i , now , [I]0-i think , who changed color . “ [[My]0-i dear]1145-my dear , [I]0-i do n’t want to get off ! ”[0-i]

“ [You]802-you ca n’t , even if [you]802-you do . [You]802-you ca n’t , [you]802-you can’t!”—he[802-you] lay beautifully staring . “ [[My]802-you uncle]1264-my uncle must come down , and [you]802-you must completely settle things . ”[802-you]

“ If [we]1314-we do , ”[0-i] [I]0-i returned with some spirit , “ [you]805-him may be sure it will be to take [you]805-him quite away . ”[0-i]

“ Well , do n’t [you]805-him understand that that ’s exactly what [I]0-i ’m working for ? [You]805-him ’ll have to tell [him]1264-my uncle — about the way [you]805-him ’ve let it all drop : [you]805-him ’ll have to tell [him]1264-my uncle a tremendous lot ! ”[0-i]

The exultation with which [he]805-him uttered this helped [me]0-i somehow , for the instant , to meet [him]805-him rather more . “ And how much will _ [you]0-i _ , [Miles]15-miles , have to tell [him]1264-my uncle ? There are things [he]1264-my uncle ’ll ask [you]0-i ! ”[805-him]

[He]805-him turned it over . “ Very likely . But what things ? ”[805-him]

“ The things [you]0-i ’ve never told [me]805-him . To make up [his]1264-my uncle mind what to do with [you]0-i . [He]1264-my uncle ca n’t send [you]0-i back — ”[805-him]

“ Oh , [I]805-him do n’t want to go back ! ”[805-him] [he]805-him broke in . “ [I]805-him want [a new field]1315-a new field . ”[805-him]

[He]805-him said it with admirable serenity , with positive unimpeachable gaiety ; and doubtless it was that very note that most evoked for [me]0-i the poignancy , the unnatural childish tragedy , of [his]805-him probable reappearance at the end of three months with all this bravado and still more dishonor . It overwhelmed [me]0-i now that [I]0-i should never be able to bear that , and it made [me]0-i let [myself]0-i go . [I]0-i threw [myself]0-i upon [him]805-him and in the tenderness of [my]0-i pity [I]0-i embraced [him]805-him . “ [Dear little Miles]15-miles , [dear little Miles]15-miles — ! ”[0-i]

[My]0-i face was close to [his]805-him , and [he]805-him let [me]0-i kiss [him]805-him , simply taking it with indulgent good humor . “ Well , [old lady]1316-old lady ? ”[805-him]

“ Is there nothing — nothing at all that [you]0-i want to tell [me]805-him ? ”[805-him]

[He]805-him turned off a little , facing round toward the wall and holding up [his]805-him hand to look at as [one]94-one had seen [sick children]807-sick children look . “ [I]805-him ’ve told [you]0-i — [I]805-him told [you]0-i this morning . ”[805-him]

Oh , [I]0-i was sorry for [him]805-him ! “ That [you]0-i just want [me]0-i not to worry [you]0-i ? ”[0-i]

[He]805-him looked round at [me]0-i now , as if in recognition of [my]0-i understanding [him]805-him ; then ever so gently , “ To let [me]805-him alone , ”[805-him] [he]805-him replied .

There was even a singular little dignity in it , something that made [me]0-i release [him]805-him , yet , when [I]0-i had slowly risen , linger beside [him]805-him . God knows [I]0-i never wished to harass [him]805-him , but [I]0-i felt that merely , at this , to turn [my]0-i back on [him]805-him was to abandon or , to put it more truly , to lose [him]805-him . “ [I]0-i ’ve just begun a letter to [[your]805-him uncle]1265-your uncle , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said .

“ Well , then , finish it ! ”[0-i]

[I]0-i waited a minute . “ What happened before ? ”[0-i]

[He]805-him gazed up at [me]0-i again . “ Before what ? ”[805-him]

“ Before [you]0-i came back . And before [you]0-i went away . ”[805-him]

For some time [he]805-him was silent , but [he]805-him continued to meet [my]0-i eyes . “ What happened ? ”[805-him]

It made [me]0-i , the sound of the words , in which it seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i caught for the very first time a small faint quaver of consenting consciousness — it made [me]0-i drop on [my]0-i knees beside the bed and seize once more the chance of possessing [him]805-him . “ [Dear little Miles]15-miles , [dear little Miles]15-miles , if [you]15-miles _ knew _ how [I]0-i want to help [you]15-miles ! It ’s only that , it ’s nothing but that , and [I]0-i ’d rather die than give [you]15-miles a pain or do [you]15-miles a wrong — [I’d]0-i rather die than hurt a hair of [you]15-miles . [Dear little Miles”—oh]39-dear little miles”—oh[0-i] , [I]0-i brought it out now even if [I]0-i _ should _ go too far—“I just want [you]15-miles to help [me]0-i to save [you]15-miles ! ”[0-i] But [I]0-i knew in a moment after this that [I]0-i had gone too far . The answer to [my]0-i appeal was instantaneous , but it came in the form of an extraordinary blast and chill , a gust of frozen air , and a shake of [the room]56-the room as great as if , in the wild wind , the casement had crashed in . [The boy]1078-the boy gave a loud , high shriek , which , lost in the rest of the shock of sound , might have seemed , indistinctly , though [I]0-i was so close to [him]1078-the boy , a note either of jubilation or of terror . [I]0-i jumped to [my]0-i feet again and was conscious of darkness . So for a moment [we]810-we remained , while [I]0-i stared about [me]0-i and saw that the drawn curtains were unstirred and the window tight . “ Why , the candle ’s out ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i then cried .

“ It was [I]15-miles who blew it , [dear]1179-dear ! ”[15-miles] said [Miles]15-miles .

XVIII

The next day , after lessons , [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose found a moment to say to [me]0-i quietly : “ Have [you]0-i written , [miss]1042-miss ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Yes — [I’ve]0-i written . ”[14-mrs. grose] But [I]0-i did n’t add — for the hour — that [my]0-i letter , sealed and directed , was still in [my]0-i pocket . There would be time enough to send it before [the messenger]811-the messenger should go to [the village]336-the village . Meanwhile there had been , on the part of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils , no more brilliant , more exemplary morning . It was exactly as if [they]168-my pupils had both had at heart to gloss over any recent little friction . [They]168-my pupils performed the dizziest feats of arithmetic , soaring quite out of _ [my]0-i _ feeble range , and perpetrated , in higher spirits than ever , geographical and historical jokes . It was conspicuous of course in [Miles]15-miles in particular that [he]15-miles appeared to wish to show how easily [he]15-miles could let [me]0-i down . [This child]814-this child , to [my]0-i memory , really lives in a setting of beauty and misery that no words can translate ; there was a distinction all [his]15-miles own in every impulse [he]15-miles revealed ; never was [a small natural creature , to the uninitiated eye all frankness and freedom]815-a small natural creature , to the uninitiated eye all frankness and freedom , [a more ingenious , a more extraordinary little gentleman]816-a more ingenious , a more extraordinary little gentleman . [I]0-i had perpetually to guard against the wonder of contemplation into which [my]0-i initiated view betrayed [me]0-i ; to check the irrelevant gaze and discouraged sigh in which [I]0-i constantly both attacked and renounced the enigma of what [such a little gentleman]817-such a little gentleman could have done that deserved a penalty . Say that , by the dark prodigy [I]0-i knew , the imagination of all evil _ had _ been opened up to [him]15-miles : all the justice within [me]0-i ached for the proof that it could ever have flowered into an act .

[He]15-miles had never , at any rate , been such [a little gentleman]818-a little gentleman as when , after [our]819-our early dinner on this dreadful day , [he]15-miles came round to [me]0-i and asked if [I]0-i should n’t like [him]15-miles , for half an hour , to play to [me]0-i . [David]40-david playing to [Saul]41-saul could never have shown a finer sense of the occasion . It was literally a charming exhibition of tact , of magnanimity , and quite tantamount to [his]15-miles saying outright : “ [The true knights [we]819-our love to read about]1320-the true knights we love to read about never push an advantage too far . [I]15-miles know what [you]0-i mean now : [you]0-i mean that — to be let alone [yourself]0-i and not followed up — [you’ll]0-i cease to worry and spy upon [me]15-miles , wo n’t keep [me]15-miles so close to [you]0-i , will let [me]15-miles go and come . Well , [I]15-miles ‘ come , ’ [you]0-i see — but [I]15-miles do n’t go ! There ’ll be plenty of time for that . [I]15-miles do really delight in [your]0-i society , and [I]15-miles only want to show [you]0-i that [I]15-miles contended for a principle . ”[15-miles] It may be imagined whether [I]0-i resisted this appeal or failed to accompany [him]820-he again , hand in hand , to [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom . [He]820-he sat down at the old piano and played as [he]820-he had never played ; and if there are those who think [he]820-he had better have been kicking a football [I]0-i can only say that [I]0-i wholly agree with [them]822-them . For at the end of a time that under [his]820-he influence [I]0-i had quite ceased to measure , [I]0-i started up with a strange sense of having literally slept at [[my]0-i post]823-my post . It was after luncheon , and by the schoolroom fire , and yet [I]0-i had n’t really , in the least , slept : [I]0-i had only done something much worse — [I]0-i had forgotten . Where , all this time , was [Flora]16-flora ? When [I]0-i put the question to [Miles]15-miles , [he]820-he played on a minute before answering and then could only say : “ Why , [[my]820-he dear]1145-my dear , how do _ [I]820-he _ know?”—breaking[820-he] moreover into a happy laugh which , immediately after , as if it were a vocal accompaniment , [he]820-he prolonged into incoherent , extravagant song .

[I]0-i went straight to [[my]0-i room]177-my room , but [[his]820-he sister]425-his sister was not [there]1025-there ; then , before going [downstairs]182-downstairs , [I]0-i looked into several others . As [she]425-his sister was nowhere about [she]425-his sister would surely be with [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , whom , in the comfort of that theory , [I]0-i accordingly proceeded in quest of . [I]0-i found [her]425-his sister where [I]0-i had found [her]425-his sister the evening before , but [she]425-his sister met [my]0-i quick challenge with blank , scared ignorance . [She]425-his sister had only supposed that , after the repast , [I]0-i had carried off both [the children]1088-the children ; as to which [she]425-his sister was quite in [her]425-his sister right , for it was the very first time [I]0-i had allowed [the little girl]125-the little girl out of [my]0-i sight without some special provision . Of course now indeed [she]425-his sister might be with [the maids]830-the maids , so that the immediate thing was to look for [her]425-his sister without an air of alarm . This [we]831-we promptly arranged between [us]831-we ; but when , ten minutes later and in pursuance of [our]831-we arrangement , [we]831-we met in [the hall]78-the hall , it was only to report on either side that after guarded inquiries [we]831-we had altogether failed to trace [her]425-his sister . For a minute there , apart from observation , [we]831-we exchanged mute alarms , and [I]0-i could feel with what high interest [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend returned [me]0-i all those [I]0-i had from the first given [her]425-his sister .

“ [She]425-his sister ’ll be above , ”[219-my friend] [she]219-my friend presently said—“in [one of [the rooms [you]0-i have n’t searched]1323-the rooms you have n’t searched]1322-one of the rooms you have n’t searched . ”[219-my friend]

“ No ; [she]425-his sister ’s at a distance . ”[0-i] [I]0-i had made up [my]0-i mind . “ [She]425-his sister has gone out . ”[0-i]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose stared . “ Without a hat ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

[I]0-i naturally also looked volumes . “ Is n’t [that woman]1229-that woman always without one ? ”[0-i]

“ [She]425-his sister ’s with _ [her]425-his sister ? _ ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [She]425-his sister ’s with _ [her]425-his sister ! _ ”[0-i] [I]0-i declared . “ [We]1325-we must find [them]1326-they . ”[0-i]

[My]0-i hand was on [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend ’s arm , but [she]219-my friend failed for the moment , confronted with such an account of the matter , to respond to [my]0-i pressure . [She]219-my friend communed , on the contrary , on the spot , with [her]219-my friend uneasiness . “ And where ’s [Master Miles]15-miles ? ”[219-my friend]

“ Oh , _ [he]15-miles ’s _ with [Quint]22-quint . [They]1326-they ’re in [the schoolroom]85-the schoolroom . ”[219-my friend]

“ [Lord]1328-lord , [miss]1042-miss ! ”[219-my friend] [My]0-i view , [I]0-i was [myself]0-i aware — and therefore [I]0-i suppose [my]0-i tone — had never yet reached so calm an assurance .

“ The trick ’s played , ”[0-i] [I]0-i went on ; “ [they]1326-they ’ve successfully worked [their]1326-they plan . [He]15-miles found the most divine little way to keep [me]0-i quiet while [she]14-mrs. grose went off . ”[0-i]

“ ‘ Divine ’ ? ”[14-mrs. grose] [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose bewilderedly echoed .

“ Infernal , then ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i almost cheerfully rejoined . “ [He]15-miles has provided for [himself]15-miles as well . But come ! ”[0-i]

[She]14-mrs. grose had helplessly gloomed at [the upper regions]835-the upper regions . “ [You]0-i leave [him]15-miles — ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ So long with [Quint]22-quint ? Yes — [I]14-mrs. grose do n’t mind that now . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[She]14-mrs. grose always ended , at these moments , by getting possession of [my]0-i hand , and in this manner [she]14-mrs. grose could at present still stay [me]0-i . But after gasping an instant at [my]0-i sudden resignation , “ Because of [your]0-i letter ? ”[14-mrs. grose] [she]14-mrs. grose eagerly brought out .

[I]0-i quickly , by way of answer , felt for [my]0-i letter , drew it forth , held it up , and then , freeing [myself]0-i , went and laid it on the great hall table . “ [Luke]42-luke will take it , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said as [I]0-i came back . [I]0-i reached [the house]153-the house door and opened it ; [I]0-i was already on the steps .

[[My]0-i companion]239-my companion still demurred : the storm of the night and the early morning had dropped , but the afternoon was damp and gray . [I]0-i came down to [the drive]355-the drive while [she]14-mrs. grose stood in the doorway . “ [You]0-i go with nothing on ? ”[0-i]

“ What do [I]0-i care when [the child]1015-the child has nothing ? [I]0-i ca n’t wait to dress , ”[0-i] [I]0-i cried , “ and if [you]14-mrs. grose must do so , [I]0-i leave [you]14-mrs. grose . Try meanwhile , [yourself]14-mrs. grose , [upstairs]1331-upstairs . ”[0-i]

“ With _ [them]1332-them ? _ ”[0-i] Oh , on this , [the poor woman]403-the poor woman promptly joined [me]0-i !

XIX

[We]840-we went straight to [the lake]433-the lake , as it was called at [Bly]13-bly , and [I]0-i daresay rightly called , though [I]0-i reflect that it may in fact have been a sheet of water less remarkable than it appeared to [my]0-i untraveled eyes . [My]0-i acquaintance with sheets of water was small , and [the pool of [Bly]13-bly]842-the pool of bly , at all events on the few occasions of [my]0-i consenting , under the protection of [[my]0-i pupils]168-my pupils , to affront [its]842-the pool of bly surface in [the old flat - bottomed boat moored there for [our]840-we use]844-the old flat - bottomed boat moored there for our use , had impressed [me]0-i both with its extent and its agitation . The usual place of embarkation was half a mile from [the house]153-the house , but [I]0-i had an intimate conviction that , wherever [Flora]16-flora might be , [she]16-flora was not near [home]1024-home . [She]16-flora had not given [me]0-i the slip for any small adventure , and , since the day of the very great one that [I]0-i had shared with [her]16-flora by [the pond]439-the pond , [I]0-i had been aware , in [our]840-we walks , of the quarter to which [she]16-flora most inclined . This was why [I]0-i had now given to [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s steps so marked a direction — a direction that made [her]16-flora , when [she]16-flora perceived it , oppose a resistance that showed [me]0-i [she]16-flora was freshly mystified . “ [You]0-i ’re going to [the water]454-the water , [Miss?—you]43-miss?—you think [she]16-flora ’s _ in _ — ? ”[16-flora]

“ [She]16-flora may be , though the depth is , [I]14-mrs. grose believe , nowhere very great . But what [I]14-mrs. grose judge most likely is that [she]16-flora ’s on the spot from which , the other day , [we]840-we saw together what [I]14-mrs. grose told [you]0-i . ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ When [she]16-flora pretended not to see — ? ”[16-flora]

“ With that astounding self - possession ? [I]14-mrs. grose ’ve always been sure [she]16-flora wanted to go back alone . And now [[her]16-flora brother]426-her brother has managed it for [her]16-flora . ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose still stood where [she]16-flora had stopped . “ [You]0-i suppose [they]1335-they really _ talk _ of [them]1335-they ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ [I]16-flora could meet this with a confidence ! [They]1335-they say things that , if [we]840-we heard [them]1335-they , would simply appall [us]840-we . ”[16-flora]

“ And if [she]16-flora _ is _ there — ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Yes ? ”[16-flora]

“ Then [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel is ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

“ Beyond a doubt . [You]0-i shall see . ”[16-flora]

“ Oh , thank [you]0-i ! ”[14-mrs. grose] [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend cried , planted so firm that , taking it in , [I]0-i went straight on without [her]219-my friend . By the time [I]0-i reached [the pool]849-the pool , however , [she]219-my friend was close behind [me]0-i , and [I]0-i knew that , whatever , to [her]219-my friend apprehension , might befall [me]0-i , the exposure of [[my]0-i society]850-my society struck [her]219-my friend as [her]219-my friend least danger . [She]219-my friend exhaled a moan of relief as [we]851-we at last came in sight of [the greater part of [the water]454-the water]852-the greater part of the water without a sight of [the child]1015-the child . There was no trace of [Flora]16-flora on [that nearer side of [the bank]856-the bank]855-that nearer side of the bank where [my]0-i observation of [her]219-my friend had been most startling , and none on [the opposite edge]857-the opposite edge , where , save for a margin of some twenty yards , a thick copse came down to [the water]454-the water . [The pond]439-the pond , oblong in shape , had a width so scant compared to [its]439-the pond length that , with [its]439-the pond ends out of view , [it]439-the pond might have been taken for [a scant river]860-a scant river . [We]851-we looked at [the empty expanse]861-the empty expanse , and then [I]0-i felt the suggestion of [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend ’s eyes . [I]0-i knew what [she]219-my friend meant and [I]0-i replied with a negative headshake .

“ No , no ; wait ! [She]219-my friend has taken [the boat]1336-the boat . ”[0-i]

[[My]0-i companion]239-my companion stared at [the vacant mooring place]864-the vacant mooring place and then again across [the lake]433-the lake . “ Then where is it ? ”[239-my companion]

“ [Our]851-we not seeing it is the strongest of proofs . [She]219-my friend has used it to go over , and then has managed to hide it . ”[219-my friend]

“ All alone — [that child]1337-that child ? ”[239-my companion]

“ [She]219-my friend ’s not alone , and at such times [she]219-my friend ’s not [a child]53-a child : [she]219-my friend ’s [an old , old woman]1339-an old , old woman . ”[0-i] [I]0-i scanned all [the visible shore]866-the visible shore while [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose took again , into the queer element [I]0-i offered [her]219-my friend , one of [her]219-my friend plunges of submission ; then [I]0-i pointed out that [the boat]1336-the boat might perfectly be in a small refuge formed by [one of the recesses of [the pool]849-the pool]868-one of the recesses of the pool , an indentation masked , for the hither side , by a projection of [the bank]856-the bank and by a clump of trees growing close to [the water]454-the water .

“ But if [the boat]1336-the boat ’s there , where on earth ’s _ [she]1336-the boat ? _ ”[223-my colleague] [[my]0-i colleague]223-my colleague anxiously asked .

“ That ’s exactly what [we]1341-we must learn . ”[0-i] And [I]0-i started to walk further .

“ By going all the way round ? ”[0-i]

“ Certainly , far as it is . It will take [us]1341-we but ten minutes , but it ’s far enough to have made [the child]1015-the child prefer not to walk . [She]1336-the boat went straight over . ”[0-i]

“ Laws ! ”[219-my friend] cried [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend again ; the chain of [my]0-i logic was ever too much for [her]219-my friend . It dragged [her]219-my friend at [my]0-i heels even now , and when [we]874-we had got halfway round — a devious , tiresome process , on ground much broken and by a path choked with overgrowth — [I]0-i paused to give [her]219-my friend breath . [I]0-i sustained [her]219-my friend with a grateful arm , assuring [her]219-my friend that [she]219-my friend might hugely help [me]0-i ; and this started [us]874-we afresh , so that in the course of but few minutes more [we]874-we reached a point from which [we]874-we found [the boat]1336-the boat to be where [I]0-i had supposed it . [It]1336-the boat had been intentionally left as much as possible out of sight and was tied to one of the stakes of a fence that came , just there , down to the brink and that had been an assistance to disembarking . [I]0-i recognized , as [I]0-i looked at the pair of short , thick oars , quite safely drawn up , the prodigious character of the feat for [a little girl]160-a little girl ; but [I]0-i had lived , by this time , too long among wonders and had panted to too many livelier measures . There was a gate in the fence , through which [we]874-we passed , and that brought [us]874-we , after a trifling interval , more into the open . Then , “ There [she]16-flora is ! ”[874-we] [we]874-we both exclaimed at once .

[Flora]16-flora , a short way off , stood before [us]874-we on the grass and smiled as if [her]16-flora performance was now complete . The next thing [she]16-flora did , however , was to stoop straight down and pluck — quite as if it were all [she]16-flora was there for — a big , ugly spray of withered fern . [I]0-i instantly became sure [she]16-flora had just come out of the copse . [She]16-flora waited for [us]874-we , not [herself]16-flora taking a step , and [I]0-i was conscious of the rare solemnity with which [we]874-we presently approached [her]16-flora . [She]16-flora smiled and smiled , and [we]874-we met ; but it was all done in a silence by this time flagrantly ominous . [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose was the first to break the spell : [she]14-mrs. grose threw [herself]14-mrs. grose on [her]14-mrs. grose knees and , drawing [the child]1015-the child to [her]14-mrs. grose breast , clasped in a long embrace the little tender , yielding body . While this dumb convulsion lasted [I]0-i could only watch it — which [I]0-i did the more intently when [I]0-i saw [Flora]16-flora ’s face peep at [me]0-i over [[our]874-we companion]192-our companion ’s shoulder . It was serious now — the flicker had left it ; but it strengthened the pang with which [I]0-i at that moment envied [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose the simplicity of _ [her]14-mrs. grose _ relation . Still , all this while , nothing more passed between [us]874-we save that [Flora]16-flora had let [her]16-flora foolish fern again drop to the ground . What [she]14-mrs. grose and [I]0-i had virtually said to [each other]284-each other was that pretexts were useless now . When [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose finally got up [she]14-mrs. grose kept [the child]1015-the child ’s hand , so that [the two]881-the two were still before [me]0-i ; and the singular reticence of [our]874-we communion was even more marked in the frank look [she]14-mrs. grose launched [me]0-i . “ [I]14-mrs. grose ’ll be hanged , ”[14-mrs. grose] it said , “ if _ [I]14-mrs. grose ’ll _ speak ! ”[14-mrs. grose]

It was [Flora]16-flora who , gazing all over [me]0-i in candid wonder , was the first . [She]16-flora was struck with [our]874-we bareheaded aspect . “ Why , where are [your]16-flora things ? ”[16-flora]

“ Where [yours]16-flora are , [[my]0-i dear]1145-my dear ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i promptly returned .

[She]16-flora had already got back [her]16-flora gaiety , and appeared to take this as an answer quite sufficient . “ And where ’s [Miles]15-miles ? ”[16-flora] [she]16-flora went on .

There was something in the small valor of it that quite finished [me]0-i : these three words from [her]16-flora were , in a flash like the glitter of a drawn blade , the jostle of the cup that [my]0-i hand , for weeks and weeks , had held high and full to the brim that now , even before speaking , [I]0-i felt overflow in a deluge . “ [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]16-flora if [you]16-flora ’ll tell _ [me]0-i _ — ”[0-i] [I]0-i heard [myself]0-i say , then heard the tremor in which it broke .

“ Well , what ? ”[14-mrs. grose]

[Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s suspense blazed at [me]0-i , but it was too late now , and [I]0-i brought the thing out handsomely . “ Where , [[my]0-i pet]1344-my pet , is [Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel ? ”[0-i]

[XX]44-xx

Just as in [the churchyard with [Miles]15-miles]882-the churchyard with miles , the whole thing was upon [us]883-us . Much as [I]0-i had made of the fact that this name had never once , between [us]883-us , been sounded , the quick , smitten glare with which [the child]1015-the child ’s face now received it fairly likened [my]0-i breach of the silence to the smash of a pane of glass . It added to the interposing cry , as if to stay the blow , that [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , at the same instant , uttered over [my]0-i violence — the shriek of a creature scared , or rather wounded , which , in turn , within a few seconds , was completed by a gasp of [my]0-i own . [I]0-i seized [[my]0-i colleague]223-my colleague ’s arm . “ [She]28-miss jessel ’s there , [she]28-miss jessel ’s there ! ”[0-i]

[Miss Jessel]28-miss jessel stood before [us]883-us on the opposite bank exactly as [she]28-miss jessel had stood the other time , and [I]0-i remember , strangely , as the first feeling now produced in [me]0-i , [my]0-i thrill of joy at having brought on a proof . [She]28-miss jessel was there , and [I]0-i was justified ; [she]28-miss jessel was there , and [I]0-i was neither cruel nor mad . [She]28-miss jessel was there for [poor scared Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose , but [she]28-miss jessel was there most for [Flora]16-flora ; and no moment of [my]0-i monstrous time was perhaps so extraordinary as that in which [I]0-i consciously threw out to [her]28-miss jessel — with the sense that , pale and ravenous demon as [she]28-miss jessel was , [she]28-miss jessel would catch and understand it — an inarticulate message of gratitude . [She]28-miss jessel rose erect on the spot [[my]0-i friend]219-my friend and [I]0-i had lately quitted , and there was not , in all the long reach of [her]28-miss jessel desire , an inch of [her]28-miss jessel evil that fell short . This first vividness of vision and emotion were things of a few seconds , during which [Mrs. Grose]14-mrs. grose ’s dazed blink across to where [I]0-i pointed struck [me]0-i as a sovereign sign that [she]14-mrs. grose too at last saw , just as it carried [my]0-i own eyes precipitately to [the child]1015-the child . The revelation then of the manner in which [Flora]16-flora was affected startled [me]0-i , in truth , far more than it would have done to find [her]28-miss jessel also merely agitated , for direct dismay was of course not what [I]0-i had expected . Prepared and on [her]28-miss jessel guard as [our]888-our pursuit had actually made [her]28-miss jessel , [she]28-miss jessel would repress every betrayal ; and [I]0-i was therefore shaken , on the spot , by [my]0-i first glimpse of the particular one for which [I]0-i had not allowed .
